loans.name: Dudu

texts.en:
Dudu H. currently sells bread and is requesting a loan to open up a backery for high production of bread to sell. Dudu is 30 years old, married to a peaant and has three children who all go to school at Munuki primary school.  With the extra profits in future from her loan, she hopes to be able to produce more bread for sale

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: open up a backery

loans.name: Chetra

texts.en:
Mr. Chetra M., 22 (shown in the picture), and his wife, Mrs. Sreynoch Yun, 19, were married in 2007 and just have a one year old daughter. They live along national road number one apporximetely15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Chetra has a motorbike and bicycle repairer for one year, while his wife a scarf weaver for five years. He is able to earn 15,000 riel to 20,000 riel (about 3.75 USD to 5 USD) per day. Now, Chetra is a asking for his first loan of $500 he will use the loan to purchase motorbike and bicycle spare parts for his business.

loans.use: To purchase motorbike and bicycle spare parts for his motorbike repairing business.

loans.name: Qory Orcco - Pucyura Group

texts.es:
Los miembros del banco comunal “QORY ORCCO – PUCYURA”, están situados en el distrito de Anta en la provincia de Cusco; este banco está conformado por 10 miembros activos, estuvo ausente el señor Genaro, debido a un un problema de salud.

Nuestros socios tienen como primera actividad la agricultura y la ganadería y complementan a esto el comercio minorista, muchos de los socios tienen sus diferentes negocios, un socio tienen su grifo, otro tiene su taxi, otros tienen su empresa de bloquetas y algunos trabajan en ellas, otro tiene su mina de donde extrae piedras, otros tienen tiendas abarrotes y otros se dedican a la agricultura y la ganadería y sus derivados.

Nuestros socios agradecen y valoran el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank “QORY ORCCO – PUCYURA” live in the district of Anta in the province of Cusco. The group consists of 10 active members. Sr. Genaro was absent at the time the photo was taken due to health problems.

Our members are mainly involved in agriculture and livestock. However, they also have various side businesses to help supplement their income. Some examples of their businesses include running a tavern, driving a taxi, managing a brick making business (which employs some of the members), extracting stones from a quarry, and selling groceries.

Our members appreciate and value the loan they have received. They promise to make their payments at the established times.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their agricultural, livestock, and commercial businesses

loans.name: Christine's Group

texts.en:
(In the small photo, Christine was not in the group photo but a member of the group)
B. Christine is the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She is 25 years old and married with 1 child aged 3 years and in Nursery section as she takes care of her siblings. She is a tailor in Nakazadde and it’s the competition that enables her to succeed since she knows what she is doing. Before the tailoring business, she had a video library and changed two years ago and she is not regretting. She is able to make 30,000/= as profits a week and she hopes this will increase more because of the quality work she does. Christine has a dream of becoming a supplier of sewing machines as well as building a residential house for her children. She needs a loan to help add more capital in her business by buying more clothing materials for a steady supply. Christine is such a hard working and determined lady and I believe she will make it in future.

loans.use: Recapitalising her tailoring business with more clothing materials.

loans.name: Olga Lidia

texts.es: La señora Olga Lidia es una señora la cual quedo viuda y ha sido una mujer que ha tenido que luchar para salir adelante con sus hijos siendo madre y padre al mismo tiempo. Ella siempre ha tratado de tener un hogar cómodo y agradable para su familia, y hoy solicita este crédito para realizarle algunas mejoras en su hogar tales como acabados interiores e instalaciones eléctricas para mayor seguridad, porque representan un peligro el tener el cableado fuera de sus instalaciones correspondientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Olga Lidia is a woman who is widowed and has been a woman that has had to fight to get ahead with her children, being the mother and the father at the same time. She has always tried to have a comfortable and pleasant home for her family, and today she asks for a loan to make some improvements in her home such as finishing the interior and electrical sockets for better safety, because they present a danger with the electrical cables exposed.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finished interior and electrical sockets.

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en: Wissam is  34 years old and lives in Beirut, capital of Lebanon, where he owns and runs a grocery store. He sells canned food, candies, drinks and many other items, and enjoys running his own business. Wissam has lots of experience in this line of work, and his customers are almost all friends and neighbors. He has applied for a loan from Al Majmoua to buy more items to sell from his store. This is the third loan he has applied for; he paid the first two fully, and on time. In the future, he plans to expand his store.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to sell from his store.

loans.name: Taufaiesea

texts.en:
Taufaiesea L. is a 43-year-old woman who lives in the town of Samalaeulu Leauvaa. She is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Taufaiesea sells dairy products in the local community. Taufaiesea has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 280 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Taufaiesea joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Taufaiesea has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. She used her previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell. Taufaiesea is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST to expand her business. This will be Taufaiesea's 3rd loan from SPBD. Taufaiesea plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma P.'s main source of income comes from selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in her community. She is 45 years old, widowed and has four school-age children. They are from the town of Alicia, Isabela. Vilma has been in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Vilma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Vilma is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use additional revenue to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Esther Peregrina

texts.es:
La señora ESTHER tiene 48 años, vive en el distrito deL PORVENIR, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal UNIDAS POR SIEMPRE II. La socia presenta estudios  hasta 5to de secundaria.  Está separada de su esposo y tiene 4 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica a la venta de carne que trae de la sierra.
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles pudo viajar a la sierra a traer carne de res y cerdo para vender.  Con este crédito de 1,000.00 nuevos soles lo utilizará, también, para comprar más carne de res y cerdo. Ella sueña con aumentar sus ventas y obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
ESTHER, 48, lives in the PORVENIR district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She is a member of the UNIDAS POR SIEMPRE II communal bank. She finished 11th grade, is separated from her husband, and has 4 children who are dependent on her. She sells meat that she brings from the mountains. With her first, 300 new sol, loan she traveled to the mountains to get beef and pork to sell. With this new, 1000 new sol, loan she will buy more beef and pork. She dreams with increasing her sales to make higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beef and pork.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora  es socia del Banco Comunal Tulipanes.
Flora es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 1 hija, Flora vende sandalias por mayor, sus productos los reparte en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho y Huanta, además Flora tiene un carro que realiza transporte de pasajeros a las ciudades de la Selva Ayacuchana.
Flora necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de sandalias.
Los sueños de Flora es tener una tienda de sandalias y que sus hijos salgan adelante.
texts.en:
Flora is a member of the Communal Bank “Tulipanes” (Tulips). She is 33 years old, in a common law marriage, and has a daughter.

Flora is a wholesale retailer of sandals. She sells her products at the markets in the cities of Ayacucho and Huanta. In addition, Flora has a car that is used for transporting passengers among the cities in the Ayacuchan jungle.

Flora is requesting a loan of 1050 soles to purchase more sandals. She dreams of having a store where she can sell her sandals and seeing her children get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sandals

loans.name: Null

texts.en:
Mr. Null S. S. O. is single and is a villager in Sdau Kanlaeng village in Kandal province. He is a pig breeder and aside from that he is a wine maker.

Since his business is going well Mr. Null S. S. O. wants expand it. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice to make wine to sell. The rest of the loan he would use to buy pig feed to support his pig breeding business.

Mr. Null S. S. O. hopes to increase his income and improve his living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy more rice to make wine to sell and feed for his pigs

loans.name: Toribio Gustavo

texts.es: EL señor TORIVIO GUSTAVO R. G.labora como vigilante para Universidad Popular y es primer crédito que trabaja con CEPRODEL esta vez lo solicita para ayudar a su esposa en su pequeño negocio de venta de tortillas, compraría maíz, leña. Para incrementar sus ingresos y poder salir adelante se siente contento con CEPRODEL  por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Torivio Gustavo R. G.works as a guard for the Universidad Popular. This is his first loan working with Ceprodel. He is requesting a loan to help his wife in her small business of selling tortillas. He will buy corn and firewood. He will do this to increase their earnings and to be able to get ahead. He is happy about the help offered by Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains and supplies for his wife's business

loans.name: Eloisa

texts.en:
Eloisa is a married mother of four children. Her husband is a construction worker (laborer) in the community, while she manager her own buy-and-sell business to provide additional income for the family. Eloisa is a hard working entrepreneur who has been in business for almost three years.

Eloisa would like to receive a loan as working capital for her business to buy raw materials like aluminum steel for windows and doors, and a glass. A proud member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) (a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines) since 2006, Eloisa has been a dedicated member demonstrating regular attendance to weekly meetings and steady repayments on previous loans.

Her long-term goal that soon is to have an expanded business. Also, she hopes the profits from her business will fund the continued education for all four children. With the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders, Eloisa is determined to achieve business success to build more long-term financial security for herself and her family.

About ASHI: Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To fund raw materials like aluminum steel for windows and doors, and a glass.

loans.name: Dieynaba

texts.fr: Dieynaba D. est une femme de 54 ans, elle est veuve et vit avec ses 3 enfants dont elle a l'entière charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DAROU-KHOUDOSS depuis 3ans et demi et y a bénéficié de 7 prêts. Elle développe un petit commerce de légumes, d'épices et de bouillons. Elle vend ses produits sur étalage au marché de son quartier. Son objectif est de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants et de leurs assurer un bien-être familiale.
texts.en:
Dieynaba D. is a 54-year-old woman, a widow who lives with her three children whom she supports by herself. She has been a member of the "Banc Villegeois" of Darou-Khoudoss for three and a half years, and she has received seven loans. She is building a small business selling vegetables, spices, and bouillons (dried soup stock). She sells her products on shelves at her neighborhood market. Her goal is to meet her children's needs and ensure her family's well-being.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build her investment capital

loans.name: Irshad's Group

texts.en: Irshad is a citizen of the city of Borewala, Pakistan, which is famous for its shrines. Her husband, L. A., has a medicine-selling business. To earn income, he obtains order from pharmacies. Irshad is applying for a loan to start their own medical shop. They will buy medicines for resale to earn a good profit.

loans.use: To start a medical store

loans.name: Carmelitas Group

texts.es:
“Carmelitas” es un grupo de 7 señoras y 1 varón que asisten a sus reuniones en el Centro Focal “Villa Tejada”,  este es su noveno ciclo. Se agruparon por la necesidad de mejorar y ampliar sus negocios y de esta manera acceder al préstamo y beneficiarse todas. 
Un ejemplo claro es Marcela R. de 34 años casada y madre de dos niños, con el pasar del tiempo logró estabilizar y mejorar su taller de mecánica, que juntamente con su esposo logró encaminar este negocio y generar fuentes de empleo, así como diversificar sus productos ya que actualmente ofrece a sus clientes grasas para lubricar a las movilidades. Entonces el préstamo de Bs.- 3000 lo invertira en la compra de grasas. 
A Marcela le gusta el ahorro y el compartir con sus amigas de su Asociación.
Las demás integrantes tienen diversos negocios que se dedican a comercio, producción y servicio. Todas desean el préstamo para mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
“Carmelitas” is a group of 7 women and a man, they go to meetings in the hub of “Villa Tejada,” this will be their ninth loan. They became a group due to the need to improve and increase their businesses and to get a loan to benefit them all.

A clear example is Marcela R., who is 34 years old, married and a mother to 2 children. With some time she was able to establish and improve her mechanic shop that she was able to establish with her husband. The business is a source of work and they were able to diversify their products and serve their customers, currently she offers oil to lubricate the vehicles. The loan is of Bs.- 3000 and will be used to buy oil.

Marcela enjoys saving and sharing with her friends in her group.

The other members have different businesses; they sell merchandize, produce goods and services. They all want the loan to improve their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandize.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice S. sells fish and tomatoes at the market and is requesting a loan to stock onions to sell.  Alice is 40 years-old and is married with a husband that is a cattle keeper. She has four  children and her children do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

Kiva partner BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: To buy onions to sell.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame Fatoumata Traoré est âgée  de 40 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle vit dans une famille polygame avec son époux, ses deux coépouses et leurs enfants dans le quartier  Médina coura de la ville de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). 
N’ayant pas eu la chance de faire de brillantes études, elle a embrassé les activités génératrices de revenus depuis son jeune âge qu’elle apprit auprès de sa maman. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus, elle opta finalement pour l’achat vente du bois de chauffe.
Avec une expérience de 20 ans dans  ce créneau, elle est très sollicitée et peut vendre  plusieurs chargements  de camions en bois de chauffe dans la semaine. 
Pour  l’agrandissement de son activité,  Madame Fatoumata a fait  recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  avec qui elle est à son 1er prêt  individuel.  
Avec ce financement elle compte acheter  quatre chargements  de camions en de bois dans les  villages environnants de Koutiala pour les revendre  dans le marché de Koutiala  à une clientèle de femmes et d’hommes  à crédit ou au comptant.  
Elle compte sur un bénéfice de 80.000 FCFA par mois qu’elle utilisera  pour le remboursement de l’échéance du prêt et contribuer aux petites dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatoumata Traoré, age 40, is married and the mother of four children. She lives in a polygamous family with her husband, her two co-spouses and their children, in the Médina Coura neighborhood in the town of Koutiala (Sikasso Region). Not having had the chance to pursue brilliant studies, she's been earning money since her youth, which she learned from her mother. After trying several businesses, she finally settled for buying and selling firewood. With 20 years of experience in this market, she's very much in demand and can sell several truckloads of firewood in one week. To bolster her business, Mrs. Fatoumata turned to Kiva's partner, the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, from which she's seeking her first individual loan. With this loan, she intends to buy four truckloads of firewood in the villages surrounding Koutiala, in order to resell them at the market in Koutiala, on credit or for cash, to a clientele comprising both men and women. She intends to turn a monthly profit of XOF 80'000 (ca US$ 150), to be used to repay the loan and contribute to the family's small expenses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn V. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 33 years old, is married, and has a 12-year-old child.

Marlyn owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in farming for several years already.

Marlyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.

Marlyn is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure and gasoline for her tractor. This loan will be her fifth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure and gasoline for her tractor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase chickens & a freezer

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina es socia del Banco Comunal Santa Rita.
Karina es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo de 4 meses, vive en casa alquilada, Karina tiene 2 puestos en el mercado 12 de abril, uno de ellos es de su propiedad, en donde vende ropa variada productos que adquiere en la ciudad de Lima, actividad que realiza junto a su esposo, Karina inicio su negocio hace 3 años como ambulante y ahora tiene puestos estables.
Karina necesita un préstamo de 1800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ladrillos para la construcción de su casa.
Los sueños de Karina son terminar de construir su casa y tener un taller de confección de ropas.
texts.en:
Karina is a partner in the communal bank Santa Rita Karina lives with her partner and she has one son who is four months old. They live in a rented house. Karina has two stalls in the market "12th of April," at one of the stalls she sells a variety of clothing and products that she acquires in the city of Lima, an activity that she does with her husband. Karina began her business three years ago, selling her products on foot and now she has these stalls. Karina needs a loan of 1800 Soles that she will invest in the purchase of bricks for the construction of a house. Karina's dreams are to finish building her house and to have a dress making shop.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bricks for the construcion of her house.

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Sorn S., 23, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. S. grows vegetables, earning an income of $3 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of $4 per day to help cover the family expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike and improve the vegetable-growing business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike and improve the current business

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.es:
La señora Narcisa A.  es casada, vive con su esposo y sus hijos  de 24, 21, 20, y 16 años en casa propia; los hijos mayores son independientes y viven en la zona Pasankeri sur de la ciudad de La Paz.
La señora Narcisa A. se dedica a tejer chompas y vender salchipapas y el esposo es albañil, así combinana ambas actividades para obtener sus ingresos para el hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de y acabado de obra fina de una habitación donde ellos habitan y mejorar así su calidad de vida.
Es su cuarto crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Sra. Narcisa A. is married and lives with her husband and children (ages 24, 21, 20, and 16) in her own home. Her adult children are independent and live in the Pasankeri District, which is in the southern portion of the city of La Paz. Sra. Narcisa weaves sweaters and sells “salchipapas” (sausages and fried potatoes), while her husband works as a mason. Both of their combined activities enable them to generate household income.

The loan she is requesting will be used to build and make the finishing touches on a room where they can spend time and improve their quality of life. This is her fourth loan and the socioeconomic analysis indicates she has a favorable rating, which qualifies her to access this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish the construction of a room and make the finishing touches

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is widowed with eight children and all of them are in school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.   She changed her business enterprises from piggery  to poultry farming. Victoria operates a poultry farm at her home in Ndeeba Kigaga Zone. She has been in this poultry business for a few months.  She sells to all categories of people but at wholesale only.  Victoria works seven days a week and plans to use this loan to buy more chicks and chicken feeds.    She has no additional income and depends on this job for a living.  Her business challenges include transportation of bags of feeds and chicken from Owino market to her home in Ndeeba and poultry diseases.   

Victoria is aspires to see her business grow big get enough to buy a plot of land and a delivery van.  She decided to work with MCDT because they were giving out timely loans. She resides in and owns a house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her challenges are her monthly expenses, her school fees and food.

loans.use: To more chicken feed and chicks

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es: Soledad, de 52 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y sincera, vive en su casa propia junto a su hijo menor Alan de 23 años, quien siempre la ayuda en el trabajo. La actividad a la que Soledad se dedica es la venta de leña y es muy solicitada por sus clientes. Con 30 años en este negocio desea para el futuro de su trabajo, incrementar la cantidad de leña que tiene para vender y así tener plata para pagar los estudios superiores de su hijo, a quien cuida con mucho amor y siempre se ha preocupado por que no le falte nada. Ella disfruta de conversar con sus clientes y siempre suelta una broma para llevarse mejor con ellos, ya que su principal estrategia de venta es la alegría que le pone a todo lo que hace, lo que menos le gusta es estar molesta y más aun si lo esta cuando vende, ya que no quiere alejar los clientes que ya tiene ganados. Es el octavo crédito con MFP, se siente muy feliz por haberlo obtenido y se ha comprometido a pagarlo con todas las socias de su banco comunal. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más madera para tener una buena reserva en su negocio.
texts.en:
Soledad, 52, is a very hard working, sincere woman. She lives in her own house with her youngest son, Alan, 23, who always helps her with the work. Soledad’s activity is firewood sales; she is highly sought after by her customers. She has been in this business for 30 years and wants for the future to increase the amount of firewood that she has on hand to sell in order to have enough money to pay for her son’s higher education. She has always cared for him lovingly and been concerned that he always has everything he needs. She enjoys chatting with her customers and always has a joke ready to get along with them better since her main sales strategy is the joy she puts into everything she does. What she most dislikes is being upset and more so when she is selling because she doesn’t want to scare her customers away. This is her 8th loan with MFP. She is happy to have gotten it and pledges to repay along with all the members of her communal bank. She will use the requested 2500 new soles to buy more wood in order to have a good reserve supply for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more firewood.

loans.name: Affi

texts.fr: affi est une dame de 42 ans, elle est mariée et a une personne à sa charge, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier de bè qui est quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits d'alimentation générale et de boissons. elle a une ancienneté de 3 ans dans ce commerce et s'approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé; sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. Elle a appelé sa boutique "NIGHT TRAIN". elle voudrait s'approvisionner par l'achat de 2 cartons de Lait, 2 cartons de sardines, 2 cartons de macaroni, des casiers de boissons et divers.
texts.en:
Affi is a 42-year old woman, married with one dependent. She lives with her family in the Bè district, one of the peripheral districts of Lomé. She makes a living by selling general food products and beverages. She has been in this business for 3 years. She stocks up at the big market of Lomé. Her customer base is very diverse. She has named her store “Night train.” She would like to replenish her stock by buying two boxes of milk, two boxes of sardines, two boxes of pasta, some beverage cases etc.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing general food products

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en: Solomon is 26 years old and a member of Jiinuwe Ngando group.  He runs a beauty shop and a mobile-phone money transfer business.  He has been running the business for three years and employs one person.  Faulu Kenya has helped him to manage his business and he has become more focused.  He has requested for 20,000 KES to buy weaves and braids for his beauty shop and float for his mobile-phone money transfer business. He hopes to be the major supplier of beauty products in his locality.

loans.use: To buy weaves and braids for his beauty shop and float for his mobile-phone money transfer business.

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz lives in Khanewal, which is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan, famous for its agricultural industry. She is married to M. Y. who belongs to an agricultural profession. He works in the fields to put three meals on the table for his family. He is a very hard worker growing wheat on his field to sell to customers. Shahnaz shares the financial burden for the family by doing labor works. She is the mother of seven children: five daughters and two sons. All of them are studying except the last three who are of not of school-going age yet.

Shahnaz has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy fertilizer and seed for his field to grow wheat for selling. He has been doing this business for the past 10 years and Shahnaz is hopeful that this investment will be profitable for her husband and, as a result, her family’s standard of living will get better. She is a new loan applicant and hopes it will be a profitable experience for her.  

In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (the Asasah passbook) in her hands is Shahnaz.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for an agricultural business

loans.name: Uestline Group

texts.en:
Rhoda M. is in her mid-50s and is married with four children.  For the past nine years, she has run a shop selling soda, juice and water.  Her shop is open from 7 am to 8 pm.  She makes a fair monthly profit.
  
This will be Rhoda's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used her previous loans to buy drinks and empty crates for her shop and has successfully paid back her loans.  She would like to use her current loan to begin selling kangas (sarongs worn by Swahili women).  Her dream is to travel one day.  

Rhoda will share this loan with her group, Uestline, which has 17 members.  The group members will hold each other accountable in repaying the loan. 

In the photo, Rhoda can be seen first on the left in the second row.

loans.use: To begin selling kangas

loans.name: Mrs. Khoem Sophal Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Seventeen people make up this village bank loan located in Tuol Sang Kha village in Takeo province. All the members have selected Mrs. Khoem S. as the village bank president. She is 31 years old. Each of them will use their portion of the loan for different purposes in order to improve their family's standard of living. 

Mrs. Khoem S. owns a general store in the local village where she is able to earn a large profit to provide for her family. Her husband, Mr. TaR. Kung, is a teacher who gets a low salary to help support his family. Since her business is going well at this time, she wants to expand. She is seeking a loan to buy more groceries to resell. 

She is the mother of two children who are both enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Kantutas Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “KANTUTAS” es uno grupo que inicia su cuarto ciclo en el Centro focal de Panamericana, cuenta con diez integrantes.  La mesa directiva para este ciclo tiene como presidenta a la señora Adela,  como tesorera  a la señora Felisa y como secretaria de actas a la señora Virginia. Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos: comerciante, venta de tucumanas, venta de plásticos y ropa de bebé, tienda de consumo, sastrería,  venta de comida,  artesanía, venta de carteras.

La señora Adela, presidenta de la banca comunal “KANTUTAS” tiene un hogar conformado por su pareja y sus tres hijos.  Con respecto a su negocio  ella  lleva  4 años en el negocio de la venta de plásticos (colgadores, recogedores de basura), inició este emprendimiento siguiendo el ejemplo de su madre quién viaja a la ciudad de Sucre con mercadería, desde hace varios años.  Las compras son realizadas en La Paz y las ventas se realizan en el interior en las ciudades de Sucre y Potosí.   Actualmente solicitó Bs.3000.- para la compra de más mercadería.
Cuando le consultamos qué es lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer ella dice “las reuniones” pues despeja la mente.
texts.en:
The “KANTUTAS” (the national flower of Perú and one of two national flowers of Bolivia) communal bank is a group starting its fourth cycle in Panamericana Focal Center.  It has 10 members.  The governing board this cycle has Adela as President, Felisa as Treasurer and Virginia as Recording Secretary.  The women all have different businesses.  Among them are: merchant, tucumanas (fried cheese turnover) sales, plastics sales, sale of infant wear, grocery store, tailor shop, food sales, crafts, purse sales.

Adela, “KANTUTAS” communal bank President, has a home consisting of her partner and three children.  She has been in the business of selling plastics (hangers, dust bins) for four years.  She started this enterprise following her mother’s example who traversed the city of Sucre with merchandise many years ago.  She makes her purchases in La Paz and her sales are in the interior in the cities of Sucre and Potosí.  She asked for a Bs.3000 loan to buy more merchandise.

When we asked her what she liked best about Pro Mujer she answered: “the meetings” because they clear the mind.

loans.use: To buy hangers, dust pans, hygienics.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita S. is from the village of Gango, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 66 years old, married, and has four adult children. To make a living, Rosita owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Rosita has been engaged in her business for more than four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rosita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the fifth taken out by Rosita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living condition of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Chey

texts.en: Mrs. Chey R. lives in Voat Svay village in Takeo province and she was born in 1958. She is a pig breeder and farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow rice to sell to support her family and she owns an agriculture machine. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand. So to meet this purpose, Mrs. Chey R. is seeking for a loan to buy more piglets and pig food, and rest of the loan she plans to hire farming laborers to harvest rice. She is a widow with three children, one of whom is a student while the other one is employed in garment factory and the other is a pig breeder.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and pig food

loans.name: Asma Muhammad Altaf's Group

texts.en:
Asma lives in a historic city called Multan which is known for its shrines and hot weather. She lives there with her family in the area of Yaqoob town in a two-room brick house. Her husband is a welder by profession and welds spare parts and iron items. His shop is located in the market from where he has been operating his business for the past 10 years. 

Asma helps her husband financially by doing embroidery. Embroidery is a very common business in Multan and most of the ladies do it from their homes. She receives orders from her neighborhood clients and finishes the orders on time to earn an income. She has a son and a daughter. Both are very young and not yet of school-going age. 

Asma has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her husband’s welding business. With the loan, he will purchase another welding machine and hire an assistant which will help him do his business better and offer quality services to his clients. 

Asma hopes that her husband will earn a better income with the help of his improved business conditions after the investment. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. She has established good credit behavior in her previous loan year and never missed a meeting. 
Note: “In the photo, the lady with a raised hand is Asma”.

loans.use: To buy another welding machine for a welding business

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna U. is from the village of Mansabay Bajo. She is 57 years old. Myrna is a widow and has eight adult-aged children. To make a living, Myrna owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $175 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Myrna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. 

Myrna is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 6th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Jeanette De Los Angeles

texts.es: Jeanette De Los Ángeles tiene 41 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de cosméticos. Hace más de 16 años que tiene este negocio, inicio con la ayuda de su familia y por la necesidad de obtener un medio de ingreso necesario tiene 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Ella sale todos los días a ofrecer sus productos, ya que la mayoría de sus clientes le solicitan una gran variedad de materia prima. Jeanette se encuentra muy contenta con este medio de vida y con interactuar con sus clientes y así saber lo que ellos solicitan. El financiamiento es para la compra de lápiz labial, polvos, cremas, tratamientos entre otros.
texts.en: Jeanette is 41 years old and makes her living selling cosmetics. She has been doing this for 16 years and started the business with the help of her family so that she could have an income to care for her 3 children. She goes out to sell her products every day, and most of her clients ask her for a great variety of goods. Jeanette is very happy with this way of life and enjoys interacting with her clients and knowing what sorts of things they will ask her for. The loan is for buying lipstick, powders, creams, treatments, and other products.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Luz Mery

texts.es:
Luz Mery vive con sus dos hijos y junto con ellos se dedican  a la cría de animales y la venta de los mismo, esta labor que por 15 años ha desempeñado es la que le permitido tener el sustento diario para su familia.


Actualmente ella necesita mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y para esto requiere de la compra de mas animales que sean fáciles de vender y que además pueda tener un buen ingreso con la venta de los mismos.
texts.en:
Luz Mery lives with her two children.  Together they raise and sell animals.  She has done this work for 15 years.  It has allowed her to have daily support for her family.

She currently needs to improve her family’s quality of life.  To do so she needs to buy more easy to sell animals.  She will also have a good income from their sale.

loans.use: To buy animals

loans.name: Crispina Moreno's Group

texts.en:
Crispina M. is from the village of Gotocan Daku, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old, married, and has two adult-aged and one school-age child. She is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Crispina M.’s Group. 

To make a living, Crispina plants and harvests corn for sell. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Crispina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC.  

Crispina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be her 6th loan  from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: lto purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina works hard to support five children. Ludivina is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Ludivina requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials for fishing boat repairs.

Ludivina has been in this business for 27 years. Ludivina earns more income with pig fattening.

In the future, Ludivina would like to purchase an additional fishing boat.

loans.use: to purchase materials for fishing boat repairs

loans.name: Todo Lo Puedo En Cristo Group

texts.es:
Rosa siempre quiso ayudar a su esposo  con los gastos del hogar, para eso  se matriculo en un CEO donD. estudio cosmetología mediante la bolsa D. trabajo del lugar  empezó a trabajar  logrando ingresos adicionales por otro lado también se dedico a vender productos D. belleza, en la actualidad ha dejado D. trabajar para otros y lo hace por su propia cuenta ofreciendo sus servicios a domicilio como  peinados, tintes para cabello, maquillaje etc. Rosa se siente feliz por que al trabajar por su cuenta tiene tiempo para sus hijos y no descuidarlos y pueD. distribuir su tiempo D. la mejor manera ahora también se dedica a cuidar niños todos estos ingresos le sirven para apoyar a  uno D. sus hijos que esta en la universidad, su  proyecto para mas adelante es tener su salón D. belleza  y poder ofrecer  toda clase D. servicios D. otro lado su préstamo  actual le servirá para la compra D. tintes y cremas , el mes D. mayo por ser el día D. la madre ella tendrá mucho trabajo, el grupo al cual pertenece se llama“ TODO LO PUEDO EN CRISTO” es un grupo nuevo formado por 10 socias que viven en el Callao – Perú, ella es la presidenta del grupo  cargo que quiere desempeñar D. la mejor manera.

   *ROSA ES LA TERCERA D. LAS SENTADAS.
texts.en:
Rosa has always wanted to help her husband with the household expenses, so she enrolled in a CEO, where she studied cosmetology.  Through the job board, she started to work, earning additional income by also selling beauty products.  Currently she has stopped working for others and works on her own offering her services at home, such as hair cuts, hairy dying, makeup, and more.  Rosa is happy to work for herself because she has time for her children and she can distribute her time in the best way.  She also takes care of children, and all of this income goes to support one of her children who is in college.

Her project in the future is to have her own beauty salon and be able to offer all types of services.  This loan will be used to purchase dyes and creams.  She will have a lot of work in May because of Mother's Day.  

The group that she belongs to is called "Todo Lo Puedo En Cristo" [You Can Do Everything With Christ].  It is a new group formed by ten members who live in Callao, Peru.  Rosa is the president of the group.  She wants to do this job the best she can.

*Rosa is the third person seated.

loans.use: to purchase dyes and hair creams.

loans.name: Ma. Lelebeth

texts.en:
Ma. Lelebeth is a farmer who lives in Trinidad, Bohol. She has been growing rice for five years. Ma. Lelebeth sells her harvest to nearby towns. She works hard to provide for her family. She plans to use her loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

Ma. Lelebeth is 36 years old and is a married woman. She has two children, aged 6 and 10. She hopes for her children to someday finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Joseph Maina

texts.en: Joseph is 35 years old and has operated his retail shop in Naivasha town for the past five years.  He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of the field officers and this will be his third loan.  He repaid all his previous loans in a timely manner.  He plans to use the loan to buy more goods to sell in his retail shop. In the future, Joseph hopes to expand his retail shop to wholesale.

loans.use: To purchase more retail goods to sell

loans.name: Ilyosjon

texts.en: Ilyosjon is a young husband. He is engaged in production of doors and windows. Ilyosjon has been in this business for seven years and he has good experience in this business. This business he learned from a famous master who is from Khujand. Ilyosjon has so many clients who have ordered different fashions of doors and windows from him. Also, he sells his products at the market. Last year, he made a good profit and was able to celebrate his wedding party and repair his house. Today, he would like to purchase wood and dye and expand his business. For this purpose, he requested a loan of 7,000 Tajikistan somoni (TJS). More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy wood and dye.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es: La Sra. Alejandra y su esposo están recién casados y están en espera de su primogénito,  es por este motivo que ellos han pensado en ir acondicionando su hogar y al  mismo tiempo   protegerla  de la inseguridad  de  estos  tiempos,  ya  que   actualmente  su  domicilio  no  cuenta   con  protecciones  y  en  ocasiones  se meten  los  animales a   su  casa,  agradece  el  apoyo  brindado  para  la  realización de  su  proyecto   ya  que  gracias  a  esta  ayuda   podrán  retirarse  a   su trabajo  tranquilamente  y  además podrán  ofrecerle  a su  pequeño  una  mayor  comodidad.
texts.en: Alejandra and her husband are newlyweds and awaiting the birth of their first child. That is why they have planned to fix up their house and also protect against the protect against the present day lack of security.  At this time, their house is unprotected and occasionally animals get into the house. She is thankful for the support given for this project. Thanks to this help, they will able to go to their jobs with no worries and also offer their child a more comfortable home.

loans.use: to install security and a gate in her home.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is a very caring and supportive lady by nature. She spends most of her time at home and manages the household responsibilities. She makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. Besides her household work, she also supports her husband in his dairy business. She takes care of his buffalo by providing food and water as needed. 

Her husband is a very hardworking person. He gets up early in the morning, gets milk from the buffalo and then goes to clients in the community and to milk shops to sell it. In this way, their financial circle goes. 

Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business because now his milk demand is increasing day by day and a single buffalo is looking insufficient to meet the requirement. With the loan, he will buy another buffalo to increase the milk production to take care of his new clients. 

Nasreen is hopeful that the loan investment will prove a productive one for her husband. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nasreen.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for dairy business

loans.name: Erismus

texts.en:
Erismus is a 54-year-old married man with ten children.  They are living in Kamwenge, Uganda.  His family dream is to educate his children up to university level.  

Erismus has been a milk sales man for two years.  His major challenge is late payment by his customers since they pay on a monthly basis.  Erismus needs this loan to buy a milk container that can keep the milk cool for selling.

loans.use: buy a modern milk container to keep milk

loans.name: Jenny Alexandra

texts.es:
En el hermoso balneario de San Jacinto rodeado de una playa hermosa lugar donde el Rio Portoviejo se une con el mar y además visitado por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros. Cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Esperanza Para  Superar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Jenny, tiene 48 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tienen dos hijos de 24 y 13 años de edad, la mayor ya es graduada de la universidad y el menor esta en colegio. Su marido es comerciante. Es parte del Grupo De Crédito hace 6 ciclos y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho en su negocio.

Ella junto a su marido tienen un negocio de compra y venta de pescado y camarón, trabajan todos los días, en la madrugada él se desplaza hasta Puerto López donde  compra a los barcos que llegan hasta la playa  ya que allí le salen más baratos, nos cuenta nuestra amiga que mientras su esposo se encarga de las ventas en otras ciudades ella se encarga de vender ya sea en su casa o entregando a restaurantes y casas por su localidad, son más de 15 años que llevan en el negocio y les ha ido muy bien siempre.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar pescado, camarón, conchas y otros mariscos. 

Sus sueños son tener un gran restaurante ya que a ella le encanta cocinar y lo hace muy bien.
texts.en:
In the beautiful resort town of San Jacinto, surrounded by a beautiful beach, in a place where the Portoviejo River joins the sea and many tourists both national and foreign come to visit, the communal bank Esperanza Para Superar [Hope To Overcome] meets together every two weeks. 

In this place we met Mrs. Jenny, 48, who is living in a common law relationship from which they have two children of 24 and 13 years of age. The elder, a daughter, has graduated from the university and the younger, a son, is in high school. Her husband is a merchant. She has been part of the Loan Group for six cycles and she likes it because the loans help her a lot in her business. 

She and her husband have a business buying and selling fish and shrimp. They work every day. In the early mornings he goes to Puerto López where he buys from the boats that arrive at the beach, since the prices are cheaper there. Our friend tells us that while her husband is busy selling in other cities, she is busy selling at home or delivering to restaurants and homes in her area. They have more than 15 years in the business and it has always gone very well for them. 

She will use this loan to buy fish, shrimp, shellfish and other seafood. 

Her dreams are to have a large restaurant because she loves to cook and she is very good at it.

loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp, shellfish and other seafood.

loans.name: Batélé Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Batélé existe depuis l'ouverture du BV et ses membres habitent le même village. Le nom du groupe signifie "entente" en langue locale. L'activité principale est la culture et le commerce de légumes.
Mme Reine est âgée de 33 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle se situe à droite de la photo avec la main gauche levée. 
Elle pratique ces activités depuis son jeune âge et elle a acquis beaucoup d'expériences dans ce domaine.
Avec ce prêt, Mme Reine va renforcer sa capacité de production avec des semences de qualité et des insecticides pour s'assurer une bonne récolte.
Les profits tirés vont lui servir d'épargne, mais également elle compte appuyer son mari pour les besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Batélé Group has existed since the opening of its Banc Villageois. Its name means "harmony" in the local language. The group members live in the same village. Their main activity consists in growing and selling vegetables.

Mrs Reine is 33 years old, married and the mother of four children. She is standing at the right-hand side of the photo with her left hand raised. She has worked as a farmer since her youth and has gained a lot of experience in this activity.

Mrs Reine will use her loan to boost her production capacity. She will buy high-quality seeds and insecticides to secure herself a good harvest. She will partly save her profit, but also use it to support her husband with family expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Hozana Development Group

texts.en:
Forty-two-year-old Ruth's decade long success in liquor store business all boils down to blood, sweat and tears. She has been exploring many avenues to notch up success in the cut-throat business she is bearing a hand in. Success for this affable mother of three hasn't come easy and she has had to face financial hardship like many other entrepreneurs. 

The costs of doing business in the country are rising, and Ruth has not been spared. She has, at times, found it difficult to strike a balance between her earnings and expenses. While she has to pay rent and purchase more jerrycans of hard liquor to resell, she also has other family-related responsibilities to shoulder.

Remaining philosophical in the face of challenging times has been a key asset for Ruth. Her business generates weekly profits of around Uganda shillings 30,000, and she supplements the deficiencies in her income with a side business in food sales.

With this Kiva loan, Ruth says she intends to purchase more jerrycans of liquor and foods such as bananas and cassava for sale. She anticipates better prospects for her business with help from the Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase more jerrycans of liquor and foods such as bananas and cassava to resell.

loans.name: Toch

texts.en:
As is known, fish is the main vital fresh food to everyone, in particular the families who depend on fishing and fish selling. Mrs. Toch is one among those people who currently depends on selling fish at the busy local market. She sells fish that she either gets from her husband’s fishing or buys from her wholesale supplier. Toch is a humble mother who has been blessed with ten lovely children. Five of her children are married and live independently, and the other five are living with her. From this business, Toch gains approximately $2 per day. 

To upgrade their living, Toch and her husband would like to purchase fishing equipment but they lack the cash, so she has decided with her husband to request some funds through HKL, a partner with Kiva. She expects that this funding will improve her revenue. She and her husband are very thankful to all kind lenders that always help her family. This is the second cycle of her loans with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment.

loans.name: Mirson

texts.es: Mirson, de 44 años, es padre soltero de un hijo que ya es mayor de edad y tiene su propia familia, el vive solo en su casa propia en donde algunas veces llegan sus hermanas y su hijo a visitarlo o pasar un fin de semana con él. El trabajo de Mirson consiste en la siembra de productos regionales, como cítricos, además posee algunos reses, los cuales se dedica a comprarlos en edad tierna y venderlos cuando ya están grandes y robusto. Todas estas actividades los realiza en su chacra, que esta ubicado a pocos kilómetros de su casa. Lleva en este trabajo ya 15 años, en ocaciones contrata peones para ayudarlo en época de siembra y cosecha. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que esta siempre al aire libre y dispone de su tiempo como mejor le parece, además dice que no hay nada mejor que ser independiente, espera poder mantener su negocio ya que de esto vive y espera poder seguir haciéndolo por varios años mas. Este será el crédito número 16 con MFP, le va muy bien en el grupo, es un socio fundador y siempre resultó ser buen pagador de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado, comprará productos regionales de otras chacras para venderlas al por mayor en la ciudad, además de invertir en algunos granos y sacos de abono para su sembríos.
texts.en:
Mirson is 44 years old and a single father of a son who is now an adult and has his own family. He lives alone in his own house where he is sometimes visited by his sisters and son. They sometimes come to spend the weeekend with him. Mirson plants regional products such as citrus trees. He also has some cattle which he buys when they are young and sells where they are large and strong. All of these activities take place on his farm which is located only a few kilometres from his house. He has been doing this work for 15 years. On occasion he hires labourers to help him at sowing and reaping time. What he likes about his work is that he is always in the open air and can use his time as he sees fit. In addition, he says that there is nothing better than being independent. He hopes to stay in business as he lives from it and hopes to continue doing same for several years more. This is his 16th loan with MFP. He is doing very well in the group, is a founding member and always proved to be good at repaying his loan. With the requested amount, he will buy local products from other farms to sell wholesale in the city and in addition invest in some grains and sacks of manure for his crops.

.

loans.use: to buy local products, grains and sacks of manure.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
This is Analyn, 29, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She’s married to William, a driver, and mother to their two children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Analyn is a rice dealer. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling per sacks or per kilo. Aside from the rice, she also earns by selling fruit. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 450 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 24,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy sacks of rice, and fruit for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Analyn hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work at her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. She can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of rice and fruit for her business.

loans.name: Lorena Nancy

texts.es:
Lorena de 56 años, una mujer trabajadora que inicio su negocio hace 6 años.

Trabaja en un pequeño comedor, que poco a poco ha salido adelante.

Su negocio inicia a las 6am hasta las 7pm.

Su dificultad es la delincuencia  de su sector.
  
Solicita el préstamo para invertir en el negocio y comprar materiales de construcción para terminar su vivienda. 
 
Su sueño es expandir su negocio y que sus hijos tengan un buen  bienestar económico.
texts.en: Lorena, 56, is a hardworking woman who started her business six years ago.  She works in a small eatery that has gradually made progress.  Her work day is from 6am to 7pm.  The difficulty she faces is crime in her neighborhood.  She’s asking for the loan to invest in her business and to buy building materials and supplies to finish her house.  Her dream is to expand her business and that her children have good economic wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Senara

texts.en:
Senara is 19 years old, married, and has no children. Senara owns and operates a business selling baked goods in the local community. She has one year of experience in this business. Senara needs a loan of 1,000 WST to purchase ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 450 WST per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Senara joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Senara's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
This is Gemma, aged 43 and a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Vicente, a businessman, and a mother to their children. She and her husband manage their household while operating a business. Together they work hard to secure the future of their family.

Gemma operates a meat-processing business. She buys meat and processes it to produce products such as tocino (cured pork), giniling (ground pork), and longganisa (sweet sausage), which she sells to the community. She has many patrons who buy her processed meat and then sell it at their market stalls. There are many patrons who prefer Gemma’s products since they are assured of freshness and cleanliness. Gemma's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1000 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a loan of 18,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy meat and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Gemma hopes that her business will continue to be successful, just as she fervently hopes that her children will be able to graduate one day. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for meat products and other ingredients needed in her meat processing business.

loans.name: Sheriff

texts.en:
Meet 43-year-old Sheriff from Kissy, eastern area in Freetown, Sierra Leone.  He is married with 3 children between the ages of 8 years and 21 years. He also takes care of 6 relatives at home. In 2008, Sheriff established his local food stuff business. He began his business because he wanted to generate enough income to support his family.  He also earns income from renting out a house. He says that the main challenge to his business is increases in prices.

Sheriff requires a loan in order to buy more palm oil, garri (cassava product), bulgur (wheat), and corn flour. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to increase his profits and educate his children. In the future, Sheriff plans to own another store. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more local food stuffs such as palm oil, bulgur, corn flour and garri to sell.

loans.name: Víctor Fidel

texts.es:
El señor Víctor Fidel se ha dedicado a las ventas desde hace 15 años, quien le ayuda es su esposa pero a tenido problemas con la salud, la cual fue causando que su negocio tuviera perdidas. 
Solicita un préstamo para invertir en compra de cobijas y cobertores ya que sus clientes le están solicitando antes de que llegue la temporada de invierno. Y así podría recuperarse. 
Don Víctor Fidel tiene un proyecto de acondicionar una parte de su casa para el negocio y tener hay mismo su local y poder atender el negocio sin descuidar a su familia.
texts.en:
Víctor Fidel has worked in his sales business for 15 years. The person who helps him is his wife, but she has had problems with her health, causing his business to experience losses. 
 
He is requesting a loan to invest in buying bedclothes and bedspreads, since his customers are requesting them before the winter season arrives. In this way, he can revitalize his business. 
 
Víctor Fidel plans to set up an area for his business in part of his home, so that he will be able to run the business without neglecting his family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as bedspreads for the winter season.

loans.name: Carolina Concepcion

texts.es:
Carolina de 32 años, empezó vendiendo ropa y zapatos ayudando a su familia, luego se independizo e invirtió su capital para trabajar y gracias a Dios le ha ido muy bien.

Trabaja junto a su esposo y viajan los fines de semana a vender su mercadería a los pueblos.

Sus dificultades son la delincuencia y el transporte ya que es costoso coger bus para sus viajes.

Si está casada y su esposo es panificador, tiene 4 hijos de 13, 8, 7 que estudian en establecimientos fiscales y su último hijo que tiene 1 año.

Su meta es poder establecer un lugar donde pueda ofrecer  toda su mercadería cómodamente.
texts.en:
Carolina, at age 32, began selling clothing and shoes to help out her family.  She later became independent and invested her own capital.  Thanks to God things have gone very well for her.

She works with her husband and they travel to sell merchandise in different towns on the weekends.  Their problems are with the crime and transportation.  Taking the bus is costly.

She is married and her husband is a baker.  They have four children, ages 13, 8, and 7, who attend public school, and the youngest child who is a year old.

Her goal is to set up a location where she can offer all of her merchandise comfortably.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Kan

texts.en:
Kan works as a rice farmer in the urban area of Takhmao. She grows rice crops, both in the rainy season and the dry season. Together with her husband, she has been in this business since 1979. If they are able to increase their production during the year, her husband will sell some of the rice to earn extra income. Kan usually earns an average of $4.00 per day to cover her daily expenses. Currently, two of her children work in a garment factory to help improve the entire family's standard of living.

Kan would like to acquire her first loan from Kiva to buy a pump and fertilizer for her dry-season rice. She hopes that she will be able to increase her rice production through this loan.

loans.use: to buy a pump and fertilizer.

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en: Mrs. Oyunchimeg, 52, works as a nurse in a hospital located in Kherlen, a town in Mongolia. She has had this job for 32 years and has helped many patients over this time. Oyunchimeg is a widow who lives with her daughter in a slum district. Her house has become very old and uncomfortable and urgently requires some renovations. This loan will be dedicated to purchasing some building materials needed to renovate her old house.

loans.use: To purchase some building materials needed to renovate her old house.

loans.name: Luatimu

texts.en:
Luatimu is thirty three years of age and is married with two children. Luatimu owns and operates a business venture, where she plants and harvests fruits and vegetables for sale.  She has one year of experience in this business. Luatimu needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase equipment and chemicals.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Luatimu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Luatimu's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and chemicals.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 72 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with nine children. 

Adelaida has a rice field and grows rice that she sells during harvest time. She has had this business for 25 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides for the farm.

Adelaida has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Adelaida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is a food vendor.  She cooks  banku for sale.  She serves it with okro and fish stew in Adum Banso near Takoradi.   She has done this for 18 years.  

Georgina is married and has 4 children.  Her husband works at the Benso Oil plantation. She uses her income to assist her husband to pay their children’s school fees.  Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize and fish for the preparing of her banku for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her expanded  business  to build a  better stall for the sale of her cooked banku and fish.

loans.use: buy  maize and fish to make food to sell

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred lives on a farm outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for its rain forest. Many farmers in the area grow maize, sugar cane and bananas, with maize being the primary crop. The density of the old growth trees in the Kakamega forest, and the variety of crops grown in the area, make this an excellent area for beekeeping. 

Alfred is married, and has four children. Both Alfred and his wife have been farming for fifty years, and are currently growing maize, beans and vegetables on their land. Alfred likes beekeeping because despite the fact that he does not have a big farm, he can still keep bees, because they use very little land. This is Alfred’s first loan with Kiva, and he plans to use the income from his hives to buy a dairy cow. Alfred’s hope for the future is to buy more land to do farming.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Dieu Est Bon Group

texts.fr: DIEU EST BON est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Ayaba Sidonie est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. DIEU EST BON âgée de 40 ans n’a pas fréquenté l’école. DIEU EST BON est mariée à un soudeur nommé Christophe. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par DIEU EST BON et son mari. Pour cette raison, DIEU EST BON vend du riz et de l'huile végétale par la méthode de distribution depuis vingt ans ; ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. DIEU EST BON s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, DIEU EST BON sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe DIEU EST BON, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit précédent a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter du riz et de l'huile végétale.

loans.name: Benibakwe Group

texts.en: Odette is a 42-year-old married mother with five children. She has operated a small business of sorghum for the past 15 years. She works everyday from 5 a.m. until 6 p.m. While the work is tough and the hours are long, Odette is committed to her business so that her children may be able to go to school and healthy care . She is the president of BENIBAKWE group and she is the one who has a blue book in her hands. Odette has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase a large quantity of sorghum  for sale. With this loan, she will earn more profits which will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability, as well as pay her children's school fees and to pay medical insurance.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of sorghum  for sale.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.en: Daniela P. is 41 years old and lives in Silistra with her husband and her son. Till 1993 she works as a seller in many company in Silistra and then she and her husband open a small grocery store. But soon a large supermarket was opened in the neighborhood and Daniela and her husband had to close their grocery. So in 2003 Daniela\'s husband becomes a taxi driver and she opens a clothing shop. Daniela has a rich experience in retail and the shop is always very good supplied. Now Daniela P. needs $ 1 700 loan to make repairs on her shop and to buy new equipment.

loans.use: To make repairs on and to buy new equipment

loans.name: Giyas

texts.en:
Giyas wants to improve his sheep breeding.
He has been in this business for 6 years.
In the beginning of his business he borrowed $400 and bought 4 sheep.
Giyas is 51 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region, Kurdmahmudlu village. He is married and has a child.This is his only source of income.
Now he needs a loan of $800 to buy 8 sheep.

loans.use: To buy 8 sheep

loans.name: Lauiula

texts.en: Lauiula is a 41-year old woman with four children.  Her husband works as a farmer and is able to earn ST 200 (USD 80) per week from selling his taro and banana crops.
