When Lauiula heard about SPBD from a friend, she joined because she was certain that with access to capital she could greatly increase her family’s income.  Lauiula used initial loans to re-stock her parent’s old village store that was no longer in operation.  She re-opened it and now with the upgrades she was able to do, she can bring in up to ST 700 a week (approximately USD 280).  With access to loan funds, Lauiula has more than quadrupled her family’s income.  With this track record, she is certainly an SPBD success story.  Much of Lauiula’s recent profit has been reinvested in her husband’s business so that the plantation can be upgraded and the income potential of their land increased.  Lauiula is seeking an additional SPBD loan in order to finance another inventory purchase for her shop.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Intigam

texts.en: Intigam was born in 1977. He is married and has one child. He lives in Yenikand village, in the Salyan region. FIve years ago he started vine growing to support his family. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy orchard medicines and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy orchard medicines

loans.name: Ni Wayan Kari

texts.id:
With Rp.1.600.00 finance from Dinari, Ni Wayan Kari and her Husband Wayan Buda will use to farm pigs, because they are capable of doing this business. Before getting this financial assistance, Ni Wayan only had 1 pig with a cage made out of only bamboo. With Dinari's help she now has additional 3 piglets. Ni Wayan Kari is 54 years old this year and her child Ari Susanta age 20 years old lives with her. The house which they are living right now is from their own hard work. In the past 6 months Ni Wayan Kari managed to earn Rp. 400.000. She didn't need to worry about marketing, as her had regular buyer for her pigs. With the earnings, she will use it to finance the house hold expenses.

Translated from Bahasa by bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Walaupun dengan modal meminjam Ni Wayan Kari dan Wayan Buda suaminya,tetap memikirkan masa depan mereka.Modal dari Dinari Rp.1.600.000,- digunakan untuk memelihara babi.Karena usaha ini bisa menjangkau kemampuan dan ketrampilan yang dimiliki. Sebelum mendapat pinjaman, Ni Wayan Kari memelihara satu ekor babi di kandang yang hanya terbuat dari bambu sebagai pembatasnya. Sekarang Ni Wayan Kari sudah bisa membeli 3 (tiga) ekor babi untuk penggemukan. Ni Wayan Kari berumur 54 tahun dan memiliki satu orang anak bernama Ari Susanta yang berumur 20 tahun.Rumah yang ditempati sekarang adalah jerih payah mereka berdua.Dalam 6 (enam) bulan Ni Wayan Kari meraup keuntungan sebesar Rp. 400.000,-. Ni Wayan Kari tidak mperlu khawatir dengan pemasaran babinya, karena sudah ada langganan yang membeli babinya. Keuntungan ini digunakan untuk tambahan keperluan rumah tangganya.

loans.use: Membeli bibit babi untuk penggemukkan - Buying piglets

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris is a 32-year-old mother of three and a resident of the Kisiwani area in Dar es Salaam city. She runs a small restaurant, a business she has been doing for the past three years. She now wants to expand it into a quite bigger restaurant so as to cater to more clients. She is in need of U.S. $325 in order to buy more tables and chairs to furnish the place.

loans.use: To expand her restaurant

loans.name: Tinoai Sefo

texts.en: Tinoai is one of the eldest mothers within the loan program, but she is still active in doing her business. This is her fifth loan, and she is using this loan to improve her flower garden in her front yard. Tinoai likes flowers, and this is why she has decided to use this loan on her flower garden. Not only she is talented in planting flowers, she is also good at weaving fine mats. These fine mats are much needed by families during special events such as funerals, weddings and birthdays. These are her two major skills, and she is doing both activities at the same time. Tinoai is one of the supportive members of the center, and she is doing well with her business as well as the payments.

loans.use: To buy pots, fertilizers, tools, and equipment for her flower garden.

loans.name: Francisca Del Carmen

texts.es:
Sweet handmade bread with corn is later baked in the oven until they are ready to eat. Francisca del Carmen M. is dedicated to her business, selling her baked goods at the Central Markets in the city of León.

She learned to bake since she was a little girl. According to her, her mother taught her - she used to accompany her mother who sold her products along the streets of León. However, her dear mother passed away, leaving her the oven with other belongings. Since then, Francisca started selling baked goods in the streets of León.

For one year and a half, she has been borrowing loans (in total, 8) from Ceprodel. They have been invested in her business to buy corn and used for living costs. Her need for loans lies in the fact that she has no stable place to sell her goods; she is in the open air markets just outside of the Central Markets of León.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Las cosas de horno son panes dulces elaborados con maíz y luego horneados hasta llegar al punto de ser comestibles. A este negocio se dedica la dama francisca del Carmen M., vendiendo sus cosa de horno en el M. Central de la ciudad de León.

Aprendió desde muy pequeña a elaborar estos productos, su mamá le enseñó ya que según cuenta, al ser elaborados, acompañaba a su mamá por las calles de León para vender estos productos. Sin embargo, al fallecer su querida madre le deja como herencia el horno y los enseres por lo que desde ese momento inició a vender las cosa de horno en las calles de León.

Desde hace un año y medio ha realizado Créditos en Ceprodel llegando a un total de 8 créditos que los ha invertido en la compra del maíz y además en algunos gastos del hogar. Su necesidad radica en que no tiene un lugar seguro para realizar sus ventas por lo que se ubica a la intemperie en las afueras del M. Central de León.

loans.use: to buy basic ingredients to make baked goods

loans.name: Chamroeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Neom Chamroeun and her family live on the Koh Dach Island in the Mekong River. She and her husband have been married since 1989, and they have two sons and two daughters. Three of the children study at the local school, and one is still young and stays at home.

Mrs. Chamroeun runs a grocery store in front of her house. Her husband, Sam An, is a farmer. He grows vegetables and fruit, such as tomatoes and papayas, which he sells in Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Chamroeun is requesting a second loan for $500 from MAXIMA. She will use this money to purchase grocery items for reselling.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for reselling

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
"I have been in the business of making stainless steel boxes for a year and a half. I am now being requested materials to make equipment for industrial automatization (electric materials or pneumatic, which are used in the manufacturing of cables and harnesses) but I am laking the capital necessary to purchase the materials since it's an investment I was not contemplating. Several clients owe me money and that is why my money is on hold." I am requesting a loan for  $1,200 to purchase materials for the manufacturing of industrial automatization equipment.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.




“Mi negocio es la fabricación de cajas de acero inoxidable desde hace 1 año y medio, ahora me están pidiendo material para fabricar un equipo de Automatización Industrial (Material Eléctrico o Neumático, sirve para la fabricación de cables o arneses )   pero me falta el capital para la compra del material ya que es una inversión que no tenia contemplada tengo varios clientes que me deben y es por eso que tengo el dinero detenido” Solicito $ 1 200.00 dlls para comprar material para la elaboración de un equipo de automatización industrial

loans.use: Purchasing electrical materials to make industrial automatization equipment / Compra de material electrico para (Automatización Industrial)

loans.name: Sauda's Kisosora Utofu Group

texts.en: Sauda is a married woman with six children. She and her husband also take care of one other 65 year old person. Sauda is a livestock owner, and has been since 2005. Everyday, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business. She now hopes for a loan of $425 to buy more fodder for her animals. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Fatuma and Amina, who have businesses dealing in the vending of food items.

loans.use: To buy more fodder for her animals.

loans.name: Thị Cúc

texts.vi:
Mrs. T. Thị Cúc (MS: 020025), 23 years old, raises pigs at home while her husband drives construction truck. They have 2 school aged children. The income is 100,000 VND a day. She would like to apply for a loan of 2.006.000 VND to buy feed for pigs. Her group has another member, Nguyễn Thị Hương (MS: 020023), 38 years old, who applies for a loan of the same amount as hers to buy fertilizer.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị T. Thị Cúc (MS: 020025), năm nay 23 tuổi. Chị ở nhà nuôi lợn, còn chồng chị lái xe trở vật liệu xây dựng. Chị có hai con đang đi học. Mức thu nhập binh quân của gia đình chị là 100.000 VND/ngày. Chị thích tham gia chương trình vì được trả góp. Chị vay 2.006.000 NVD về để chăn nuôi lợn. Chị Nguyễn Thị Hương (MS: 020023), năm nay 38 tuổi. Chị vay 1.062.000 VND để mua lân đạm bón cho cây trồng.

loans.use: Invest in business

loans.name: Beni

texts.fr:
Beni T. is 24 years old and single without children. He makes bracelets and rings in Adéta, a small village located about 150 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Beni would like to use this loan to buy the raw materials necessary for his business to meet customer needs. Mr. Beni is a good client because he is on his second loan, and the first one was fully repaid.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Beni T. est âgé de 24 ans célibataire sans enfants. Il fabrique des anneaux et bagues à Adeta, un petit village à 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Beni désire, avec ce crédit, acheter les matières premières nécessaires à son activité afin de répondre aux besoins de la clientèle. Monsieur Beni est un bon client car il est à son deuxième crédit et le premier a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: To buy raw materials necessary for his business

loans.name: Chau

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi Chau is 58 years old. She has been a member with TYM for past 10 years. Both she and her husband are retired military personnel. In 1998, she joined TYM to borrow money to raise poultry and improve their family's income. With the original loan of 30 USD she was able to purchase chickens to raise. This project has changed her family's economic situation. Currently, in her spare time she also babysits children for additional income. In addition to their retirement pensions, she and her husband make an additional 120 USD per month from raising poultry and babysitting. In order to continue her business and increase her income, which would allow her 2 children to go to school, she wishes to borrow 725 USD. Her income is 210 USD per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Châu năm nay 58 tuổi, chị là thành viên của Quỹ tình thương đã được 10 năm. Hiện nay hai vợ chồng chị đều là cán bộ hưu trí. Năm 1998 chị đã tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương vay thêm vôn đầu tư cho chăn nuôi phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Với vòng vốn ban đầu là 500.000đ chị đã sử dụng để mua gà về nuôi. Đây là dự án đã mang lại sự đổi thay về kinh tế đối với gia đình chị. Tận dụng thời gian rảnh rỗi chị còn nhận trông trẻ để tăng thêm thu nhập. Hiện nay ngoài lương hưu anh chị còn có thêm 2.000.000đ/ tháng từ dự án chăn nuôi và công việc trông trẻ. Để mở rộng mô hình kinh doanh tăng thu nhập và có điều kiện đầu tư tốt hơn cho 2 con đi học vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 12.000.000đ. Thu nhập 3.500.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in a various goods to restock a small grocery store.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea P. is 53 and has a business selling fish at the market. She is able to earn approximately $3 each day. This business is good as fish is a favorite food among Cambodian people, who prefer fish to meat. But she still faces some problems. She does not have enough capital to sell a large amount of fish each day. Her husband Nov Mee is 54. He is a motor-taxi driver and makes $4 per day. The high price of gas has put many motor-taxi drivers off of the road and the remaining are making less profit. This couple has four children together, two of who are employed as garment workers and one of whom is married and no longer at home.

Mrs. Chea is asking for a loan from Kiva via local partner Credit to purchase a motorbike for family transportation. This will reduce some of the cost that this family spends on motor-taxi.

Mr. Nov is pictured because his wife is not available.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for family transportation.

loans.name: Chhum

texts.en: Chhum M., 40, is a widow and lives with her three children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Since 2000, she has been selling many kinds of vegetables, pork, and beef in the village. She is able to make around $2 USD each day and is aided by three of her children who work in garment factories. She also has one niece whom she takes care of. Chhum M. would like a $1000 USD loan to increase the number of items she sells. She said that her husband was the breadwinner of the family, but since he died, she started this business to support her family. Both competition and inflation make it difficult to earn enough to support her family.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: María Artemia

texts.es: Con sus 50 años D. edad, la señora María dedicó 15 años a ser empleada del hogar, lo que la distanciaba D. su hija menor, actualmente D. 21 años, por lo que desD. comienzos D. año se dedica a lo que antes era un hobbie o recurso al momento D. hacer regalos a familiares: tejidos D. ropa y accesorios. A pesar D. la insistencia D. sus hijos, los mayores y la menor que aún la acompaña, ella sigue firme en el negocio aunque le es esencial poder invertir más en aras D. incrementar sus ganancias, para poder concretar una añoranza suya: poner un taller donD. actualmente vive e irse a vivir al terreno que 1 D. sus hijas le acaba D. comprar (lo que en sí mejoraría su calidad D. vida en todo ámbito –actualmente su casa queda en faldas D. un cerro y por la edad ya no le es tan fácil el acceso a ésta-).nnDicha realidad se hiciera más cercana D. poder obtener un préstamo D. 500 soles, financiando así una compra importante D. material a utilizar en la confección D. su arte.n
texts.en:
Of her 50 years of life, María dedicated 15 to being a maid, which distanced her from her youngest daughter, who is now 21 years old. Because of this, since the beginning of the year she has dedicated herself to what used to be a hobby or last minute resource to make family gifts: hand-woven clothing and accessories. Despite her children's insistence, the older ones and the youngest still accompany her. María remains firm in her business although the most important thing is being able to invest more in methods of increasing her earnings, so that she can start saving money. She would like to open a workshop where she currently lives and go to live on the land that one of her daughters just purchased (which would in itself improve her quality of life in all respects--currently her house is on the siD. of a mountain, and due to her age it is not easy to access it). A 500 soles loan would move her closer to this desire. The loan would finance an important purchase of materials used in the production of her art.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material to make hand-woven cloth.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Mrs. Maricel Oliveros M., 21, is a workaholic mother and a resident of Brgy. San Isidro, Tibiao, Antique Philippines.  Currently she is living together with her parents and her husband and their 2 children.  She and her husband did not finish their studies even up to high school because of poverty. Due to lack of education they cannot find a decent job and that is why her husband decided to work as a “sacada” (plantation laborer) on the island of Negros, Philippines. 

Finally, Maricel joined ASHI to have a working capital of php 5,000 with a term of 50 weeks for  fish vending.  She believes that through ASHI they will be able to rise up from poverty and have a brighter future for their children.  And if she given a chance she would like to become a wholesaler of fish, provided she can manage to get a working capital of Php 10,000 through her next loan.  She plans to link up with the other wholesalers from different towns in the province of Antique or even to deliver to Luzon, the largest island in the Philippines, if she can have access to enough capital for her business someday.

loans.use: fish vending

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita Es socia del Banco Comunal Sumaqcha que significa Hermoso en quechua.

Margarita es casada, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, Margarita vende comida en su casa, da pensión a personas extranjeras que pertenecen a la iglesia mormona, para lo cual participo en diferentes capacitaciones para la preparación de los alimentos. Además su esposo junto a un socio tiene un taller de carpintería, también tienen un carro con el cual realiza taxi en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Margarita necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite.

Los sueños de Margarita son comprar un terreno para construir su taller, terminar de construir su casa y que sus hijos estudien.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the Sumaqcha Communal Bank. "Sumaqcha" means "beautiful" in the indigenous language, Quechua. Margarita is married. She is 35 years old and has two children. She sells meals out of her home and provides boarding to foreigners who are part of the Mormon church. She has participated in various trainings on the preparation of meals. Her husband is part of a group that owns a carpentry workshop, and the couple have a car that they use as a taxi in the city of Ayacucho. Margarita needs a loan of 2000 soles (~$650), which will be used to purchase rice, sugar, and cooking oil. Margarita's dreams are to buy a plot of land on which to build a shop, finish building her house, and send her children to school.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, and cooking oil

loans.name: Bandhira

texts.en:
Mrs. Bandhira K., 45 years old, is a tailor in the town of Balkhu in Kathmandu.  She opened her tailoring shop 7 years ago. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies dresses and school uniforms for both boys and girls. She prefers to make popular dresses like Kurta Sulwar, blouses, ladies' long dresses, Makhshi, and others.
 
Before starting her own business, Mrs. K. took a 6 month training course in tailoring when she was younger. Now she is requesting a loan to buy raw materials for her tailoring work.

Her husband's name is Rabindra K. and he works in a private office. She has two sons who are both studying in BBS (Bachelors in Business Study) Level.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her work.

loans.name: Francisca Gladys

texts.es: Francisca Gladys D. de 54 años de edad reside en el municipio de Apopa en el departamento de San Salvador.  Hace varios años abrió una venta de cosméticos y papelería en su propia casa. Con este humilde negocio Francisca pago sus estudios universitarios que ahora le permiten ejercer un mejor ejemplo a sus dos hijos quienes también han salido adelante. A pesar de todos sus logros Francisca y su familia siempre buscan la manera de avanzar y crecer un poco más, por lo que Francisca solicita un préstamo para reinvertir en su negocio  y comprar nueva mercadería  que den nueva vida a su negocio y le permitan  crecer aún más.
texts.en:
Francisca Gladys D., 54 years old, lives in the town of Apopa in the department of San Salvador. A few years ago she opened a cosmetics and stationery business in her own house. With this humble business Francisca paid for her university studies which now permit her to set a better example for her 2 children, who have also progressed forward. In spite of all her achievements, Francisca and her family always look for a way to advance and grow a little more, for which reason Francisca is seeking a loan to reinvest in her business and buy new products, which will give new life to her business and allow it to grow more.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de mercarderia para su negocio

loans.name: Etibar

texts.en: Etibar, 28 and single, lives in Khachmaz Region, Armud-Padar village, where he started a cattle-breeding business three years ago. He is now requesting a loan of 950 AZN to buy three calves for his business.

loans.use: To buy three calves

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome N. is 44 years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, three males and two females. Two of her children have completed senior high school. The rest are in senior and junior high schools.

She says she works to make some income to support her husband financially to take care of the family. Salome lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Mampong, in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Salome deals in printed fabrics and second hand clothes. She buys bales of printed and second hand clothes from Kumasi and hawks to sell in her community. She has been in business for eight years. Salome wants a loan to procure more goods. She is hopeful to support her children in school.

loans.use: Buy more second hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mayte

texts.es: Mayte tiene 39 años, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos que están en edad escolar y la incentivan a seguir a delante. Desde hace 11 años vende comida en un lugar afuera de casa que implementó para su negocio, también prepara y vende panes, y adicionalmente a estas actividades cría pollos. Mayte es una mujer muy activa, y tiene planificado su tiempo para sus diversas actividades, además cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y de su esposo. Es importante para ella dar una buena atención a sus clientes, que su comida quede bien sabrosa y criar adecuadamente a sus pollos. Lo bueno de su negocio es que tanto con la comida como con los panes obtiene ganancias diarias, con las que sostiene los gastos básicos de su familia; por otro lado, la venta de sus animales es cada 35 días que es lo que demora en estar en peso y tamaño cada pollo. Con MFP tiene 4 préstamos, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque existe bastante solidaridad, respeto y responsabilidad entre sus integrantes. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en forma equitativa en sus tres actividades; la preparación de comida, insumos para sus panes e incremento de la cantidad de pollos que cría y vende.
texts.en:
Mayte is 39 years old. She lives with her husband and her three school-aged children who inspire her to move forward. For the last 11 years she has sold prepared meals at a location away from her home which she established for this purpose. She also bakes and sells bread and raises poultry. Mayte is a very active woman and plans out her time for her various commercial activities though she also can count on her husband's and her children's support. It is very important to her that her meals are well prepared and tasty and that her customers are well-served as well as that her poultry is adequately cared for. What is best about her business is that both with the meals and the bread production she makes daily profits with which she is able to pay for the family's basic needs; on the other hand, the sale of her poultry happens every 35 days which is the time it takes for the chicks to mature enough to be ready for sale. She has four loans with MFP and likes working with her communal bank because of the support, respect and responsibility that exists among its members. The money she asks for now will be divided equally among her three activities: food preparation, raw materials for her baked goods, and an increase in the number of chicks she raises and sells.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her three businesses.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel M. works as a taxi driver in Domenase, near Elmina. Samuel has completed senior high school. He is married and has 5 dependent children. His wife is a trader.

Samuel has been working as a taxi driver since 2008. He is responsible for paying school fees and light bills. His loan will be used to buy spare parts for the car. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to save and maintain the car.

loans.use: His loan will be used to buy spare parts for the car.

loans.name: Serafina

texts.es: Serafina tiene 63 años, vive con sus hijos en su casa propia. DesD. niña las actividades agrícolas fueron el sostén D. su hogar, y en la actualidad esa experiencia le sirve para continuar con la misma labor. Su cultivo principal es la papa, para ello se levanta muy temprano para verificar que sus cultivos estén bien, sus hijos la apoyan siempre y se siente respaldada por ellos. A pesar D. su edad, Serafina sigue teniendo todas las energías para trabajar, porque el campo la hace sentir viva y activa. Para el futuro desea mejorar su producción para dejares a sus hijos una fuente D. ingresos para su autosostenimiento. Este es su doceavo préstamo con MFP, Serafina es una D. las que impulsan la unidad D. su grupo, y ahora se compromete a seguir trabajando para que su banco comunal siga unido. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará sacos D. abono para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Serafina is 63 years old and lives with her children in herr own house. Since she was a child, agriculture activities supported her home and it continues that way. Her main crop is potatoes. She arises early to check on her crops; her children always help and she feels supported by them. In spite of her age, Serafina still has a lot of energy because in the fields she feels alive and active. In the future she hopes to improve her production and leave her children with a source of income to support themselves. This is her 12th loan with MFP. Serafina is one of the members who drives her group and now she is committed to keep working so that her communal bank continues to be united. With the loan she requests, she will buy fertilizers for her next planting.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Shomurod

texts.en:
S. Shomurod is a loving and self-sacrificing father. Ever since he was very young, Shomurod has been around people raising animals, and thanks to this experience, he dedicates himself to raising and selling cattle, work that he learned from his humble parents.

With experience gained over time in the purchase and sale of cattle, he has been able to bring stability to his family. The desire that Shomurod harbors in his heart is that of increasing his capital to invest in acquiring more animals. He requests 800 USD to buy more cattle so as to expand his business. Let’s get together behind the request of this devoted father to help him keep bringing well-being and security to the members of his family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle and calves to expand the business

loans.name: Tanutsu Women's Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are Fanta S., Aminata K., Fullamusu S. and Hawa K.. They named their group the Tanutsu Women’s Association. These four women are requesting a loan in order to expand their businesses, earn better profits and consequently, improve their standard of living. 

Fanta S. (pictured on the right) is the leader of this group. Fanta is now 35 years old and was born in Bo, in southern Sierra Leone. She is married to a driver and now have three children who are attending primary school. Fanta sells medicine and has been working in this business for four years now.

loans.use: To further invest in her medicine sales business to improve her family's living standard

loans.name: Oimniso

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
      Оимнисо – пожилая женщина 59 лет. Замужем и мать 4-х детей. Имеет высшее педагогическое образование. Раньше работала учителем в школе, но сейчас зарплата учителей не хватает на жизнь и Оимнисо начала заниматься продажей детской одежды на рынке Якшанбебозор города Худжанда. Ее муж работает разнорабочим, в свободное время помогает жене в ее бизнесе. Они старается много работать и зарабатывать побольше денег, чтобы прокормить семью. Оимнисо закупает свой товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан. Она сама ездит выбирать товар. Оимнисо хотела, бы расширить ассортимент своего товара, потому, что хороший ассортимент привлекает больше клиентов. Для этого она предпочла взять займ для закупки летнего товара.
texts.en:
Oimniso is an elderly 59-year-old woman. She is married and is a mother of 4 children. She has a higher pedagogical education. Previously, she worked as a teacher at a school, but because teachers’ salary was no longer enough for life, Oimniso began selling children’s clothing at the Yakshanbebozor market in the city of Khujand. Her husband works as a handyman and helps his wife with the business in his spare time. They try to work a lot and earn more money in order to support the family. Oimniso buys her merchandise at a wholesale market in the city of Istaravshan. She goes to pick her merchandise by herself. Oimniso wants to expand her merchandise assortment because good assortment attracts more customers. She decided to request a loan to purchase summer merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of summer merchandise

loans.name: Caroline Nalubega’Sgroup

texts.en:
Caroline is the leader of a four-member group. She is a 39-year-old single mother of five children aged between 12 and 20 years. All her children go to school. She resides in and owns a one-room house, where she is staying with three people. Caroline doesn’t take care of any additional family members. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets two meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area in the outskirts of Kampala.

Caroline stays in Lugala and has a stationery shop in Kasubi, one of Kampala's suburbs. She incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping. Caroline sells to an average of 20 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works six days a week and besides her stationery shop, she sells chapati (a flat bread). 

Caroline sells mainly on a retail basis.She buys stationery from Nkrumah Road in the Kampala city center, where there are wholesale shops. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent for her business premises and home. She has been in this business for the last three years. Caroline has been with MCDT for more than two years and is servicing her fourth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more books, envelopes, duplicating papers and pens. Caroline aspires to see her business grow bigger and to own a permanent business premise.

.

loans.use: To buy more books, envelopes and duplicating papers

loans.name: Vaileth

texts.en:
Vaileth is a member of the Upendo borrower group in Kinyanambo ,Iringa,she is 26 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 6 and 2 years.

Vaileth started her own shop business selling commodities like rice,cooking oil,sugar 6 years ago,she works 10 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 250,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Vaileth`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more commodities.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Vaileth hopes to save money,pay school fees,and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more commodities

loans.name: Mrs. Kunthea Than Village Bank Group

texts.en: This group loan consists of 18 people who all live in Ta Reab Doun Sar village in Kandal province. Mrs. Kunthea T. has been selected by the members of the group to be its president. She sells fish in the local market. Her husband, Mr. P. Phearak, is a fisherman whose boat is broken. Although this couple tries to work hard, they still don't earn enough income to support their family’s needs. Because of this, Mrs. Kunthea T. is asking for a loan to buy more fishnets, fix her husband's boat, and repair her family's house. She is 24 years old and the mother of two children who are only ages one and three.

loans.use: To buy more fishnets, fix her husband's boat, and repair her family's house.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen de Cocharcas.
Felicitas es casada, tiene 42 años y 3 hijos, Felicitas vive en el distrito de Acosvinchos, se dedica a la fabricación de tejas de manera artesanal, sus ventas los realiza en el mismo lugar, además Felicitas tiene una tienda de abarrotes.
Felicitas necesita un préstamo de 1800 soles dinero que será invertido en el pago de peones y compra de tierra.
Los sueños de Felicitas son tener mas capital y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen de Cocharcas”. She is 42 years old, married, and has 3 children. Felicitas lives in the district of Acosvinchos and manages a business that manufactures and sells handmade tiles. In addition, she also operates a grocery store.

Felicitas needs a loan of 1800 in order to pay her workers and purchase some land. She dreams of obtaining more capital and providing a good education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay her workers' salaries & purchase some land

loans.name: Shokir

texts.en: K. Shokir is 41 years old and is married with two children. His wife is the housekeeper. For more than two years Shokir has been running a small open café where he cooks kebab (pieces of meat roasted or grilled on a skewer or spit). His café is located inside the food market of the city. Shokir’s children are growing up and, accordingly, their expenses are rising. For this reason he wishes to expand his café in order to make more profit from his business. He requests the loan of 1500 US Dollars in order to increase his capital and expand his business. With your support, you can improve the quality of life for Shokir and his family and help his business grow and prosper. He is sincerely grateful for your support. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To expand his café

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito H. is from the village of Green Hills, Suarez, Iligan City. She is 50 years old, married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Charito owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Charito has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Charito joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Bolaji

texts.en: Bolaji is 43 years old and married with four (4) children. Her husband sells electrical materials and they live in Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells bunches of plantain at retail prices to her customers. The demand for her plantain is high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. Plantain in Nigeria can be prepared by boiling, roasting and frying. It is a staple food in Nigeria. She hopes for a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more bunches of plantain to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bunches of plantain to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria and her husband are engaged in manufacturing an improvised stove. It is being assembled by her husband. Gloria helps him in delivering their product to different villages and to some dealers. For each stove, they earn PHP700. Gloria would like to further expand her business to make her business more profitable. She hopes to obtain a loan of PHP5,000 to use as additional capital in purchasing more materials needed to manufacture more stoves. According to her, the more capital they have, the more stoves they can make. She hopes that her loan will be granted by some generous KIVA lenders. 

Gloria is 41 years old and she is married to Gabriel who manages his own welding shop in their house. They are blessed with four children; two are married and two are still being supported by them.  They live in the village of Punit, Benito Soliven, Isabela.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed in their manufacturing business

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian A. is from the village of Bacolod, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Vivian owns and operates a hog-raising business. She has been engaged in this business for ten years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In October 2009, Vivian joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Vivian is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase an additional feed supply

loans.name: Lady

texts.es:
La sra. Lady se dedica a la venta de coca por take, un take es la medida que utilizan los vendedores de coca, equivale a 50 libras cada uno. La coca en su estado natural es muy apreciada en Bolivia desde tiempos incaicos por sus beneficios medicinales, lo utilizan en mates para el dolor de estómago, en cremas para dolores musculares, y las personas que tienen un trabajo que requiera un mayor esfuerzo fisico, como los mineros, mastican las hojas ya que éstas quitan el sueño y el hambre. La cliente compra la coca que traen de los Yungas del departamento de La Paz, toda esta mercadería llega al mercado de la coca ubicado en la zona de Villa Fatima, se registra a los propietarios y luego la venden, las personas que comercian con la coca deben tener un permiso especial para vender este producto. La sra. Lady tiene su permiso ya que su papá es yungueño, y le permitieron trabajar en este rubro. Es una cliente muy responsable, su esposo es chofer asalariado, ambos se apoyan para los gastos de la casa. El crédito que solicita ahora es para incrementar la cantidad de takes de coca ya que para fin de año algunos comerciantes descansan y no traen coca para vender, por esto el take de coca sube de precio. 						
						
Si deceas conocer mas sobre la hoja milenaria visita la siguiente pagina http://www.bolivianet.com/cultura/encuentro/coca/la_coca.html
texts.en:
Lady works selling coca leaves by the take. A take is a measurement used by coca sellers and is equivalent to 50 pounds. Coca in its natural state has been valued in Bolivia since Incan times for its medicinal benefits. It is used in teas for stomachache and in creams for muscle pain. People who have jobs that require great physical exertion, such as miners, chew the leaves because they relieve fatigue and hunger. The borrower buys coca brought from the Yungas region in the department of La Paz. All of the merchandise arrives at the coca market located in the Villa Fatima area. The owners are registered, and then they can sell it. The people who work in the coca business must have a special permit to sell this product. Lady has a permit because her father is from the Yungas region and so they have allowed her to work in this sector. She is a very responsible borrower. Her husband is a salaried driver and they both count on one another for household expenses. The loan she is asking for now is to increase the number of takes of coca, because towards the end of the year some merchants take a break and do not bring coca to sell. For this reason the price of a take of coca goes up. If you would like to know more about the coca leaf visit the following page: http://www.bolivianet.com/cultura/encuentro/coca/la_coca.html

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of takes (sacks) of coca

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda S. is from the village of San Jose, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 41 years old. Imelda is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Imelda owns & operates a retail store where she sells slippers in the local community. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Imelda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Imelda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Cherly's Group

texts.en:
Cherly P. is from Kinuman Norte Ozamiz City. She is 23 years old. Cherly is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Cherly is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Cherly owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products such as shampoo, noodles, sugar, salt, coffee, some foods for snacks and etc. in the local community. Cherly has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Cherly joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cherly is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Cherly from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a motorcylce taxi

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en: Mrs. Chanthou S. is a 29-year-old married woman who lives in Trapeang Khlout village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Ra Choun, are farmers who own a 2-hectare field to cultivate rice. Mrs. Chanthou S. is also a duck breeder, selling duck eggs to help support her family. Mrs. Chanthou S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer for farming and duck food for duck breeding. Mrs. Chanthou S. is the mother of two children, who are students at the public school. Her husband is on the right of the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and duck food

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas is a 37-year-old married man who has been operating a butcher shop for the past nine years. He was employed before he started his own business. He farms to earn extra income and his wife is a businesswoman.  Nicholas has requested a loan of KES 60,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy goats and cows for slaughter. He hopes to invest his money and buy a plot of land in the future. He dreams of opening other outlets for his business to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy goats and cows for slaughter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy and sell prepared rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Completing construction of a home and paying off capital expenses

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en: Nulu is married to a taxi driver with whom she has children and all her children are in school. Nulu doesn’t take care of additional family members. She owns a drug shop in Bwaise. Nulu wants to use this loan of 900,000/=to buy more boxes of drugs and syrups for her drug shop (pharmacy). She has been operating this business for a long time. Nulu rents the shop where she has her drug shop and pays a monthly rent of 50,000/=. Besides this drugshop, Nulu also owns piped water which she sells to neighbors at 100/= per jerry can. She also owns a dry cleaning business.In this dry claening business she doesn't operate it alone but has  got three employees.  Her major customers are people around her place of work and former work mates. Nulu’s business challenges include thieves and the rainy season, which disturbs her business because she works in a muddy place. She aspires to see her business grow bigger and to own a fully stocked pharmacy. Nulu joined MCDT because they were helping women from grassroots and, above all, low income earners. Nulu has access to electricity and piped water.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of drugs and syrups

loans.name: Mckeown Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Akosua is a 53-year-old woman who describes herself as trustworthy.  She is married to a gardener and together they have two children who are 14 and 17 years old.  She would like to support her children’s education up to the tertiary level. Akosua has operated a retail palm oil business for the past year.  She also sells 'gari' to supplement her income.  Gari is a fried cassava dish.  She will use the loan to buy palm oil and 'gari'.  She hopes to eventually become a palm oil wholesaler.  

Akosua is currently the leader of the trust bank group called 'McKeown'.  Akosua believes that she was elected group leader because she is educated, humble and hard-working.  There are 9 members in the group.  The other members of the group are involved in trade businesses such as chop bar (food stall) operator, yam selling, and clothes selling. They plan to use the loan to purchase various items to grow their business to support their family.

loans.use: To purchase palm oil and gari in bulk

loans.name: Rodella

texts.en:
Rodella T. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 40 years-old. To make a living, Rodella owns and operates a business raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. She hopes for an abundant harvest.

In May 2009, Rodella joined Kiva partner CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rodella has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Rodella is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Rodella from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly in recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI provides not only credit for its clients but also savings, insurance and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Carmen Yesenia

texts.es:
Carmen de 28 años, vive en las Orquídeas (la originalidad de este lugar fue un campo con muchas flores orquídeas) de Guayaquil, es madre soltera y tiene un salón de belleza. 

Aprendió a ser estilista desde pequeña cuando veía a su mama cortar cabello, cuando creído y tuvo su hija tuvo que invertir sus ahorros en una peluquería para hacer lo que le gustaba y tener dinero. Ahora trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 19h00pm todos los días. 

Para tener mas incremento de clientela necesita tener mas materiales por eso con el préstamo quiere comprar tratamientos de cabellos, secadora y plancha para alisados. En el futuro quiere incrementar mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Carmen, age 28, lives in Las Orquídes (this place is named this way because the countryside had a lot of orchids) in Guayaquil. She is a single mother, and she has a beauty salon. She learned to be a stylist when she was little and she watched her mother cut hair. When she was grown she had her daughter. She had to invest her savings in a hair salon in order to do what she likes and to have money. She now works from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. everyday. In order to have more customers she needs to have more materials. She wants to use the loan to buy hair treatments, a dryer, and an iron for straightening. In the future she wants to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hair treatments, a dryer, and an iron

loans.name: Roy

texts.en:
Roy C. is from the city of Poblacion 4 Oroquieta City. He is 29 years old. Roy is single. To make a living, Roy works in someone else's business venture in the services sector transportation service. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motor transport in the local community. Roy has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Roy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12000 PHP from GDMPC. Roy is requesting a new loan of 21000 PHP which will be used to repair his existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Roy from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Hope Foundation, Kyenjojo Group

texts.en:
John Mary K. is very hard working and ambitious about owning a big agricultural farm in his home area of Buhihi Kyenjojo. Yet he is in circumstances that may make him seem like a wishful thinker. This means he faces long odds in achieving that mission. He, however, has at length built a strong determination that has played in his favor.

With strong hard working skills up his sleeve, he has carved out a dependable business selling bananas, farming poultry and growing fruit. John Mary has banked on this business for the last 3 years and his family of six children has also enjoyed the good graces that have come with that business. He earns monthly profits of 250,000 Ugandan shillings. With this loan he hopes to purchase mulches and fertilizers to help improve his agricultural farm and also buy pesticides, as pests like banana weevils have always affected the plantation and reduced yields. This will in turn improve his yields, and hence his sales revenue, and will enable him to live a more satisfying life.

loans.use: purchase of mulches and pesticides for his agricultural farm improvement.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of men's shirts, trousers, socks, t-shirts, handkerchiefs etc.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.es:
Maureen  Gaitán R.  es una señora de 29  años de edad la  cual vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

El negocio de Maureen es la lechería,  y todos los productos derivados de esta. Algunos vecinos aseguran que el queso que vende ella es el mejor de la zona, sin embargo la oferta de su producto ha disminuido un poco debido a sus instalaciones.
Es por eso que Doña Maureen está solicitando un Crédito de ¢604.000 (seiscientos cuatro mil colones) para la construcción de un nuevo Corral  donde ella pueda ordeñar sus vacas bajo techo y así seguir ofreciendo sus productos a la comunidad.

Ella es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo,  y está muy feliz por que asegura que esta inversión mejorara  mucho su negocio.
texts.en:
Maureen Gaitán R. is a 29-year-old woman who lives with her husband and her 3 children in a community called Santa Fe, located in Los Chiles, in Alajuela province. This community is noted for being a mountainous zone and for being very near the northern border of our country. Its main economic activities are ranching and agriculture, specifically growing basic grains, sugar cane and oranges. Maureen's business is producing milk and all of the products derived from it. Some neighbors report that the cheese she sells is the best in the area. However, the amount of product she offers has declined a little due to her infrastructure. For this reason, Maureen is requesting a loan of ¢604,000 (six hundred four thousand colones) to build a new enclosure where she can milk her cows under a roof, and thus ensure that she can continue offering her products to the community. She is a member of the Manantial de Santa Fe communal bank, one of the 100 partner organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan, and she is very happy because she is sure that this investment will greatly improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying construction materials for an enclosure

loans.name: Ildika

texts.en:
Ildika is an entrepreneur who makes a living selling socks, lingerie, tops, shirts and other items at the Albion Market in her home town of Uzhgorod. She has been in business for 15 years, and has many loyal customers who come to buy from her because they trust the quality of her merchandise and enjoy her friendly and respectful service. She earns about 5,000 Grivnas in profit each month.

Ildika has used micro-loans in the past and found them to be a very useful way to expand her business. She is applying for a loan for 20,000 Grivnas to increase the size and scope of the items she has to sell. She would like to buy clothing for the fall season so that she can increase her sales and make additional income.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther O. is currently in the business of selling rice, beans and alcohol and is requesting a loan to stock more rice and beans to sell.  Esther is 30 years old married to a business man. She has one child and her child goes to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a big shop.

loans.use: To stock more rice and beans to sell

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta G. is a married woman who lives in Purok MMY Village, Bgry. Miranda, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures: Fish vending, running a general store and food vending. Her husband Romeo G., who is 50 years old, works as a fisherman, and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are 14 to 29 years old. Marietta joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired to achieve something better for her family. With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marietta has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 16000 helped her to earn a monthly profit of PHP 5000,  lifting her family's standard of living. This time, for her ninth loan cycle, she is borrowing PHP 16000, which she intends to use as additional working capital for her fish vending business so that she can continue to save up for her children's education and household consumption. Marietta G. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund Operations

loans.name: Damira Berdalieva's Group

texts.en:
Agriculture in Kyrgyzstan is a significant sector of the economy. Most of the farmland needs irrigation which is a challenge for farmers. A large part of land in Kyrgyzstan is used for crop cultivation, but even more of this mountainous country is used as pasture for livestock and animal husbandry. 

Damira B. is a 44-year-old farmer from Tokmok who is married with two sons. Her eldest son has a temporary income from his job and her younger son goes to school. The whole family relies on their land as a source of income. A basic part of their income is the sale of strawberries; they also cultivate land for other crops and raise livestock. Damira’s family took a risk to start raising livestock, but it has been a good decision with good results. They have purchased new carpets for their house, replaced old linoleum, and made household repairs. The family hopes to use this loan to purchase more livestock animals for breeding.  

Duishokul C. is 52 years old and also sells strawberries. Duishokul applied for this loan to purchase livestock to expand her business. She hopes that, after a while, she will be able to give her husband the car of his dreams and have a two-sided refrigerator for herself. 

Ainura M. is 37 years old and she and her husband sell strawberries. Ainura has already begun to enjoy the fruits of her labor. She hopes to use this loan to increase the number of cattle that she has as well as purchase new furniture for her bedroom.  

Aigul S. is 50 years old and is engaged in the strawberry business. She plans to use this loan to buy livestock. She is sure that she will be a success, because there was a time when her business was raising cattle.

 
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Riziki Group

texts.en:
Juma R. is in his mid-twenties and married with one daughter.  He has run a food shop for the past four years.  In his shop he sells flour, sugar, wheat, etc.  The shop is open daily from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m.  This will be Juma's tenth loan with Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used his past loans to open the shop and to pay interest on the shop.  Juma plans to use this loan to increase the capital of his business.  

Juma is a member of Riziki Group, which has 15 members.  The members will hold each other accountable in repaying the loan.  In the photo, Juma can be seen seated in the second row, wearing a black shirt and black cap.

loans.use: To increase the business' capital.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: Rosalie N. is 48 years old, married and supports her family by operating three business ventures: a general store, farming, and a ready-to-wear clothes business. She lives in Lumbay, Brgy, Cayhagan, Sipalay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store, farming and her ready-to-wear clothes business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000. Rosalie is now borrowing PHP 15,000 so she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her sixth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 11,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Rosalie aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Bernardino

texts.es:
El Sr. Bernardino de 65 años de edad, vive en Puerto Diaz una comarca a 15 kilometros fuera de Juigalpa  con su esposa y sus  3 hijos mayores de edad los cuales le ayudan en los quehaceres diario, se dedica a la pezca en el lago y luego los comercializan en Juigalpa, tambien obtiene ingresos mediante trabajos de Albañileria, cuenta con una Motocierra propia que tambien le saca provecho cortando madera y de esta manera ha venido sacando adelanto a su Familia en conjunto con sus hijos y esposa. 

Esta solicitando su credito mediante Kiva para cambiar Zing al techo de su Cocina y de este modo preparase para el invierno del proximo año que se avecina.  

ya que sueña con darle mejores condiciones de vida a su Familia.
texts.en:
Bernardino, 65, lives in Puerto Díaz, an area 15 kilometers outsider of Juigalpa, with his wife and his three adult children who help him with the daily chores.  He is a lake fisherman.  He sells his catch in Juigalpa and also earns income as a bricklayer.  He owns a power saw that he also uses cutting lumber to earn still more income to support his family and move his wife and children ahead in life.

He is asking for a Kiva loan to replace the zinc metal sheeting on his kitchen’s roof to prepare for next year’s winter that is approaching.

He dreams with providing his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy zinc metal sheeting to replace his kitchen's roof.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia B. is from Upper Langcangan, Oroquieta City. She is 60 years old and married, and she has seven adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a retail store, selling a variety of food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $100 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lilia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Lilia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 3rd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Tob

texts.en: Mrs. Tob N., born in 1954, lives in Slaeng village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow both rice and vegetables which she sells to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Roeun Van, is a construction worker, fisherman and owns a stereo hi-fi instrument which he hires out to villagers. In the plantation, she has had some problems because her rice field is ready to grow rice but she did not have enough money to support it. So, in order to improve production, Mrs. Tob N. is applying for a loan to do farming, hire farming laborers and buy fishing supplies. She has two children, one of whom is a driver while the other is a farmer. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To support her farming business.

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a talented lady who operates a hand embroidery business at her home to supplement the income of her family. She is known among her community for the quality of her work. This helps her to receive good number of orders every month. She doesn’t have any children, that’s why the income she earns from her business is saved for her old age.

Her husband’s name is A. and he has a barber shop in the market. Through his shop he offers hair cutting and hair dressing services to his customers. He has been in this business for the past 15 years and he has a good number of customers. 

Shahnaz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy scissors, shampoos, and hair gel for his barber shop. By doing this he will be able to provide better quality services and attracts many more clients.

Shahnaz is hopeful that an investment will bring positive changes to her husband’s business and he will be able to make more income than before. She is a new loan user of Asasah. She belongs to Yaqoob town which is a small residential area in the city of Multan. Multan is a historic city of Pakistan and known for its shrines & hot weather. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a raising hand is Shahnaz.

loans.use: To buy scissors, shampoo and hair gel for the barber shop.

loans.name: Mat's Group

texts.en:
In the Cham Kraom village bank has nine members. It is located in Kandal province. The members of this village hope to increase their income to improve the family living by use this loan.

Mrs. Mat F. is 41 years old, and she is a village bank president. She was selected to be village bank president by the other members. She is a fish seller. Since her business is going well, she want to expand it so Mrs. Mat F. would like to ask for a loan to buy fish for selling.  Her husband, Mr. Sman You, is fishermen who are able to earn a little income to support their family living.

This couple has eight children: five of whom are fishermen and two are attending in the local school while the youngest one is 3 years old.

loans.use: To buy piglets for breeding and pig food.

loans.name: Gaylord Eduardo

texts.es:
Gaylord tiene 32 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos. Vive con su familia en el distrito de Cayaltí, una zona conocida por los sembradíos de caña de azúcar. Se encuentra ubicada a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Desde hace dos años se dedica al servicio de transporte público en su mototaxi propia, un vehículo que consiste en una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior. Desea usar su crédito para realizar algunas mejoras en su moto, su herramienta de trabajo. También planea comprar algunos repuestos nuevos. Con las reparaciones, Gaylord puede mantener en mejor estado su mototaxi lo que lo permitirá ofrecer una mejor calidad de servicio a sus clientes y aumentar sus ingresos. 

Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1,000 nuevos soles.  Gaylord es muy trabajador y responsable frente a su negocio por ello desea salir adelante siempre.
texts.en:
Gaylord, 32, is single and has no children.  He lives with his family in Cayaltí district, a zone noted for its sugar cane plantations.  It is located over an hour away from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital.

He has been providing public transportation services with his own mototaxi for two years now.  A mototaxi is a vehicle consisting of a motorcycle with an attached cabin in which to move people around.  He wants to use his loan to make some repairs on his motorcycle, his work tool.  He also plans to buy some new replacement parts. With these repairs Gaylord can maintain his mototaxi in better working condition which will make it possible for him to offer better customer service and increase his income.

Because of this he has decided to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan.  Gaylord is very hard working and responsible with his business and wants to get ahead always.

loans.use: To repair and buy parts for his mototaxi.

loans.name: Xiomara

texts.es: La sra. Xiomara G. Chavarriaes profesora de primaria, es casada tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. Se le han financiado dos crédito los ha invertido en mejora de vivienda, este lo ha solicitado para la compra de materiales de construcción como arena, cemento, madera, piedrín, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Mrs. Xiomara G. Chavarriaes is a primary school teacher.  She is married and she has two school-aged children. She has had two past loans and she has invested them in the improvement of her house. She has requested the current loan to purchase construction materials such as sand, cement, wood, and gravel. The loans granted by Ceprodel have been a great help because she has been able to improve her living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: to purchase sand, rocks, and cement

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 42-year-old married man living with his wife and four kids. He is from Lebanon. He has been working as a home painter for the past 24 years. He works on a freelance basis, taking home projects. His income is vital to support his family and be able to satisfy the heavy expenses of life. He has obtained his first Kiva loan and was a good client with payments on time. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new painting tools instead of his used ones to present good quality service to the clients. In the future, he hopes to further expand his business and continue his work properly to earn income for his family.
