loans.use: to purchase new painting tools.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan K. is a 61-years-old married man with three children. He operates a Posho mill business where he grinds dry seeds into flour in Marereni market in Malindi town. The business gives him a monthly income of about KES. 10,000/=.  He has been running this business for the last five years now.

Jonathan has been loaned Kshs 10,000/= by KADET LIMITED and this serves as his first loan from the company. He intends to use part of the loan to purchase spare parts for the "posho" mill and will use the rest to service it so that it works well. 

Jonathan wishes to utilize the anticipated profits to continue looking after his family and continue educating his children who are still in school. He would also like to save some of it so that  he will be able to purchase another "posho" mill in future with a view to grow the business.

loans.use: To repair and service his "posho" (cornmeal) mill

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann L. is from the village of Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 30 years old, married, and has a young child. To make a living, Mary Ann owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community.  Mary Ann has been involved in her business for over five years, and she earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from the business.

In 2011, Mary Ann joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Ann is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory to sell. This will be her first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory to sell

location.town: Liloy-Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is 36 years old, married, and has five children, all of whom go to school. She is currently in the business of selling tomatoes. Anita has taken a loan to stock more tomatoes to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Koilel Ole

texts.en:
Koilel has practised farming in Naivasha town for the last seven years.  He is 45 years-old, married to Wanja I. and they have two children.  

He was introduced to Kiva partner KADET by one of his friends and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Koilel hopes to become a leading farmer in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman who grows crops for a living. Her husband is also a farmer. Together, they till land to grow rice crops and vegetables. Elizabeth said that they have been running the farm for five years. They earn about 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month from farming. Elizabeth also raises pigs in her backyard. She sells the pigs at the market.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and seeds. In the future, she hopes to improve her house and to have a good harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Ansorbeh Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you the members of the "Ansorbeh" Group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 500,000 SLL each in order to invest in their businesses.

Adama is the leader of this group. Adama is a 40-year-old woman. She is married to a driver, and they have five children. Adama sells groundnuts/peanuts and has been doing this business for five years now. With her share of this loan, Adama is going to buy bags of groundnuts in order to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of groundnuts in order to add to her business.

loans.name: Martha Ligia

texts.es: Llegar a tener un taller de confección que le permita generar empleo es el sueño de Martha Ligia, quien a sus 42 años de edad se dedica a la confección a terceros de camisas y blusas, esta emprendedora desde pequeña aprendió este oficio al lado de su madre y por la falta de oportunidades para estudiar decidió dedicarse a su propio negocio.
texts.en: Martha Ligia's dream is to have a workshop that allows her to employ people.  Martha, who is 42 years old, works making shirts and blouses for third parties.  She is an enterprising woman who learned this trade at her mother's side, and because of the lack of opportunities for studying she has decided to start her own business.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Onarhon's Group

texts.en:
Onarhon is 46 and married to a tractor driver. Together with her husband she has raised a son and two daughters. Her son works in construction, the first daughter is a seamstress and the second helps Onarhon with the housework. Onarhon is the leader of this group.

In order to meet the family’s needs, Onarhon works on their farm with her husband. They have been doing so since the collapse of the Soviet Union. With money received from the loan the family wants to purchase mineral fertilizers for farming.

In the future Onarhon wants to see her children wed.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Rocafuerte. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Rosa,  tiene 51 años, es maestra en una escuela en Rocafuerte, hace varios años su querido esposo falleció,  pero fruto de esa relación tuvo cuatro hijos, todos mayores y dos de ellos aun viven con ella. La menor de sus hijas estudia en la universidad en Guayaquil. Es socia del Banco Comunal hace ya por 10 años le gustan porque los créditos son una gran ayuda en su negocio.

Además de ser maestra también se dedica al comercio, tiene un negocio de venta de ropa y zapatos de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja todos los días en la mañana vende en su lugar de trabajo y en las tardes sale a recorrer por su ciudad. Compra su mercadería en Guayaquil ya que allá le salen más barato, nos cuenta que lleva como 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
 
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas, ropa de niños y zapatos.
 
Sus sueños son arreglar su casa y que su hija sea una gran profesional.
texts.en:
In the Rocafuerta hamlet every two weeks the members of the communal bank Rocafuerte come together. This place is known for its delicious sweets prepared by its inhabitants which are renowned throughout the country. 

In that place we met Mrs. Rosa, 51, who is an elementary school teacher in Rocafuerte. A number of years ago her dear husband passed away, but from that relationship she had four children, all of them grown and two of them still living with her. The youngest of her daughters studies at the university in Guayaquil. She is a member of the communal bank now for ten years. She likes it because the loans are a great help in her business. 

In additional to being a teacher she also works in commerce. She has a business selling all types of clothing and shoes. Her way of selling is door to door. She works every day. In the mornings she sells at her workplace and in the afternoons she goes out into the city. She purchases her merchandise in Guayaquil since the prices are cheaper there. She tells us she has been working in this line of business for about ten years. 

This loan is for buying pants, t-shirts, blouses, children's clothing and shoes. 

Her dreams are to fix up her house and that her daughter would be a great professional.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, T-shirts, children's clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes tiene 63 años, es una mujer sencilla y trabajadora, vive en casa propia junto a su hija y su nieto con quienes comparte su alegría y entusiasmo de poder salir adelante.Mercedes se dedica al comercio de frutas de temporada de la región, este trabajo lo realiza en su casa y cuando hay escasez de ventas lo hace en la esquina del mismo.  Ella también  se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y se va por el río en busca de generar un ingreso mas para su hogar. Lo que mas le gusta de trabajar en esta actividad es que puede disponer de su tiempo ya que sus ventas las realiza en el horario que ella crea conveniente. Lleva 4 años en esta actividad y siente que le va bien ya que sus ganancias son duplicadas dependiendo de su inversión. Mercedes espera poder ampliar su negocio y dedicarse a la venta de comida en la vereda de su casa ya que vio que hay un mercado muy interesante en la calle en la que vive. Mercedes lleva ya el sexto préstamo con MFP espera poder seguir bien como le ha ido hasta ahora ya que siempre se mostró como una mujer responsable y sobre todo cumplida, en su banco comunal es una socia muy querida ya que siempre esta con una sonrrisa y preocupándose por el bienestar de las demás socias.	Con los 1000 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará frutas, ropa usada, ingrediente e insumos para la venta de comida y así poder emprender este nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Mercedes, aged 63, is a humble and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own home with her daughter and grandson, with whom she shares her joy for living and enthusiasm to get ahead in life. Mercedes works selling seasonal fruits from the region.  She does this work from home, and when sales are slow, she does the same on the street corner.  She also sells used clothes and travels along the river to find more income for her household. 

What she likes most about working in this activity is that she can manage her own time as sales take place on her own schedule.   She has been engaged in this activity for 4 years, and feels that it's going well for her because her earnings are doubling her investment.  Mercedes hopes to expand her business and engage in selling food on the street in front of her home, as she saw there is a very interesting market in the street where she lives. 

Mercedes is taking her sixth loan through MFP, and expects to continue as well as she has done up until now.   She has always shown herself to be a responsible woman, and above all accomplished.   She is a beloved member of her community bank, who is always smiling and concerned with the welfare of the other members. 

With the 1,000 New Soles requested, she will buy fruit, second-hand clothing, and ingredients and supplies for the sale of food so she can start this new business.

loans.use: to buy fruit, second-hand clothing, and ingredients and supplies for selling food.

loans.name: Virgen De Candelaria Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VIRGEN DE CANDELARIA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro de Copacabana, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Catalina. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de salchipapas, venta de artesanías, panadería, venta de comida, venta de boletos, tienda de barrio.

La señora Catalina, indica que este es el primer ciclo que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación del asesor y promoción. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio, que viene trabajando hace cinco años atrás.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de aceite y conservas), que comprara de la distribuidora de Copacabana misma y lo comercializará en su establecimiento. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la amistad de las socias.
texts.en:
The “VIRGEN DE CANDELARIA” community bank are about to start their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana regional office.  The group has ten members and is managed by a board of directors which is led by Catalina.  The businesses that the members of the bank are engaged in are varied and include selling 'salchipapas' (traditional fast food), selling handicrafts, running a bakery, selling food, selling tickets and running a neighborhood store.

Catalina says that this is her first loan cycle with Pro Mujer.  She joined through an invitation from a loan officer and promotional work.  She currently runs a neighborhood store where she has been working for five years.

Catalina will use this loan to increase her capital (buying oil and canned goods).  She will buy her goods from a supplier in Copacabana and sell them in her establishment.  This work enables her to make income with which to support her family.  Catalina is single and has two children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, Catalina replied that she likes the friendship of her fellow community bank members.

loans.use: to buy oil and canned goods

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en: Margarita is a farmer working in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She is married and has children. Margarita has been growing rice for a long time now. She is able to provide for her family through her business. Margarita is requesting a loan to purchase rice seeds and fertilizers. She hopes to have a bigger farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is a widow with five children. For the past 11 years she has been selling palm oil in Jukwa. Abena uses the loan money to buy more palm oil to sell. The loan will make a great difference to her as she struggles financially with having to provide solely for her family. Abena hopes to be able to keep reinvesting in order to maintain her business.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Yopi

texts.en:
Yopi is a 32-year-old man and married to Elis, a 28-year-old lady. They actually had two sons, but their first son passed away due to a sickness. Their second son is Rivaldy, 2 years old. 

Yopi is working as a livestock salesman. He purchases chickens, pigs, goats, and cattle from the traditional markets in rural places and resells them at the market in the city. He has been involved in the business since 2006.

Yopi dreams of improving his income because of the increasing daily needs, and moreover, he should also take care of his parents. 

He plans to buy more livestock such as pigs and goats to be resold, but he does not have capital to do so. He is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 10,000,000. Yopi hopes that TLM will assist him with the loan soon.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock such as pigs and goats to be resold.

loans.name: Blanca Beatriz

texts.es:
Blanca, vive con sus padres y su hijo de 10 años, tiene un comedor donde ofrece desayunos, almuerzos y cena, y también vende tortillas, desde hace varios  años tiene este negocio, lo atiende todos los días de lunes a domingo.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar sillas y mesas para el comedor, para dar una mejor comodidad a sus clientes y de esa forma mejora en  sus ingresos.
El sueño de Blanca es crecer en su negocio, para obtener más utilidades y en el futuro comprar un lote para hacer su propia casa.
texts.en:
Blanca lives with her parents and her 10-year-old son.  She has a small restaurant where she serves breakfast, lunch and dinner.  She also sells tortillas.  She has had this business for several years and works in it every day, from Monday to Sunday.

Blanca will use her loan to buy tables and chairs for her small restaurant so that she can make her customers more comfortable and thereby improve her income.

Blanca's dreams are to grow her business, to make more profits and, in the future, to buy a plot of land so that she can build her own home.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs

loans.name: Libardo De Jesús

texts.es:
A sus 50 años de edad Libardo es un trabajador incansable que desde hace de 10 años se dedica la carpintería, específicamente a la fabricación muebles, sus clientes lo reconocen por su buen servicio y la calidad en el producto terminado.

Actualmente necesita comprar materia prima para la fabricación pero no cuenta con el capital necesario para realizar esta compra por lo que solicita un préstamo con el cual comprará los insumos necesarios para seguir `prestando un servicio eficaz y de muy buena calidad. Sueña con tener una ebanistería reconocida en el sector, incrementar sus ventas y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
At 50 years of age, Libardo is a tireless worker. He has been a carpenter since the age of 10, specializing in furniture making. His clients recognize him for his good service and the quality of his finished product. 

He currently needs to purchase raw material but does not have the necessary capital to make the investment. He is requesting a loan to purchase the necessary materials to make furniture to carry on offering efficient, high quality service. His dreams are to have a his furniture carpentry shop well known in the area, to increase his sales, and to improve his quality of life

loans.use: purchase raw material to make furniture

loans.name: Nyawa

texts.en:
Nzaphila is a widowed man with 3 children who are enrolled in school. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and medical bills.

Nzaphila has operated a clothes selling business for the past 7 years; his potential clients are his neighbors and the local residents. He faces a major challenge of seasonality when there is high demand during the festive season. He dreams of expanding his business.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase more clothes for resale. He decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access funds to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Edith

texts.fr:
Cliente de 44 ans, celibataire  avec 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 16 et 23 ans, elle ouvre un restaurant en 1996 a l'arrêt de ses etudes en terminal par faute de soutien financier.
Tres pragmatique, elle n'a pas cherche a aller loin dans la cour de la parcelle familiale, elle crée une cuisine ou chaque matin elle se lève très tôt pour préparer , ces clients sont les taxi-mans, des ouvriers qui ont des ateliers au alentour de son resto.Elle a des recettes de 60.000frs a 75.000 frs par jour.

Pour une quatrième fois , elle va encore bénéficier du prêt de Hope , elle compte acheter des cartons de morue, soles, des cartons de poissons de mer, poissons fumes , de l'huile et des assaisonnements.

Tres serviable et dynamique, elle tient a s'affirmer en tant que restauratrice et elle tient a aller loin dans son activité,elle prend soin de ses enfants et assure leur scolarité  et soutient sa fille qui est entrain de faire des etudes de journalisme.
texts.en:
This borrower is a 44-year-old single woman with three children aged between 16 and 23 years old. She opened a restaurant in 1996 after quitting her studies at the end of her high school education for lack of financial support. A very pragmatic woman, she opted to stay close to home and set up a kitchen in the backyard of the family residence. She gets up very early every morning to start cooking. Her customers are taxi drivers and workers from nearby shops. Her revenue averages 60,000 to 75,000 francs daily. 

This is her fourth time seeking a loan from Hope. She will use the credit to buy cartons of cod, sole, seafood, smoked fish, oil and seasonings. 

Very obliging and enthusiastic, she wishes to make a name for herself as a restaurant operator and plans to keep going forward in this activity. She takes care of her children and provides for their education, and she also supports her daughter who started journalism studies.

loans.use: to buy cod, sole, seafood, smoked fish, oil and seasonings for her restaurant

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza is 45 years old and a mother of eight sons and daughters, the oldest of whom is 22 years old.
After her husband retired, they prepared a small chicken house in their backyard and started a small business buying and selling chickens. That was almost four years ago and the business is still going on. Aziza has applied for a loan in order to buy more chickens to add to those she already has in order to make a bigger chicken farm.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens.

loans.name: Manuela Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Manuela sigue con su venta de tortilla, frijoles cocidos, el cual desde horas tempranas esta palmiando para lograr la clientela de la mañana, en este año ha sido dificil ya que su mama se le enfermo de presion, resultandoles azucar, lo que se complico y ayudo economicamente, desviando su prestamo, pero por una buena razon.
Hoy comenzara de nuevo este proyecto, al poder hacer una pared interna de su casa de concreto, logrando mejor seguridad, y privacidad para su familia, ya que la que tiene no es segura, y desea mejorar esta condicion, que sera de gran beneficio e higiene personal.
texts.en:
Doña Manuela continues to sell tortillas and cooked beans from the early hours of the morning, clapping out loud to attract the mornings customers. This year has been difficult as her mother became ill with blood pressure problems which resulted in high blood sugar levels which complicated matters and meant that she had to help financially. This meant that her loan was used for another but good reason.

Today she is starting the project again. Putting up concrete walls inside her house will improve safety and privacy for her family as what they currently have isn't safe and she wants to improve the situation. This will be of great benefit and also improve personal hygene.

loans.use: to build interior walls, for rooms, improving safety and privacy.

loans.name: Ana Miriam

texts.es: Ana Miriam de treinta y nueve años de edad vive con su compañero de vida. Ella posee una tienda la cual es muy conocida en la localidad pues en ella los clientes encuentran todo lo que necesitan arroz, frijoles, leche, golosinas, entre otros, todos productos de muy buena calidad a precios realmente accesibles  además el servicio que les ofrece es excepcional. Ana es una mujer emprendedora con muchas metas por delante uno de sus objetivos es hacer crecer su negocio y está trabajando duro para lograrlo ella piensa que se alcanza el éxito convirtiendo cada paso en una meta y cada meta en un paso esto la ha motivado a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, pan, producto instantáneo, embutido, bebido etc. Ana Miriam tiene fe que así logrará darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ana Miriam, 39, lives with her common-law husband.  She has a store which is very well-known in the town because customers always find everything they need such as rice, beans, milk, sweets, etc.  All of the products are top quality and prices are really low.  The service provided is also exceptional.  Ana is an enterprising woman with many goals.  One of them is to expand her business and she is working hard to achieve it.  She believes one becomes successful by converting each step into a goal and each goal into another step, and this is what has motivated her to request a loan through INTEGRAL to buy basic grains, sweets, bread, instant products, sausage, beverages, etc.  Ana Miriam believes that this will enable her family to lead a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, sweets, bread, instant products, sausage and beverages.

loans.name: Aniceta

texts.en:
Aniceta is a modest person with a strong personality. She lives with her husband and children in the village of Carabatan Grande.

Aniceta is engaged in a hog-raising business that primarily involves hogs for breeding. It is a business she started several years ago. The best way to earn profits was to go to the livestock markets to buy and sell pigs. Now, she needs to increase her business, and this is why she is taking out a loan of 7,000 PHP that she will use to buy feed, vaccines, and additional hogs to raise. This business helps Aniceta, because it's the only source of income she has to raise her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, and additional hogs to raise.

loans.name: Orifjon

texts.ru: Орифчон у себя дома занимается торговлей сухофруктов. В этой области он десять лет. Орифчон женат. Ему 36 лет. У него шестеро детей. Орифчон берет кредит для покупки сухофруктов.
texts.en: Orifjon is involved in selling dried fruits at home.  He has been in this business for ten years.  Orifjon is 36 years old, married and has six children.  Orifjon is requesting this loan to purchase dried fruits.

loans.use: to purchase dried fruits

loans.name: Rushdi

texts.en:
Rushdi is a 36-year-old married man who has a tailoring shop.

It has been almost 18 years now since he has had the shop, and it is  running successfully. Mainly he tailors different models of suits. Now he has applied for a loan in order to buy more sewing machines and expand the shop space.

loans.use: to buy more sewing machines and expand the shop space.

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel is 39 years old and has six children. Ethel is married and has five children who are in school.

Ethel is in the agricultural business farming seaweeds in the Philippines. Ethel requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy plastic bag, and other supplies to use in her business.

Ethel has been in this business for 16 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ethel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy plastic bag, and other supplies to use in her business

loans.name: Ana Leticia

texts.es: Ana es  una madre de familia muy perseverante, tiene grandes propósitos en la vida, con su negocio de servicios de trasporte le ha ido muy bien a Dios gracias, pues gracias a su crédito los repuestos de su vehículo logro  comprar y su carro en buenas condiciones ahora se encuentra. Ana con el afán de darle a su vehículo una mejor apariencia ha decidido solicitar un préstamo  que en esta ocasión lo utilizara para la compra de accesorios y repuestos para su carro, con esta inversión espera mejor su servicio y llamar la atención de más clientes. Su gran sueño es comprar otro taxi y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Compra de repuestos y accesorios para su vehículo.

loans.name: Berta Alicia

texts.en:
Berta Alicia lives with her three children and husband in Escobedo, Neuvo Leon. Three years ago she started selling shoes and catering to help her husband with the family\\\'s expenses, as her husband\\\'s income was not enough to cover the basic necessities (such as education). The perseverence that defines Berta is what has made it possible to continue on with her business since the beginning - her motivation is the love of her children and her husband.

She needs a loan of $250, of which she will repay within 3 months. With it she will be able to meet her clients\\\' demands, increasing her income and improving her family\\\'s quality of life. You can help her with her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Berta Alicia vive en Escobedo N.L con sus tres hijos y su esposo. Hace 3 años ella comenzó a vender zapatos y comidas para ayudar a su esposo con el gasto familiar, ya que con el sueldo de éste no les alcanzaba para hacer frente a los requerimientos básicos, como educación, de su familia. La perseverancia que define ha Berta es lo que ha hecho posible que ella continúe con la actividad que hace tiempo inicio, impulsada por le amor a sus hijos y esposo.

Ella ahora necesita de un préstamo de $250 DLLS, mismo que planea cubrir en un periodo de 3 meses. Con éste ella podrá hacer frente a los pedidos de sus clientes en ésta época e incrementar sus ingresos y por ende la calidad de vida de sus hijos. Tu puedes contribuir a esta causa, la decisión esta en tus manos, apóyalos.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Shakir

texts.en:
Shakir has 2 years of experience in this business.
Having borrowed $400 he bought 2 calves.
He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region , settled in the Fizuli region, Kayidish village.
This 49-year-old man is married and has 2 children.
Now he needs a loan of $800 to buy 4 calves.

loans.use: To buy 4 calves

loans.name: Mele

texts.en:
Mele rents a stall at the main flea market. In her stall she sells handicrafts and jewelry to tourists and locals. She stocks the handicrafts that are handmade by Samoan villagers. Mele readily admits that she enjoys running her own business and being in charge of her family finances.

Mele has a long track record of running her flea market stall successfully. She joined the SPBD program so that she can access the capital necessary to ensure that she can keep a consistent supply of merchandise in her stall at all times. Mele is one of the SPBD members who will use a loan periodically as her business demands, but she usually pays them off more quickly than required.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her flea market stall

loans.name: Djalil

texts.en: Djalil is 55 years old, married, and has two children. He lives with his family in Khachmaz town. Djalil has his own orchard, where grows cherry trees, pear trees, and apricot trees. He began his business seven years ago. Djalil would like a loan of $775 in order to purchase fertilizer and medicine.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and medicines

loans.name: Nadya

texts.en:
Nadya is a hard-working entrepreneur from Novomoskosk, a city in south central Ukraine. She and her husband, Nikolay, have one son. She runs a business where she sells women’s clothing at the busy central market in Novomoskovsk.

Nadya started her business five years ago and has run it with both extreme care and seriousness. It is an important source of income for her family of three. She sells around $1200 USD worth of clothing in a typical month.

Nadya has requested a loan of $500 USD so that she can purchase additional clothing inventory and to continue developing her business. Thanks to this loan, she will be able to grow her business further and help feed her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothing inventory

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Packaging material can get pretty creative in Ghana. Comfort K. is the first in her area of the market to start selling packaging materials. She sells the typical black plastic bags that are used in commerce in Ghana, old unread newspapers from abroad for wrapping bread, plastic bags used for drinking water, and various other products used by businesses inside the market.

She started her business six years ago with just $700. Over the past few years she has been able to keep her business running by buying most of her products on credit. However, lately her suppliers have been demanding money upfront, rather than allowing her to pay after she has sold the packaging materials. For the most part, she has been able to meet her suppliers’ demands, but she will need a loan to purchase 17 bundles of water bags. She has no doubt that these bags will sell. Many water sellers in the market come to her for the bags.

Currently, Comfort is using her extra income to support her 3 children through college. They are studying agriculture and nursing. They are all graduating within the next few years. Once they do, Comfort expects to invest her extra income into her business.

loans.use: To purchase 17 bundles of water bags

loans.name: Pule

texts.en: Pule A. is one of the new members of the programme. She is from the village of Sagafili Mulifanua. She just joined last week and she is deciding to do a pig farm. She already has lots of pigs but she needs a sty for them. She is twenty-seven years of age and her husband works at the Le Vasa Hotel. She has two children, who both have physical and mental disabilities. She is planning to sell her pigs to the restaurants and also to the public for special events. This is Pule’s first loan and she is looking forward to more loans in the future.

loans.use: To buy wires, cement, and pipe tubes for her pig farm

loans.name: Thi Quy

texts.vi:
Mrs Quý is 43 years old. She has 3 children who are all grown up and married. Everyday, she goes to the market to sell pork and she raises a drift of sows at home. Her husband wakes up very early to go pick up the pork from the supplier for her. Beside selling pork, they also sell bean curd that they buy from the neighbors. Previously, she had contracted out loans from "Ngân hàng nông nghiệp và Phát triển Nông thôn" (Bank of Agriculture and Farming) but she found the paperwork to be too complicated. This time she applies to SEDA for a loan to buy mash for her drift of sows

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Cô Quý, 43 tuổi, có 3 con đều đã xây dựng gia đình. Hàng ngày cô đi chợ bán thịt lợn, ở nhà cô chăn nuôi đàn lợn nái. Chồng cô thì sáng sớm đi lấy hàng về cho cô bán. Ngoài ra, gia đình cô còn buôn bán đỗ tương cho những hộ làm đậu quanh vùng. Nhà cô làm khá nhiều nghề nên trước kia cô vay vốn của Ngân hàng nông nghiệp và Phát triển Nông thôn Huyện Yên Phong, tuy nhiên cô cũng thích vay của chương trình tài chính vi mô vì không phải làm những thủ tục rườm rà. Cô vay vốn để mua thêm cám chăn nuôi.

loans.use: To buy pig mash

loans.name: Malohat

texts.ru:
Malohat G. is 48 years old, she has 6 children -- 3 sons and 3 daughters. Her oldest son and his father are in Russia to make money, her second son serves in the military, her third son helps take care of his mother and helps feed the animals. All Malohat's daughters already have their own families. She has 5 grandchildren. Malohat has a university diploma and she used to work as a school teacher.

Now, because of her illness, Malohat does not work, she spends all her time at home and enjoys very much taking care of her animals. Currently, she has 3 cows and 10 sheep. Since now animals are cheap on the market, Malohat would like to increase the quantity of animals. This is why she decided to approach MicroInvest for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Гуфранова Малохат,возрост 48 лет имеет 6 детей трое сыновей и трое дeвочек. Старший сын с отцом уехали на заработки а Россию , второй сын служит в Армии, третиий сын помогает маме по уходу и откорму скота. Все девочки уже имеют свои семьи. Малохат уже имеет 5 внуков. Она имеет высшее образавоние, раньше работала учительницей в средней школе.

А сейчас по болезни вышла на пенсию, и все свое время проводит дома и очень любит ухаживать за скотом. Сейчас имеет 3 коровы и 10 баранов. И пока скот дешевый на базарах она хочет увеличить домашний скот. Поэтому решила обратится в Микроинвест.

loans.use: To purchase more animals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase 2 hundredweights of rice, 2 hundredweights of sugar, one hundredweight of beans, 2 drums of oil, 2 boxes of soap bars, 2 cases of bathroom tissue paper, 3 cases of ramen noodles, one box of eggs, and one case of milk.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is thirty-three years old and the mother of three children. Two of her children are currently in school. She has been selling frozen products like fish, chicken and beef, and charcoal for the past year. Charity travels from place to place selling frozen products in the mornings and evenings.

She wants to use her new loan to buy more frozen products and bags of charcoal.

Charity is a member of the group called Shepherd. Members agree to use peer pressure on each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and frozen products like fish and chicken

loans.name: Umriniso

texts.en: Umriniso A.  is 53 years old and  is married with 6 children. Mrs. A. Umriniso lives in the Asht region of Tajikistan that is famous for its beautiful fabrics and dressmaking. She has 2 years of experience selling fabrics but has 15 years of general selling experience.  She has a good and harmonious family; her children help her with her home business and her husband is a collective farmer. Mrs. A. Umriniso applies to KIVA for help. She requests a loan for further business development and the new displays that will allow her to increase  turnover. Mrs. A. Umriniso requires the loan of 1800 TJS for 8 months. She thanks KIVA for the support that KIVA presents to small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Business development and new displays.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en: Rashid H. is a 55-year-old married father of three living in Bilasuvar, a southern region of Azerbaijan. To support his family, he sells clothes in the Internally Displaced People Settlement. More than 600,000 Azerbaijanis live in these types of settlements; most have fled from an area called Nagorny Karabakh, a region caught in the Azerbaijan-Armenian territorial conflict. To expand his business, he has applied for a loan of $1,000 U.S. dollars. Since he has successfully sold clothes for more than two decades, Rashid is confident that he will be able to repay his loan.

loans.use: To buy clothes to expand a small business

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena G., married with two daughters, is an entrepreneur from Melitopol, where she sells paintings, watches, and souvenirs in the central market. She is a Christian who regularly attends a Christian church. An experienced vendor who has been in business for eight years, Yelena’s gross monthly income is about $1600, and she has about $2000 in inventory.

With a Kiva loan of $675, Yelena hopes to increase her assortment of paintings and develop her trade. Her business has already enabled her to arrange a wedding for her elder daughter, who has moved to Kiev. This loan would allow her to continue to support her children and grandchildren.

Note: this is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in two months .

loans.use: To increase her assortment of paintings for sale.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Angela is a 44-year-old married woman with four children. Additionally, another family member is dependent on her. She owns a small Mama Lishe, or local café, that she started in 2005 and runs with two employees. When you see a SELFINA entrepreneur whose business title is ‘restaurant’ or ‘café’, you may have to adjust your mental image of what that is. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches, with the sky as a ceiling. Such places don’t even appear in the Lonely Planet’s budget guide, but if you’re looking for a cheap and tasty meal, and someone to have a chat with, this is the place to be. The food is all local; rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savoury banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of yummy sauces.

Angela is requesting $US275 in order to purchase additional stocks of rice, cooking oil, and beans and to add more chairs for customer seating. In the future, she hopes to open another café, which would allow her to serve her delectable food to even more customers.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence the poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client. The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional foodstuffs

loans.name: Gospava

texts.en: Gospava is a widow from the town of Doboj and she works as a seamstress at home. She owns one sewing machine and she does everything that she can with this machine. She wants to use this loan in the amount of 600 KM to buy textiles for sewing. Her wish is to make a new suits and pants and to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: To buy textiles for sewing

loans.name: Sao

texts.en: Sao S., 45, is married and lives with three of her children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She works as a farmer, making about US$3, while her husband typically makes US$3 every day from raising pigs for sale. They are also supported by one of their children who works in the garment factory. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year, and inflation is out of control and has forced food prices to skyrocket. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians. In light of these times of economic difficulties, Sao S. is asking CREDIT for a loan to breed pigs and to buy food for them as well. She sees this loan as a way to increase her income and is confident that the business venture will be successful. (Her husband is pictured.)

loans.use: To raise pigs.

loans.name: Sivet

texts.en:
Mrs. Sivet E., 59, is a widow with two children one son and one daughter. The first child is a garment worker and the second child was married and lives outside the family home. The family live in a small village off of National Road Two about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh

Mrs. Sivet has been growing rice and vegetables since she was young. Now she has created another job cutting grass to sell for cow feed. She is requesting a loan of US$250 to purchase zinc to roof her house.

loans.use: To purchase zinc to roof her house.

loans.name: Delecia

texts.en:
Mrs. Delecia A., 50, is married to Helson A. and blessed with 6 children. Like her they are only at the elementary level in school; they cannot afford to send their children to high school due to financial problems. Presently they reside in the mountain site of San Francisco North, Tibiao, Antique Philippines.  Based on their experiences with poverty, she decided to work as a “sacada” (plantation laborer) in Negros, Philippines.  

When ASHI came to her area, explaining its purpose and vision for less fortunate women, she began to hope that ASHI can give her the opportunity to show her skills such as fruit and vegetable vending.  

Fruit and vegetable vending is a very common job for mothers just to cope with the needs of their family.  Delecia has a great dream that she could establish a business as a rice retailer with her own stand in the municipality of Culasi, Antique near the town of Tibiao, Antique Philippines.  

To realize this dream, she needs a working capital of Php 10,000 to purchase 10 sacks of rice for her business.  Mrs. Delecia has faith in God that she can achieve her dreams someday, if she has patience and is industrious.

loans.use: fruit and vegetable vending

loans.name: Magdiel

texts.es:
Magdiel es socia del Banco Comunal Imperio.

Magdiel es casada, tiene 21 años y 1 hijo, Magdiel vende golosinas variadas en la puerta de su casa, que se ubica cerca de la posta de Licenciados, actividad que realiza diariamente. Magdiel tiene proyectado cambiar de negocio por la venta de ropa.
Magdiel necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa variada.

Magdiel sueña con tener una casa propia, local estable y tener un taller de confecciones.
texts.en:
Magdiel is a member of the Imperio communal bank. She is married, is 21-years-old, and has one son. Magdiel sells various candy at the entrance of her house, which is located near the lawyer's office. She does this every day. Magdiel plans to change her business and to start selling clothing. She needs a loan of 900 soles, money that she will invest in the purchase of various clothing. Magdiel dreams about having her own home, a stable locale, and having a dressmaking shop.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Magdiel needs a loan of 900 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of various clothing

loans.name: Reat

texts.en: Mr. S. is 30 years old and grows vegetable crops to sell. He lives in Siem Reap Province. He is married to Mrs. Khorn and has two children. He works growing vegetables to sell with his wife, and started his business in 1998 and can earn around $2.17 per day. This business is supporting his family's living. It has gone well, and he sells to his regular customers who come to buy at his house. Now, his crop is growing but it is being damaged by insects. Hence, he would like to ask for a loan to purchase insecticide to protect his vegetable crop.

loans.use: to purchase insecticide to protect his vegetable crop

loans.name: Mutesayire

texts.en:
Greetings from MUTESAYIRE S. in Gatenga Sector, Kicukiro District, Kigali the capital city of Rwanda! S. is 33 years old, married with one child and one orphan.

S. started her business 3 years ago .She owns a clothes store where she sells different men's and women's clothes in Kimironko market. She employs 2 persons who help her to run this business and she earns about 85,000Rwf as the monthly profit.

This entrepreneur is requesting a loan worth 515,000Rwf, which will help her to expand the business. This loan will be repaid in 8 months.

loans.use: Expand her Business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
This is an entrepreneur who believes in hard work. She has been in the sale of foodstuffs like maize and crates of eggs for the past seven years. She is called Mary K. and she is 56 years old, married with eight children. All her kids are in school.

Mary lives at Berekum, a suburb of Sunyani, in Ghana. She treks to the surrounding villages to buy her foodstuffs (maize) and crates of eggs and transports them to the regional capitals for sale. She says it is a very lucrative business. Trading in foodstuffs has been her major source of livelihood because it has a big market share.

Her major challenge has been with adequate funds to make business progress. Mary requests this loan to buy more maize (cereals) and crates of eggs to increase her inventory even in the lean season. Mary belongs to a village bank called ‘Haggai’. She hopes to receive GHS 800 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: to buy more maize (cereals) and crates of eggs

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.en:
Maria Rosario is 42 years old and has 4 children. She is married although her husband is not currently in Guatemala. She is dedicated to making traditional blouses and has done this work for over 15 years. In addition to her sewing business, Maria Rosario also sells corn at the market in San Martín, a small city about 70km from Guatemala City. She is asking for a loan in order to buy cloth and corn in bulk. By doing so she is hoping to increase her profits and help expand her business. Her dream is that her children continue to study so that they will have a brighter future.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Bouch, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Rosario tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos. Su esposo por ahora no esta en Guatemala. Ella se dedica a fabricar blusas típicas desde hace 15 años. También vende maíz en el Mercado de San Martín. Su crédito lo necesita para comprar telas y maíz para que su negocio sea más grande. Sus sueños son que sus hijos sigan estudiando para que el día de mañana sean mejores.

loans.use: Bulk purchase of cloth and corn

loans.name: Magdali

texts.es: Magdali trabaja como docente en la Escuela Diriangen  desde hace 3 años, es madre soltera, tiene una hija de 2 años de edad, el papá de su hija le pasa una pensión alimenticia, está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 3er crédito para invertirlo en la construccion de una habitacion.  Magdali se caracteriza por ser una joven honesta y muy trabajadora, actualmente está estudiando  su 3er año en la Universidad URACCAN, vive en la colonia San Antonio a unos 25 km de Nueva Guinea, todos los dias ella tiene que madrugar a las cuatro de la mañana para dejar hechos los quehaceres del hogar y viajar a caballo a una hora de camino a la comarca San Ramon a impartir el pan de la enseñanza a niños campesinos, su sueño es terminar de construir su vivienda y así gozar de mejores condiciones, que a su hijita no le falte nada  y tener estabilidad laboral.
texts.en:
Magdali has worked as a teacher at the Diriangen School for the last 3 years. She is a single mother, has a daughter who is 2 years of age and her daughter's father provides child support. She is applying for refinancing of her third loan to invest in the construction of a room. Magdali is a young and hard working women and she is currently in her third year of studies at the URACCAN University. She lives in the San Antonio neighborhood 25 km away from Nueva Guinea. Everyday she has to get up early at 4:00 a.m. to leave the household chores done and travel an hour on horseback to the San Ramon region to teach rural children. She dreams are to finish building her home and enjoy better conditions, that her daughter has everything she needs and to have job stability.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a room

loans.name: Kuña Rory Group

texts.es:
En la Ciudad de Carapeguá en el barrio Calixtro distante a 4km de la oficina de Carapeguá uñas señoras de escasos recursos se enteraron del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de Fundacion Paraguaya y decidieron reunirse para recibir una información sobre el mencionado programa.
 
Estas Señoras son activas muy trabajadoras y se dedican a las actividades ya mencionados mas abajo. Ellas buscando un poco mas de apoyo para fomentar atravez del crédito susingresos familiares y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Necesitan de esta operación crediticia para invertir en sus respectivos trabajos y así poder lograr un crecimiento sostenible que les haga crecer como grupo y en forma individual.

Las integrantes son:

CLAUDELINA P.	Venta de Leche y Huevo
FRANCISCA A.	Peluquera
NILSA M.	Vendedora
GLORIA B.	Almacèn
GLADYS A.	Almacèn
CAMILA TOÑANEZ	Empleada
GILDA A.	Vendedora
SIXTA A.	Vendedora
ROSA A. 	Venta de productos avon
MA-CANDIDA M.	Venta de ropas
FELIPA G.	Almacèn
ANA M.	Ventade pollos 
MIRTA A.	Docente
JUANA D.	Docente
MIRIAN A.	Almacèn
DIONICIA A.	Venta de leche
texts.en:
In the Calixtro neighborhood of Carapeguá city, 4 km from the Carapeguá office, four women of scant resources entered the program Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras of the Paraguay Foundation. They decided to get together to receive information about the program. These women are active and hard working. They are engaged in the activities listed below. They are looking for a little more support. A loan will give their family income a boost and improve their quality of life. They need operating capital to invest in their respective jobs. Then they can achieve sustainable growth. This will make them grow individually and as a group. The members are: Claudelina P.: Sale of Milk and Eggs Francisca A.: Hairdresser Nilsa M.: Sales Person Gloria B.: Grocery Store Gladis A.: Grocery Story Camila Toñanez: Employee Gilda A.: Sales Person Sixta A.: Sales Person Rosa A.: Avon Sales Ma-Candida M.: Sells Clothes Felipa G.: Grocery Store Ana M.: Sells Chickens Mirta A.: Teacher Juana D.: Teacher Mirian A.: Grocery Store Dionicia A.: Sells Milk

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Most members will invest in their activities as described (clothes, noodles, sugar, herbs, rice, drinks, fabric, starch,  corn flour, etc.)

loans.name: Saturnina's Group

texts.es:
La señora Saturnina  es socia del Banco Comunal “Yunga Uyo” en  Distrito de Yunguyo, la  provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 48 años de edad, estado civil casada 04 hijos, Vive en el Barrio Alto la Florida,  ella posee estudios de primaria incompleta (segundo grado). 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 8 años, La señora Saturnina tiene se dedica a compra y venta de frutas, su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles.

Actualmente ella desea un préstamo adicional de S/ 1000.00 nuevos soles; este préstamo le servirá para comprar variedades de frutas, (plátanos, naranjas, peras, mandarinas, manzanas, uvas) y venderlos en el Mercado 15 de Agosto. Su sueño es poner una gran tienda completando con abarrotes, ya que nos indica que la venta esta algo baja.
 
Asimismo ella refiere que le gusta mucha el cumplimiento de sus compañeras y la forma de trabajo, de Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Saturnina is a member of the Yunga Uyo community bank in the Yunguyo district, Chucuito province, Puno department. She is 48, married, and has four children. She lives in the Alto la Florida neighborhood. She has a second grade education. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for eight years. Saturnina buys and sells fruit. Her first loan was for 300 PEN. She currently wants an additional loan for 1,000 PEN. She will buy a variety of fruit (bananas, oranges, pears, mandarins, apples, grapes) and sell them at the 15 de Agosto market. Her dream is to have a big store filled with groceries. Sales are down a bit. She really likes the fulfillment of working with her colleagues and the way Manuela Ramos works.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bananas, oranges, pears, mandarins, apples, grapes

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
In the rural village of Sta. Maria (Dupax Del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya), Nimfa and Arben M. live happily with their four children.  All their children are in elementary school. Despite the hardships of life, they have a strong determination to send their children to college, because they want them to become successful someday. 
The couple works hard for their children so that they will able to give them a better future. Nimfa raises pigs while her husband tills their farm lot, where they usually plant rice and vegetables. Nimfa is requesting PHP10, 000 to sustain her hog-raising business. to buy their feed. She also hopes to buy at least 3 piglets to raise so that her business becomes big.

loans.use: Business Capital

location.town: Sta. Maria, Dupax Del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed R. is a young hairdresser and sells Hair Products such as hair creams, wigs and hair pomade in Hohoe. Mohammed has received a junior high education.  She is single and has no dependants. She is responsible for paying her utility bills, and feeding and clothing herself.  With the increase in R.'s customer base, her loan will be used to buy a hair dryer and hair products to attain to the customers. She hopes to save the new profits from her business.

loans.use: To buy a hair dryer and hair products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional inventory in bulk.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort A. is married and has two children. She has received schooling through senior high school. Comfort sells beans and red-red (a dish made with cowpeas) at Atabadze near Elmina, which she has done since 2004. Her husband is self employed. Comfort uses his income to pay for school fees and other bills. She will use the loan to purchase more beans, plantain and other ingredients for the preparation of food for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort plans to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for preparing food for resale.

loans.name: Avelita

texts.en:
Avelita V. is from the town of D'Ban, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. Avelita is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Avelita owns and operates a business venture in the arts sector, operating a handicraft business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling general handicrafts to tourists and local community members. Avelita has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2003, Avelita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Avelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Avelita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional handicrafts to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Avelita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional handicrafts to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is happily married with 4 children and she is 30 years old. Mary sells crates of drinks and she also sells cooked food in her shop. Mary hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more crates of drinks and foodstuffs. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks and foodstuffs

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es: Candida Rosa Martínez P. tiene 41 años, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta y elaboración de tortillas, todos los días se levanta muy temprano ya que tiene que limpiar su vivienda y además tiene que llevar el maíz a un molino en donde pasa por un proceso y obtiene lo necesario la masa, después de la elaboración, Rosa tiene que arreglar su triciclo en donde ofrecerá sus tortillas a sus clientes, a pesar del inmenso calor que siente tiene que hacer todo lo posible por salir adelante, ya que es una madre muy responsable y les ha enseñado a sus hijos a ganarse la vida con mucho esfuerzo y de una manera digna. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de leña, maíz, cal, bolsas plásticas, comal. Su deseo es que su hija logre finalizar sus estudios y así el día de mañana puedan ayudarla recuperar todos los sacrificios que ha hecho.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is married to Rolando, a farmer. She is 44 years old, blessed with four children, three of them are married.  They are living in a peaceful village of Sillawit, five to seven kilometers from the city proper of Cauayan City.

Marivic is engaged in the barbecue vending business for almost one year until she decided to venture into retailing business.  Her weekly net income is PHP1,000.00.  She is now borrowing  a loan of PHP7,000 from the KIVA lenders as additional working capital and for her business expansion. She's been working so hard to support her family and she wants to improve more her business.

loans.use: Additional Capital in her retail store

loans.name: Nelson Cecilio

texts.es: Don Nelson tiene su tienda donde ofrece el servicio de internet, y tiene también su cabina telefónica pública, es una persona muy responsable, con sólo 26 años de edad ya tiene su negocio bien establecido, el cual fue creciendo poco a poco, su hermana mayor es quien le apoya en sus proyectos y le impulsa a terminar sus estudios en la universidad, vive en la casa de sus padres donde también colabora con los gastos de la casa. Es un cliente antiguo de la institución y el crédito que solicita es para la compra de accesorios para computadora para mejorar el servicio al cliente.
texts.en:
Don Nelson has a shop where he offers Internet service and a public phone booth. For being only 26 years old, he is a responsible person and already has an established business that has been steadily growing. His older sister helps him with his endeavors and encourages him to finish his college education. Nelson lives at home with his parents and contributes toward the household expenses. He is a long-time client of the Institution and is requesting a loan to buy computer accessories so that he can provide better service to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase computer accessories

loans.name: Mawuli Group

texts.en:
Rosina is 35 years old, divorced and the mother of a child in junior high school in the community where they live, a suburb of the eastern region of Ghana. Rosina, a rice and stew vendor in the community market, works very hard to support her child's basic needs. She started her operation about three years ago, but her food production is low because of inadequate funds to support her business. She is therefore requesting the loan to buy more meat, vegetables, and bags of rice to increase her business' efficiency, market share and profitability.

Rosina, the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Mawuli,’ which literary means There is God, is the one seated in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and farmers. In this group, members act as social collateral to access the loan and utilize peer pressure to ensure repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, vegetables, meat and firewood etc.

loans.name: Luaiva

texts.en:
Luaiva U. is a 48-year-old woman living in the town of Pesega. She is married and has five adult children.

Luaiva owns and operates a tailoring business, providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 400 WST a month.

In 2009, Luaiva joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting for a loan from SPBD. Luaiva is now requesting a new loan of 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles and thread. The loan will be her 2nd from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.


About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles and thread

loans.name: Zyinatkan's Group

texts.en:
The leader of the group Zyinatkan comes from the city of Karabalta. She has lived a simple life, raising three children. After the children grew up and left to work she still engaged herself in doing her everyday work around the house. She keeps some cattle and manages to earn a certain amount of money by selling milk.

The children have begun to make their own living. The eldest and the middle brothers are married and live separately. The youngest son, now 21, is also married. But according to Central Asian tradition, the youngest son stays with his parents to take care of them once they get old.

Life in the rural area has been more attractive to Zyinatkan than the life in a bustling city. The fresh air and everyday work of raising cattle have kept Zyinatkan young. She loves the way she lives and enjoys every day of her life. Now that her son is by her side and helps look after the cattle, her life is even easier.

Selling milk brings Zyinatkan about $70 a month. Because of this money, Zyinatkan has been able to make some repairs at home. One thing that concerns Zyinatkan is the winter season. They need coal to get through it. Zyinatkan has applied for this loan to purchase a sufficient amount of coal. Zyinatkan’s partners are: Ainur, 45, keeps cattle and sells milk. Her husband helps Ainur around the house. They have five children: four daughters and one son. Two daughters live separately. Ainur needs a loan to prepare a dowry for their third daughter. Farida, 44, and her husband are raising four children. They keep cattle and farm. They make their living by selling milk and onions that they grew. Farida needs a loan to make a repair at her house. Her goal is to give all her children a good education. Mirbek, 21, is single. He is already making his own living. He has a trailer and offers transportation services. Besides that, he raises livestock and sells milk. Mirbek needs a loan to buy fuel for sowing. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and the Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy coal for the winter season

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma de 50 años es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella quien vive en casa de un familiar lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila. Es así que tiene un negocio, que es la venta de ropa extranjera, desde ese momento se dedica a la venta ambulatoria en las principales ferias de la ciudad de Juliaca, durante todos los días de la semana. Irma es una vendedora muy persuasiva y siempre convence a sus clientes de llevarse alguna prenda, ya que la parte que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y es buena dando consejos y proponer que prendas pueden usar. De esta manera lleva 13 años realizando esta actividad, siendo lo más duro y complicado es llevar los fardos de ropa que son muy pesados al lugar de venta. Con el tiempo espera juntar el capital necesario para instalar un puesto en el mercado San José (Mercado Importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), en donde pueda vender con más comodidad sus prendas. Este es su séptimo préstamo con MFP, por lo que esta muy contenta, asimismo se compromete a pagar todas sus cuotas sin demora, además se le considera como una persona muy alegre y trabajadora y por ello los integrantes de su banco comunal la estiman mucho. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más ropa extranjera, para así poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad de prendas para elegir.
texts.en:
Irma is 50 years old and very hardworking woman. She lives in the home of a relative and desires to have a peaceful retirement. To achieve this goal she has a business selling imported clothing. At the moment, she sells her merchandise as a traveling vendor through the main fairs in the city of Juliaca every day of the week. Irma is a very persuasive saleswoman and always convinces her customers to leave with some clothing. The part of her job that she enjoys the most is conversing with her customers and providing them good advice as to what clothing they should wear. Irma has been in business for 13 years. The hardest and most complicated part is transporting the heavy bundles of clothing to the places where she sells. In time, she hopes to acquire enough capital to secure a vending post at the San José Market (the largest market in the city of Juliaca), where it will be more convenient for her to sell her products.

This is her seventh loan with MFP. She is very happy and agrees to make all of her payments on time. Irma is also regarded as cheerful and hardworking, thereby making her one of the most respected members of her Communal Bank. With her loan of 1000 soles, Irma will buy more imported clothing so that she can offer her customers a wider selection.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: María De Jesús

texts.es:
La Sra. María de Jesús L. vende desayunos en el mercado Israel lewite de Managua.
María va usar el crédito para comprar un termo y un microonda. 
Quiere un microonda para hacer comida rápida y un termo para poner gaseosas ya que el tiene se encuentra en mal estado y a si podrá tener mas ingresos.
Su negocio comenzó cuando María tenía 35 años y dejo de trabajar como domestica, y quiso poner su propio negocio esto debido a que quería estar mas cerca de su hijo, y este fue creciendo poco a poco.
María ha tenido su propio tramo en el mercado para 32 años. Trabaja cada día de 8 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde.
Ella espera que con la compra del termo y el microonda la clientela aumente.
María  es  viuda y madre de dos hijos estos ya no dependen de ella.
Este es el veinte y uno crédito que María ha tenido con CEPRODEL. 
Ha trabajado con ceprodel 4 años, y los financiamientos le han ayudado mucho a su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. María de Jesús L. sells breakfasts in the Israel Lewites Market of Managua. María will use the loan to buy a cooler and a microwave. She needs a microwave to make meals rapidly and a cooler for soft drinks, since the one she has is in bad condition. With these she will earn more income. María began her business when she was 35 years old, when she stopped working as a domestic servant. She desired to start her own business in order to be close to her son. Her business has been growing little by little. María has had her own stall in the public market for 32 years. She works every day from 8:00 AM until 4:00 PM. She hopes that with the purchase of a cooler and a microwave her clientèle will grow. María is a widow and the mother of 2 children who no longer depend on her. This is María's 21st loan with CEPRODEL. She has worked with CEPRODEL for 4 years and her past loans have helped her business a great deal.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY A COOLER AND A MICROWAVE FOR HER BUSINESS

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel A. is from the village of Poblacion 1 in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old. Maricel is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Maricel sells new clothing to local community members. Maricel has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Maricel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maricel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50000 PHP from GDMPC. Maricel is requesting a new loan of 50000 PHP to expand her business. This will be Maricel's 17th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en: With a solid, loyal client base, Jenny approached ACCION USA for the capital and know-how she needed to expand her home-based cosmetics business. With her one-year old daughter by her side Jenny enjoys being her own boss. Having weathered the recent financial crisis, Jenny feels she is now in a good position to grow her business. With the knowledge she gained at ACCION USA's educational seminars Jenny plans to continue expanding her business, supporting her family, and increasing her independence. She placed her loan request well in advance of Valentine's Day, so she was ready to capitalize on this big sales opportunity. Jenny was so happy working with ACCION USA that she often refers other entrepreneurial friends. Originally from Honduras, Jenny feels that she is living proof that you can achieve what you dream. About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA: Have you ever thought about how the cute new café on your corner or the salon you frequent every month got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated ten million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis”. Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education. Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild our economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita C. is from the village of Malinao, Gingoog city. She is 57 years old. Emerita is widowed and has 7 adult children.  She owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop.  The main source of income for the business comes from selling food & daily use products in the local community. Emerita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. 

In 2003, Emerita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emerita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. This new loan will be the 8th she has taken out from HSPFI.  Emerita is requesting 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Dany

texts.es:
La Sra. Dany, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín y Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 37 años y tiene 03 hijos que aun depende de ella y están estudiando.
Dany, es una persona que a tenido muchas dificultades en su vida, nos cuenta que por iniciativa propia, decidió iniciar su negocio de venta de salchipapas y salchipollo, ubicado en una esquina de su casa  donde hay bastante movimiento, lleva 05 años dedicándose al negocio .Con su primer préstamo de 300.00 Nuevos Soles y siempre con el apoyo de su pareja comprarón su carrito salchipapero.
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará, pollos en javas, sacos de papas, paquetes de aceites y parte del dinero lo invertirá en comprar utensilios de cocina, para reemplazar a los que tiene actualmente y así brindar un mejor servicio y atención a sus clientes. 
Dany, se siente muy contenta y feliz por el trabajo que realiza día a día y agradece bastante al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad de crecer cómo pequeña empresaria, su sueño es tener su propio local y seguir con la venta de salchipapa y salchipollo.
texts.en:
La Sra. Dany, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín y Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 37 años y tiene 03 hijos que aun depende de ella y están estudiando. Dany, es una persona que a tenido muchas dificultades en su vida, nos cuenta que por iniciativa propia, decidió iniciar su negocio de venta de salchipapas y salchipollo, ubicado en una esquina de su casa donde hay bastante movimiento, lleva 05 años dedicándose al negocio .Con su primer préstamo de 300.00 Nuevos Soles y siempre con el apoyo de su pareja comprarón su carrito salchipapero. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará, pollos en javas, sacos de papas, paquetes de aceites y parte del dinero lo invertirá en comprar utensilios de cocina, para reemplazar a los que tiene actualmente y así brindar un mejor servicio y atención a sus clientes. Dany, se siente muy contenta y feliz por el trabajo que realiza día a día y agradece bastante al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad de crecer cómo pequeña empresaria, su sueño es tener su propio local y seguir con la venta de salchipapa y salchipollo.
