Translated from Spanish by Alex Jaffe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprarà ingredientes para la preparación de sus alimentos.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr: Née le 27 Février 1964 à Kétou au Bénin, D. Mariam est mariée à SOUMANOU Yaya, un chauffeur. Le couple a cinq enfants à charge, dont quatre sont leurs propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés et vivent ensemble avec leurs parents dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Mariam  vient en aide à son mari et supporte avec lui les différentes charges de la famille. C'est depuis 20 ans que Mariam exerce l'activité de la vente de produits de soins (dentifrices, brosses à dents, savons, etc.) à son domicile. Mariam s'approvisionne à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariam a bénéficié une fois de crédit auprès de ALIDé, et a bien effectué les remboursements. Mariam désire augmenter son fonds de roulement et renforcer son activité, afin d'être plus compétitive sur le marché et se faire plus de revenu. C'est ce qui amène Mariam à solliciter auprès de ALIDé, un second prêt.
texts.en:
Born 27 February 1964 in Kétou in Benin, Mariam D. is married to Yaya SOUMANOU, a driver. The couple cares for five children, of whom four are their own. All the children have had schooling and live together with their parents in the Sèmè-Podji commune. Mariam helps her husband in dealing with the various family expenses. Some twenty years ago, Mariam started retailing personal care products from her home (toothpaste, toothbrushes, soap, etc.). She gets her supplies from Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Mariam has already been granted one loan from ALIDé, which was correctly repaid in full. She wants to increase her turnover and reinforce her activity, so that she can become more competitive in her line of business and generate more income. This is why she is requesting a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cartons of toothpaste, toothbrushes and soap

loans.name: Simiente Escogida Group

texts.es:
el grupo Simiente Escogida esta ubicado en San Marcos de Colon, son personas muy unidas y trabajan desde hace varios años atras. a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan en su diario vivir:
el sr. Nelson Wilfredo Davia tiene 40 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos que dependen de el y se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva en la comunidad de San Marcos de Colon, tiene 5 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad.
tambien es el encargado del gimnasio municipal, utilizara el credito para comprar ropa.
cuando esta trabajando en el gimnasio aprovecha a vender su ropa sport.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar y para mantener a su familia.

la sra. Ruth Yanely M. es una persona muy activa y se dedica a la venta de comidas como: nacatamales,
sopa de mondongo y donas. Ruth tiene dos hijos y esta casada, su esposo trabaja de albañil en varias construcciones.
Ruth tiene 35 años de edad.
el credito lo utilizara para abastecerse de algunos alimentos y materiales para preparar sus comidas y golosinas. 

el sr. Ramon Antonio S. es un joven carpintero que tiene su taller en el barrio Candelaria de San Marcos
de Colon, tiene un hijo de 2 añitos y una esposa que se dedica a atender a los cientes mostrandole los muebles que Ramon fabrica. 
Ramon tiene 5 años de dedicarce a este tipo de actividad. 
el credito lo utilizara para ampliar sus instalaciones y asi exibir sus muebles en su casa.
texts.en:
The Simiente Escogia group is located in San Marcos de Colon. They are very united people, and they have been working for several years. What follows are details of the different activities they do in their daily lives. Nelson Wilfredo Davia is 40, and he has three children who are dependent upon him. He sells new clothes in the San Marcos de Colon community. He has been doing this type of activity for five years. He also is in charge of the municipal gymnasium. He will use the loan to buy clothes. When he is working at the gym he takes advantage of that time to sell his sports clothes. He needs the income to cover the household expenses and to support his family. Ruth Yanely M. is a very active person. She sells food like “nacatamales” (a traditional Central American dish similar to a tamale), tripe soup, and doughnuts. Ruth is married and has two children. Her husband works as a bricklayer at various buildings. Ruth is 35. She will use the loan to stock up on some food and materials to prepare her meals and sweets. Ramon Antonio S. is a young carpenter. He has his shop in the Candelaria de San Marcos neighborhood in Colon. He has a two year old child. His wife waits on the customers and shows them the furniture that Ramon makes. Ramon has been doing this type of work for five years. He will use the loan to expand his facilities and show his furniture in his house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy new clothes, accessories for women, wood furniture, pork and chicken, vegetables, corn flour, shortening, condiments, wheat flour, sugar, tripe, and firewood

loans.name: El Vallecito Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. LUZ ESTHER, TIENE 58 AÑOS D. EDAD, Y TIENE 4 HIJOS YA ADULTOS, ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO "EL VALLECITO", JUNTO CON 9 PERSONAS MAS RESIDENTES DEL DISTRITO D. CARABAYLLO. LA SRA. LUZ ESTHER FUÉ ELEGIDA POR SUS COMPAÑEROS COMO LA PRESIDENTA D. LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA DEL GRUPO.
LA SRA. LUZ ESTHER, INICIÓ HACE CUATRO AÑOS SU NEGOCIO D. VENTA D. CALZADO, AL INICIÓ EMPEZÓ D. FORMA AMBULATORIA, Y OFRECIENDO D. CASA EN CASA A SUS AMIGOS Y CONOCIDOS, AL VER QUE SU NEGOCIO CRECÍA Y QUE TENÍA MAS CLIENTES E INGRESOS SE ANIMÓA A ALQUILAR UN PUESTO EN EL MERCADO.
CON SU TRABAJAO A CONSEGUIDO ARREGLAR SU CASA, TENER ESTABILIDAD E INDEPENDENCIA ECONÓMICA.
SU PROXIMA META SERÍA TENER UN LOCAL PROPIO, CON MUCHO MERCADERÍA EN CALZADO.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO UTILIZARÁ PARA COMPRAR CALZADO D. PREFERENCIA PARA DAMAS, PARA APROVECHAR LA CAMPAÑA POR EL DÍA D. LA MADRE.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luz Esther is 58, and has 4 adult children. She is a member of the group “El Vallecito” along with 9 more residents of the Carabayllo District. Mrs. Luz Esther was elected president of the Board by the members. Four years ago she began her business of selling shoes from house to house to friends and acquaintances. When she saw that her business was growing and she had more customers and earnings, she decided to rent a stand in the market. With her business she was able to fix up her house, and to have economic independence and stability. Her next goal is to have her own stand, with a lot of inventory of shoes. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy shoes, particularly women’s shoes, for the sales for Mother’s Day.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes for sales for Mother's Day

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase new chairs for his barber shop

loans.name: Lester Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Lester Antonio U. B., es casado y su esposa realiza los trabajos del hogar, con sus tres hijos menores de edad, habitan en el Barrio Lomas de Guadalupe,  él labora como chofer de rutas urbanas, ellos son una familia muy humilde que con su propio esfuerzo edificaron el humilde hogar donde ahora residen.

Es para su vivienda que solicita un préstamo para la construcción de un levantamiento de tapia, que le resolverá el problema de división de territorio que posee actualmente con sus vecinos aledaños, con el crédito realizara las compras de  materiales de construcción, agradecerá el apoyo que se le pudiese dar ya que con esta inversión les podrá ofrecer una mayor seguridad para todos sus pequeños hijos y la tranquilidad como padres de criar a sus hijos en un ambiente más seguro y cómodo.
texts.en:
Señor Lester Antonio U. B. is married; his wife looks after the household. They and their three children live in the neighbourhood of Lomas de Guadalupe. Lester works as a driver in the town. The family is a simple one, but with hard work they have built a humble home where they now live. It is for this house that Lester is asking for a loan. He wishes to repair a wall and solve the problem with his neighbours over division of land. With the money he plans to buy construction material. He is grateful for the loan and the greater security that the wall will provide to his young family. It will bring him and his wife as parents peace of mind to know that they will be raising their children in a safer, more comfortable environment.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction material

loans.name: Francy De La Concepción

texts.es:
Francy de la Concepción V.  O. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora. Ella 1993 inicio con poco capital a comercializar ropa usada luego con forme fue creciendo e invirtió en cosméticos de la marca Avon y Zermat, calzado y  ropa nueva.
Ella sueña con tener su propio local ya que ella vende de manera ambulante junto con su hija de 13 años quien le ayuda en el comercio después de clases.
texts.en:
Francy de la Concepción V. O. is a hard-working, dedicated, and enterprising woman. In 1993 she used a small amount of capital to start selling used clothes. Later, her business was growing and she invested in Avon and Zermant brands of cosmetics, footwear, and new clothes. She dreams of having her own place because she sells on foot. She sells with her 13 year old daughter, who helps her with the business after classes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cosmetics, clothes, and footwear

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
At the age of 55 years old, Concepcion F. wants to start a savings fund for her old age. She can’t depend on her children for all her needs as well as her husband’s needs in their older years, because she is aware of the economic conditions of having their own family. 

Her two older children are employed as a hired farmer and as a hired laborer whose incomes are small and sporadic. Concepcion wants to support them and their children financially. She really hopes that someday her grandchildren will be able to have a life that is much better than what they are having now. Concepcion’s two younger children have no family yet, and they depend on all of their needs to be supported by their parents. They are unemployed because of the fact that either they did not finish college or that they never reached college level. 

With all the challenges Concepcion and her family are facing everyday of their lives, she never loses hope that one day all of them will be out from under the umbrella of poverty. Starting to reach her goals, she raises pigs for selling after four months, either alive or slaughtered. This is financed by the loans she receives from ASHI where she has been a member since 2008. 

Proceeds from her business have changed the kind of life experienced by her family. Concepcion is very happy for this; thus, she wants to continuously request larger loans to grow her business and sustain its operation.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feed for fattening and selling

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita A. owns and operates a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling both food and daily use products in her community. She changed her business from buying and selling fish to retailing different household products because she is trying to have a business which will generate more income. She is 54 years old, married and has four school-age children. They are from the village of Barangay 25, Pandan, Gingoog City. Teresita has been in her business for more than a year and earns approximately 8,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Teresita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her fourth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

location.town: Barangay 25, Pandan, Gingoog City, Mis. Or.

loans.name: Mana Chrity

texts.fr:
Agée de 40 ans, cette dame reste très active. Elle est revendeuse de charbons de bois. Elle voyage régulièrement à l'intérieur du pays pour s'approvisionner, notamment SOTOUBOUA, BLITTA. Elle y achète des sacs de charbons de bois. Elle associe à ce commerce, la vente de céréales et de miel.
elle vend ses marchandises à la devanture de son domicile. Le crédit actuellement sollicité est destiné à l'achat de 15 sacs de charbons de bois, 5 sacs de maïs, 3 sacs de mil et 2 bidons de miel.
Elle compte sur l’accroissement de ses activités grâce à ce nouveau crédit pour mieux contribuer aux charges familiales.
texts.en:
This lady, aged 40, is very active. She sells charcoal. She travels regularly to the back-country to stock up, notably to SOTOUBOUA and BLITTA. There, she buys sacks of charcoal. She also sells cereals and honey. She sells her goods in front of her domicile. This loan will allow her to buy 15 sacks of charcoal, 3 sacks of millet, and 2 jerrycans of honey. She is counting on growing her businesses thanks to this new loan so that she can better contribute to family expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of charcoal, millet, and honey

loans.name: Victor Elias

texts.es:
Víctor de 49 años, el es mecánico y tiene cinco hijos de 22, 19, 15, 13 y 9 años su esposa vende almuerzos para ayudar con los gastos familiares, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil. 

El tiene ya años trabajando como mecánico en su propio taller, comenzó cuando lo despidieron de su trabajo y como no encontraba trabajo decidió abrir su propio taller mecánico, ahora trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días. El hace toco tipo de reptaciones a carros. 

El quiere comprar con el préstamo herramientas para poder reparar mas vehículos, en el futuro quiere termina de construir su casa y hacer adecuaciones a su taller.
texts.en:
Víctor, 49, is an auto mechanic. He has five children who are 22, 19, 15, 13 and 9 years of age. His wife sells prepared lunches to help meet family expenses. He lives in Guayaquil’s Beltway. He has worked as a mechanic in his own shop for several years. He started when he lost his job and, not finding new employment, decided to open his own auto repair shop. He is open from 8am until 8pm every day. He performs all types of auto repairs. He wants to buy tools with the loan in order to be able to repair more vehicles. In the future he’d like to finish building his house and refurbish his shop.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For tools.

loans.name: Karla Vanesa

texts.es: Karla Vanesa R. M. es una mujer joven, quien es dueña de una miscelánea y venta de licor la cual adquirió desde hace 2 años gracias a la inversión que hicieron sus padres. Esta mujer ahora puede sentirse realizada gracias a que puede ocupar su tiempo en cosas productivas y que lleven ingresos a su hogar. Ella utilizará el crédito otorgado en la compra de distintos productos de mucho movimiento en su negocio.
texts.en:
Karla Vanesa R. M. is a young woman who owns a general store; she also sells liquor. She got it two years ago thanks to an investment her parents made. She can now feel fulfilled because she can use her time in productive activities that produce income for her home. She will use the loan to buy various types of products that sell well in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products.

loans.name: Antasyo

texts.en: Antasyo P. is currently in the business of selling clothes  and is requesting a loan to stock more clothes to sell.  Antasyo is 29 years old and is married to a husband who is a tailor. She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a concrete house.

loans.use: Stock more clothes to sell

loans.name: Ivan Enrique

texts.es:
“La Súper Arepa” es el negocio que  Iván Álvarez, de 26 años, inició desde hace un poco más de cinco años,  para resolver los ingresos de su familia cuando contrajo matrimonio y debía asumir su nueva responsabilidad. Así fue como inició con su carrito de madera y gradualmente ha ido agregándole las sillas, fogones, ollas y un molino al que èl mismo adaptò un motor; porque sus arepas son muy naturales y están fabricadas con el más puro y fresco maíz. En la actualidad vive con su cónyuge y su hijo de 7 años de edad en el barrio Las Nieves de Barranquilla, ubicado al sur de esta ciudad, que tiene muchas características típicas de la cultura caribe arraigadas, como la música y las fiestas por cualquier actividad y su cultura es un aporte a la conservación de las tradiciones populares, lo cual favorece el mercado permanente de Iván Enrique.
Su credikiva  es el primer financiamiento de Iván y como sueña con empezar a ampliarlo y diversificarlo, lo invertirá en la compra de su materia prima al por mayor  y adecuar su carro en el que vende el producto;  más adelante piensa crear varias unidades de negocios, ubicadas estratégicamente pensando en aumentar sus ingresos,  para ofrecerle un futuro promisorio a su familia especialmente a su hijo y constituir un capital que en el futuro convierta esta actividad en una gran empresa familiar.
texts.en:
Iván Álvarez, twenty-six, started his business, "The Super Arepa," a little more than five years ago to secure his family's income when he got engaged and had to assume his new responsibility.  He started out with a wooden cart and has gradually added chairs, a burner, pots and a grinder, which he retrofitted with a motor because his arepas are very natural, made with the purest and freshest corn.  

He currently lives with his partner and seven-year-old son in the Las Nieves de Barranquilla neighborhood, south of the city.  It has many of the typical Caribbean cultural characteristics, like the music and fiestas, which help conserve the popular traditions that favor Iván Enrique's permanent market. 

This is Iván's first Kiva loan.  Because he dreams of beginning to expand and diversify his business, he plans to invest in some wholesale supplies and fix up the car he uses to sell his product.  Later he's thinking about starting up several branches, strategically located to increase his income so he can offer his family, and especially his son, a promising future, and turn his business into a large family enterprise.

loans.use: To buy wholesale supplies and fix up the car he uses to sell his product.

loans.name: Ung

texts.en:
Ung P., 31, sells chickens in the local market in Takeo province. She is married with two children who are still living at home, and her husband works in construction. She typically makes about US $6 each day and would like a loan to expand her business. She has many sources of income, one of which is weaving as she is pictured going here.

Since she spends a lot on transportation, she is asking for a loan of US $800 to purchase a motorbike to transport chickens to sell at the local market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa P. is from the village of Lawis. She is 45 years old and single. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-five years and earns approximately $285 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Josefa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Josefa is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 5th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena T. is 38 years old and married. She supports her family by operating a business of selling salted eggs. She lives in Brgy. Cambaog, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her salted egg business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). Elena is now borrowing PHP 20,000 so that she could continue to purchase more stock of salted eggs to sell. This will be her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Elena aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Calachuchi Group

texts.en:
Jelyn B. is from the village of Sapang Ama in Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 25 years old. Jelyn is the leader of a 2-member loan group sponsored by GDMPC. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Calachuchi.

Jelyn is married and has one young child. To make a living, Jelyn makes and sells longaniza sausage to the local community. Jelyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Jelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jelyn is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be Jelyn's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy materials for her carpet weaving business

loans.name: Davron

texts.en:
T. Davron is 50 years old. He is married and has one child. Davron is the sole breadwinner for his family and his only income comes from the raising and sale of large livestock at the local market. Every year he buys young heifers from the farms in adjacent villages. He raises them with the help of his wife and then sells the adult cows and bulls to local butchers. 

Davron is thinking about expanding his business, since the income from his present herd isn't enough to provide for his family. He plans to purchase additional young cattle. To do this, he needs to invest an additional 7,500 TJS in his business. In order to receive this amount, Davron has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner organization, IMON International.    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing young cattle to expand his business

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel V. is from the village of Baybay Liloy Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 59 years old. Isabel is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Isabel sells ocean-caught fish in the local community. Isabel has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Isabel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Isabel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. 

Isabel is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be the fifth loan taken by Isabel from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Yudi Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Yudi del Carmen G. E. ella es trabajadora activa de la Empresa “Alcaldía Municipal San Rafael del Sur” desempeñándose como  Auxiliar de Fotocopias tiene  dos años  de trabajar para esta institución. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc.  Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Yudi del Carmen G. E. works at the municipal mayor's office in San Rafael del Sur as a photocopying assistant. She has held this job for 2 years. Yudi has had two previous loans from CEPRODEL that she used to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, stone, gravel, cinder blocks, etc. to expand and improve her house. The CEPRODEL financing has helped improved her house immensely, creating a better quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials such as sand, cement, and stone.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago tiene 60 años de edad, tiene tres hijos y vive en la ciudad de Pisaq de la provincia del Calca departamento del Cusco, Perú.
 
Santiago se dedica a la venta de artesanía de tipo enchapado, el elabora sus productos en el taller que implemento en su domicilio,  nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de artesanía, él tiene un pequeño taller  en su domicilio, él sale a vender sus productos a la plaza principal de la ciudad de Calca, él es una persona amigable y colaborador y por eso pertenece a la Asociación de Artesanos Huayna Condor, él requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales para seguir haciendo sus collares y aretes. Ya son 8 años que se dedica a la venta de artesanía y le ha ido muy bien. 
     
Santiago pertenece al banco comunal “Mosoq Ñusta” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Santiago is 60 years old, has three children, and lives in the city of Pisaq in the Province of Calca, Department of Cusco, Peru.

He sells plated handicrafts.  Santiago makes his products in a workshop that he operates in his home.  He is a friendly and helpful person who is a member of the Huayna Condor Association of Artisans.  Santiago is requesting this loan to buy more materials so that he can continue making necklaces and earrings.  He has been selling crafts for eight years and has done very well.   

Santiago belongs to the Communal Bank “Mosoq Ñusta”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa.  He is grateful for the opportunity provided and promises to complete his payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase materials for making necklaces & earrings

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina, de 59 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de sus tres hijas que son mayores y le ayudan en su labor diaria; juntas se esfuerzan a diario para salir adelante. Desde hace 17 años, esta trabajadora dama se dedica a la venta de golosinas y piqueos en un kiosco que esta ubicado dentro de un colegio de su zona. Esta muy satisfecha pues con este negocio obtiene regulares ganancias que le han permitido sacar adelante a su familia; además le gusta atender a los niños y jóvenes que le suelen comprar en el kiosco, pero a veces no le alcanza tiempo por lo que sus hijas mayores la ayudan. Paralelamente a esta actividad también se dedica a la venta de menú (platillos diarios) que ofrece a sus comensales fijos, que en su mayoría son obreros de construcción que le pagan semanalmente. Para el futuro tiene planeado instalar un restaurante en su casa, pues quiere empezar con un negocio tranquilo y fijo para mejorar sus ganancias. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Marcelina tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio; además quiere pagar la garantía que le permitirá empezar a trabajar en el kiosco del colegio.
texts.en:
Marcelina, 59, lives in her own house next to her three adult daughters who help her with daily work.  Together, they strive every day to get ahead.  For 17 years, this hardworking lady has been selling candy and snacks at a kiosk located inside a school in her area.  She is very pleased with this business for giving her regular income that has allowed her to raise her family.  She also likes to serve the children and teenagers who tend to patronize the kiosk, but sometimes she doesn't have enough time, so her daughters help out.  

Alongside this business, Marcelina also sells daily dishes that she offers to a set of regular customers, most of whom are construction workers who pay weekly.  Her future plans are to install a restaurant in her house because she wants to start a casual and permanent business to improve her profits.  

This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to pay her dues, not wanting to give a bad impression to people who have made contributions and allowed her to continue working to progress.  Marcelina has planned to invest the requested loan in buying merchandise for her business.  She also wants to pay the deposit that will let her start working in the school kiosk.

loans.use: To buy products for her kiosk.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy new tools for his business

loans.name: Od-Ser

texts.en: Od-Ser, 39, is married and lives with her husband and two children in the Suhbaatar district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a small plot of land that they own. Her husband works as a driver for a local police station. Her elder daughter attends a college, and her younger daughter goes to a local school. Od-Ser began retail trading of plumbing supplies in 2003. She rents a stall at a large market that sells construction materials. Her business has become more stable now. Od-Ser wants to expand her business and increase her working capital. She is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase more plumbing supplies for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more plumbing supplies

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena S., age 41, cherishes being a community partner in CCT* because of the entrepreneurial training she receives, as well as the spiritual support being given to her. Lorena was not able to reach high school, but she is grateful to know that a good future lies ahead of her as she strives to lead a better life with a micro business of her own. Lorena is married to a younger husband named Richard, and together they are raising six children in their home in Tanza, Cavite.

Lorena focuses on her ready-to-wear (RTW) clothing business. She sells undergarments and other clothing apparel as well as such items as tablecloths to a set of valued customers composed of relatives, friends, and fellow community members. She has a commercial space in the public market of their community which she has managed on her own for four years now. She is able to earn a monthly income of approximately Php 12,000 a month.

To help her improve her business, Lorena has chosen to request a loan of Php 50,000. She will budget this money toward buying various merchandise items such as blouses, undershirts, and tablecloths to offer for sale. She believes that the loan will strongly sustain her capital and enable her to increase her profits. These will benefit her growing business and thus enable her to support the needs of her family and finance the education of her dear children.

The unstable prices of the merchandise she sells is one major difficulty Lorena faces at present. However, being an adept micro entrepreneur, she has ways to manage this problem and to grow as a person and as an entrepreneur. It is her goal to make her business stable and grow her profits. 

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from receiving the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy various merchandise items such as blouses, undershirts, and tablecloths to offer for sale

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Seng S., 55, is a rice farmer living in Kompong Cham province. She has spent most of her life in the rice planting business. She always uses her own farmland to grow her rice crop in both dry and rainy seasons. Most of her planting activity always gets good results and she is able to make an average daily profit of US $1.50. Her husband works with her on the farm and he also buys animals from the villagers, fattens them for a while and then sells them for a profit. Because the animal sales business is the family's main source of income, Seng S. has requested a loan as capital for her husband to buy an extra cow to sell.

loans.use: to buy an extra cow to sell.

loans.name: Phocas

texts.en: Phocas is 36 years old.  He is single and is working very hard in order to get himself out of poverty. He has been selling sorghum in the market for 7 years. He is requesting a loan to buy more sorghum and make more profits, which he plans to reinvest so he can expand his business.  He dreams of being a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy sorghum for resale.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 31 years old and married to Annastacia. Together, they have a 5-year-old child. He has been a vegetable vendor for a year and hopes to open up a permanent retail shop someday. Francis currently earns around 9,000 KES a month from his business. He intends to take an 8,000 KES loan to buy more vegetables, bananas, and coal that he will sell as a vegetable vendor.  

Francis learned about KADET Ltd. through a KADET staff member. This is his first loan with KADET. He plans to use the proceeds from the loan to expand his business. He hopes to open a retail shop one day.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables, bananas, and coal that he will sell as a vegetable vendor.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua sells kenkey (fermented maize or cassava) and fish in Elmina. She also makes gari (grated and fried cassava) for sale. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a farmer. Efua has been selling gari for 10 years. She helps her husband take care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more cassava to make gari for sale.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more cassava to make gari (grated and fried cassava) for sale.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: La señora Paulina es madre soltera dispuesta a dar todo por su hijo para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. Para generar un ingreso extra para los gastos familiares, los fines de semana pone su negocio de venta de comida denominado “Tacontodo” como lo es Menudo, tamales y pozole comida típica del país que a variedad de gente le gusta. Paulina aparte trabaja como intendente en una empresa de la localidad. El crédito que solicita es para comprar la materia prima del negocio para la elaboración de los platillos que prepara y así seguir apoyando a su hijo con lo que necesita.
texts.en:
Paulina is a single mother who is prepared to give her all so that her son can enjoy a better quality of life.  In order to make an extra income for her family, Paulina sets up her food business called 'Tacontodo' every weekend and sells 'menudo' (tripe soup), tamales and 'pozole' (pork and hominy stew).  These are all traditional dishes that many people like.   In addition, Paulina works as a janitor for a company in her town.

Paulina will use this loan to buy supplies for her business, to make the dishes that she prepares.  In this way, she will be able to continue supporting her son in everything he needs.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making the dishes that she sells

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 44 years old and a single mother of three.  She sells fresh juice to earn a living. She has been operating the business for five years.  With income from her business, she is able to provide for her children, including educating them.
  
Elizabeth hopes to grow her business and open a bakery in five years. She has requested 10,000 Kenyan shillings to buy avocado, pineapple, mangoes and pawpaws for making juice.

loans.use: To buy avocado, pineapple, mangoes and pawpaws to make juice

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es:
En el centro poblado menor de Kiteni, distrito de Quillabamba, provincia de La Convención, en el Cusco conocimos al señor Modesto y nos cuenta: 

“Nací en la ciudad de Abancay del departamento de Apurímac, tengo 53 años edad, tengo siete hijos y ahora vivo en la ciudad de Kiteni y donde desarrollo mis actividades económicas que son: venta de bebidas alcohólicas y elaboración de muebles de madera”. 

Modesto es una persona luchadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia, el tiene un pequeño taller de carpintería en su domicilio, él fabrica muebles de madera como por ejemplo mesas, sillas, roperos y otros más. 
El socia Modesto pertenece al banco comunal “Cholo de Oro de Kiteni” y accede al préstamo para invertir en el negocio de desea comprar madera, goma de carpintero, clavos y otras cosas más.
texts.en:
We met Modesto in the middle of the town of Kiteni, Quillabamba District, La Convención Province in Cusco and he told us:

“I was born in the city of Abancay, Apurímac Department.  I’m 53 years old and I have seven children.  I now live in the city of Kiteni which is where I carry out my economic activities which are: the sale of alcoholic beverages and wood furniture making.” 

Modesto is a tenacious, enterprising person who moves his family forward.  He has a small carpentry shop at home where he manufactures wood furniture like tables, chairs, armoires, etc.

Modesto belongs to the “Choclo de Oro de Kiteni” communal bank and is accessing a loan to invest in his business.  He wants to buy lumber, carpenter’s glue, nails and other things.

loans.use: to buy lumber, carpenter's glue, nails and other things.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a 36-year-old man, married with four children and one dependant. His family is made up of six members. Richard lives in a rented house, his dream is to buy land and build his own business premises. Richard operates a retail shop in Bwijanga Masindi district. He has been in the business for six years. He started the business with only 200,000 as start up capital and now has over 2,000.000 UGX as stock. Richard has hardships like lack of enough capital to keep the business well stocked and the high costs of transporting his merchandise from town. Richard sees his business in his own premises and dealing in wholesale. The purpose of the business is to buy more shop items like detergents, tea leaves, sweets, curry powder, books, pens, pencils, plates, sugar, salt and polythen paper bags.

loans.use: To buy more shop items like detergents, tea leaves, sweets, curry powder, books, pens, pencils. plates, sugar, salt and paper bags

loans.name: Virgen Asunta Group

texts.es:
(En la fotografía la socia Francisca está levantando la mano). 

La señora Francisca, tiene 30 años de edad, nació en la provincia de Paruro (Cusco) y ahora vive en la comunidad de Hospitalpampa distrito de Anta de la provincia de Anta del departamento del Cusco, ella radica hace 22 años en la comunidad y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. 

Francisca se dedica a la elaboración de bloquetas (Un bloque es un mampuesto prefabricado, elaborado con hormigones finos o morteros de cemento, utilizado en la construcción de muros y paredes.) . También, Fransisca se dedica la venta de materiales de construcción como por ejemplo piedra chancada, bolsas de cemento, confitillo y arena fina. Ya son seis años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Francisca requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales como por ejemplo bolsas de cementos (Una bolsa cemento cuesta aproximadamente s/. 23.00 nuevos soles).  Francisca en algunas ocasiones compra bolsas de cemento por mayor en la ciudad del Cusco pues le resulta más barato y en otras veces compra unas cuantas bolsas de cemento de tiendas de la zona para no quedarse sin materiales de trabajo. 

Las reuniones de las socias del Banco Comunal “Virgen Asunta” son cada treinta días en la comunidad de Hospitalpampa en la casa de unas de las socias. El Banco Comunal está conformado por personas que son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. La mayoría de los socios viven en la comunidad de Hospitalpampa y sus actividades económicas de los demás socios son por ejemplo venta de comida, venta de granos, venta de cosméticos, venta de carne, crianza de animales menores, venta de verduras y venta de hierba medicinales.   La comunidad de Hospitalpampa se encuentra ubicada a 45 minutos en carro de la ciudad del Cusco. Cusco es conocido desde hace muchos años como la "Capital Arqueológica de América".
texts.en:
(In the photograph, the group member Francisca is raising her hand.) Señora Francisca, who is 30 years old, was born in the province of Paruro (Cusco) and now lives in the community of Hospitalpampa in the Anta district in Anta province of the department of Cusco. Twenty-two years ago she settled in the community where she now carries out her business activities.

Francisca makes blocks. (A block is a prefabricated unit, made with fine cement or mortar, used in the construction of walls.) She also sells construction materials, such as crushed stone, gravel, and fine sand. She has already been in this business for six years, and it is going very well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her work. At this time Francisca needs a loan to buy more materials, such as bags of cement. (A bag of cement costs about 23 PEN.) Francisca sometimes buys bags of cement wholesale in the city of Cusco, which is cheaper for her, and at other times she buys a few bags of cement in shops in her district so that she won't be without working materials.

The meetings of the members of the communal bank "Virgen Asunta" are held every month in the community of Hospitalpampa in the home of one of the members. The communal bank is made up of people who are workers and entrepreneurs and who are always looking for opportunities to advance and, with their daily effort, give their children a better future. The majority of the members live in the community of Hospitalpampa, and the businesses of the other members include, for example, food sales, grain sales, cosmetic sales, meat sales, raising small animals, selling vegetables, and selling herbal medicines. 

The community of Hospitalpampa is located 45 minutes by car from the city of Cusco. Cusco has been known for many years as the "Archaeological Capital of America."

loans.use: to buy more building materials, for example, bags of cement

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: As it is known, fish is the main vital fresh food to many, in particular to the families who depend on fishing and fish selling. Mrs. Touch, one of these people, currently depends on selling fish at the local busy market. She sells fish that she either gets from her husband’s fishing or buys from her wholesale supplier. Touch is a humble mother who has been blessed with three lovely children. All of them have already married and live separately. From this business, Touch earns approximately $3 per day. To earn a living, Touch and her husband would like to purchase fishing materials but they lack the money, so Touch, together with her husband, has decided to request some funds through Kiva partner HKL. She expects that these funds will improve her revenue. She and her husband are very thankful to all kind lenders that always help her family. This is the first cycle of her loan with Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 33 años, es una mujer amable y muy responsable, es madre soltera de un niño de ocho años. Juntos viven en su casa propia. Su mayor anhelo es darle una buena educación a su hijo. EL trabajo de Rosa es el de servicio de costura, dicho trabajo lo realiza en su casa, en ella sus clientes la visitan para que realicen alguna confección de una prenda. Ella es muy creativa y termina elaborando prendas con novedosos diseños.  ella posee dos maquinas de coser y una remalladora, la segunda maquina y la remalladota se pudo comprar con los primeros crédito que solicitó a la institución. Lleva ya diez años en este trabajo, cuando no hay mucha demanda trabaja sola y cuando necesita que le ayuden por la demanda de sus prendas se ve obligada a contratar a dos personas más que saben del trabajo y son buenos en la costura. A Rosa siempre le gusto la costura, le gusta mucho su trabajo, le agrada tener sus creaciones y saber que es libre en hacer sus diseños, y casi siempre sus clientes están ahí para solicitarle su servicio. Espera poner un taller de costura implementado y empezar a hacer confecciones más grandes. Este será el octavo crédito con MFP, hasta ahora le ha ido bien en su grupo y esta contenta de trabajar con ellos porque demostraron todos que son muy responsables, además esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad de invertir en su negocio. Con el monto solicitado, comprará telas, hilos, blondas, cierres.
texts.en: Rosa, 33, is a kind, responsible woman and a single mother of an 8-year-old boy.  They live in their own house.  Her greatest desire is to give her son a good education.  Rosa works as a seamstress in her house where her customers come to place their  orders.  She is very creative and gives all her work novel designs.  She has two sewing machines and an overlock machine.  The second sewing machine and the overlock were purchased with the first loan she had through the institution.  She has been in business for ten years and works alone when demand is low.  When she has many orders she has to hire two people who know their work well and have sewing expertise.  Rosa has always enjoyed sewing and knowing that she is free to create her own designs.  She hopes to set up her own sewing shop one day and produce larger things.  This will be her eighth loan through MFP.  She is happy working with her group because all the members are responsible.  She is very grateful for the opportunity to invest in her business.  The loan will be used to buy fabric, thread, lace and closures.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread and notions (closures).

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with two children, one attends school while one is still young for school. Josephine lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, she has operated a shoe sales business, selling from door to door and from her home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments by creditors. She dreams of establishing a cosmetics shop in the future.

With the 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase bundles of shoes for both men and women for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of shoes for both men and women

loans.name: Indiana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Indiana, ha mejorado en su economia, al cambiar de trabajo, hoy en dia labora en ventas en un modulo en un mercado capitalino, obteniendo mejores ingresos de pago, ya que anteriormente estaba en servivios domestico.
Tambien sus tres hijos estan laborando, y como objetivo es seguir ampliando su casa, ya que es muy pequeña, con el credito anterior comenzo la construccion de un cuarto, y ahora, hara cambio de techo y poner piso, logrando mejor higiene, y comodidad para su familia. todo este progreso es gracias a los prestamos que Afodenic ha otorgado. Y al esfuerzo del trabajo que junto con mis hijos logramos para una mejor un mejor techo.
texts.en:
Indiana has improved her finances by changing her work.  Nowadays, she sells from a unit in the market of the capital, and earns a better income, since previously she was in domestic service. Her three children are also working.  

Her goal is to continue expanding her home, since it is very small.  With the previous loan she began the construction of a room, and now will have the roof replaced, and a floor put in, achieving better hygiene and comfort for her family. 

All this progress is thanks to the loans that Afodenic has granted, and to the hard work that she along with her children has done. In this way they are managing to build a better roof.

loans.use: To have her roof replaced, and install a floor in the main room, improving its condition.

loans.name: Lina Patricia

texts.es:
Lina es una mujer emprendedora que ha trabajado incansablemente por sacar a sus 2 hijos adelante, actualmente tiene una tienda en su casa donde ofrece productos de gran variedad y adicional a este vende comida rápida, sueña con tener una gran miscelánea donde la variedad y la calidad de sus productos la diferencien de la competencia.

Lina debe surtir su negocio, comprar productos al por mayor e insumos para la preparación de la comida rápida pero no cuenta con capital para invertirle a su negocio por lo que solicita un crédito con el que comprará lo necesario para incrementar las ventas, generar mas ingresos para los gastos del hogar y proporcionalmente mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lina is an enterprising woman who has worked tirelessly to get her 2 children ahead. At present, she has a store in her house where she offers a wide variety of products. In addition, she also sells fast food. She dreams of having a great variety store where the variety and quality of her products would distinguish her from the competition. 

Lina has to stock her store, buying products wholesale and ingredients to prepare the fast food. She doesn't have the capital to invest in her business and that is why she is asking for a loan to buy what she needs to increase her sales, generate more income for household expenses, and proportionally improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her business and ingredients to prepare fast food.

loans.name: Nuriddin

texts.ru: Нуриддин проживает в районе Рудаки. Он таксист маршрутной линии №3. Ему 61 год. Он женат. У них четверо детей. Нуриддин в этой области три года. До этого он 15 проработал по профессии, инженером. У него имеется высшее образование. Нуриддин берет кредит для ремонта своего автомобиля.
texts.en: Nuriddin lives in the region of Rudaki. He is a taxi driver along route №3. He is 61 years old. He is married and has four children. Nuriddin has worked in this field for three years. Before that, he worked as an engineer for 15 years. He has a university degree. Nuriddin is applying for credit to repair his car.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Dina Lizzeth

texts.es:
La señora Dina tiene 36 años de edad y vive en una aldea del municipio de San Pedro Sula. Dina es separada y tiene tres hijos de 4, 14, y 16 años de edad. Los dos mayores están estudiando. Doña Dina cuenta con el apoyo del padre de sus hijos quien la ayuda cubrir los gastos de educación. 

Anteriormente, doña Dina era ama de casa pero con la separación de su esposo hace un año, ella tenía la necesidad de proveer para sus hijos y conseguir un fuente de ingreso. Lo encontró muy difícil conseguir empleo así que ella colocó una chiclera (pequeño puesto donde vende golosinas). La chiclera creció hasta llegar ser una pequeña pulpería. 

En la pulpería vende productos de consumo personal como carnes, cornflakes, pañales, papel, cloro, jabón, huevos, pan, lácteos, azúcar, arroz, frijol, churros y jugos. Dina atiende a su clientela 16 horas al día. Ella nota que el incremento en el costo de la canasta básica ha impactado a sus clientes y por supuesto, a sus ventas. 

Solicitó su primer crédito de L10,000 para surtir el negocio con la compra de refrescos, pan, huevos, churros, lácteos, jugos y agua. Ella espera cumplir con este compromiso con ODEF y hacer crecer su pulpería para estar más orgullosa de ella misma. Ella agradece de antemano por creer en ella y por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Señora Dina is 36 years old, and lives in a village in the municipality of San Pedro Sula.  Dina is separated, and has three children aged 4, 14, and 16.  The two eldest are in school.  Doña Dina has assistance from the father of her children, who helps her cover their education expenses.

Previously Doña Dina was a housewife, but when she separated from her husband a year ago, she needed to provide for her children and identify a source of income.  She had great difficulty in finding employment, so she opened a "chiclera" (a small stand where she sells candies).  The chiclera has grown to the extent that it has now become a small general store.

In her store, she sells everyday items such as meat, cornflakes, diapers, toilet paper, bleach, soap, eggs, bread, dairy products, sugar, rice, beans, churros (dough fritters) and juices.  Dina serves her customers 16 hours a day.  She notes that the increase in the cost of standard goods has impacted her customers, and consequently her sales.

She has requested her first loan of L10,000 to stock up her business with the purchase of sodas, bread, eggs, churros, dairy products, juices and water.  She intends to comply with her commitment to ODEF, and to be able to grow her general store so that she can become even more proud of it.  She is grateful to ODEF for believing in her, and for the opportunity that's being provided.

loans.use: to purchase sodas, bread, eggs, churros (dough fritters), dairy products, juices, and water.

loans.name: Lustrica

texts.en:
Lustrica is a 57-year-old married woman with 8 children. She is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. Lustrica grows and sells rice. Her husband is also a farmer. They work together to improve their living conditions.

Lustrica has applied for a loan to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers. Lustrica hopes for their farm to grow.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Rosario Regina

texts.es:
Rosario de 44 años, es cliente del banco D-miro desde su fundación y con la ayuda del banco pudo terminar de construir su casa y después estableció un negocio.

Gracias a Dios no ha tenido ninguna dificultad en su negocio. Está casado y su esposo trabaja como maestro constructor, y tiene 1 hijo de 17 años que estudian en colegio fiscal.

Tiene muchas aspiraciones de su negocio por eso quiere seguir trabajando y asi mejorar su estilo de vida con mayores ingresos a su familia. Su meta es poder comprar mas mercadería para así poder incrementar mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosario is 44 years old. She has been a client of the D-Miro bank since it was founded. With the bank's help, she was able to finish building her house and later she opened her business.   

Thankfully, she hasn't had any problems with her business. She is married and her husband works as a builder. She has one 17 year old who is in high school.  

She has many aspirations for her business and because of this she wants to keep working and thus improve her quality of life with more income for her family. Her goal is to be able to buy more merchandise to increase her business.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, paper and picture frames

loans.name: Tram

texts.en:
Tram is a 23-year-old beautician who lives with her husband and son in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works in the field of construction. Tram runs a beauty shop from her house. She has worked in this profession for one year.

Tram is requesting a loan to buy cosmetic products and other basic supplies for her beauty shop. She hopes that this will enable her to better serve her existing customers and attract new customers. She also hopes that through the loan she will be able to generate a higher income and set aside some savings for the future.

loans.use: buy supplies for her beauty shop.

loans.name: Nom

texts.en: Nom, 56, is widowed and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a rice farmer. Additionally, she makes flat baskets to sell. Her children are employed at a garment factory. Since the factory is far away from home, Nom is requesting a loan of $1000 US to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work. In the future, she would like to renew her house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work

loans.name: Rasoha

texts.en:
Rasoha 70 years old, is married and has five children ranging from seventeen to thirty years. She describes herself as a persistent woman. 

For the last four years, she has been selling clothes to the neighbours in her home area.  In addition, Rasoha does faming and sells kales and peas to increase her income.  She describes her business challenge to be the high price of clothes. 

She will use the loan of KES 10,000 to buy more clothes.  In the future, Rosaha hopes and dreams to run several clothes stores.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Selinah Omenya

texts.en:
Selinah Omenya is a 45-year-old private school proprietor in Shanzu, Mombasa. She is married and she has been running this business for the past 13 years and she is doing great. 

This is Selinah’s third loan from KADET. She plans to construct more classes and buy new desks. 

She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and improve her school. She hopes to have the most well known school in the coast province.

loans.use: to construct more classes and buy new desks.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a married man with four children. He will use the loan to pay tuition fees for his children who are supposed to register for the first year at university. 

He is grateful that Kiva through Ugafode, is willing to bail him out in his time of need. He is hard working and innovative. He will use money from milk sales to repay the loan.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for his children.

loans.name: Victoire Group

texts.fr: VICTOIRE  est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui exerce le même métier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. Le représentant du groupe, du nom de Dagbegnon Léon est celui qui a la main levée sur la photo. Dagbegnon Léon âgé 27 ans, a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire mais a appris la couture et la broderie, activité qu’il exerce depuis huit dans sa région, ce qui lui paermet de répondre aux besoins de sa famille. Dagbegnon Léon est marié un agent commercial du nom de Olga. Le couple a un enfant, scolarisé et à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Dagbegnon Léon  et sa femme. Dagbegnon Léon s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et au NIGERIA. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Dagbegnon Léon sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe VICTOIRE, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit précédent a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter des tissus et des fournitures de broderie.

loans.name: Jesukpego 3 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUKPEGO 3 est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Rafia, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 31 ans est mariée à un maçon du nom de Samounou. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Rafia vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par le couple. Rafia n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour cette raison, Rafia tricoteuse de profession vend des vêtements par la technique de distribution depuis sept ans. Rafia s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Rafia sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUKPEGO 3 un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des v^tements.

loans.name: Danaya Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  DANAYA II  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à MANA, un des villages de OUELESSEBOUGOU 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième  prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide, le riz et le mil avec   NAOMY, 1ère personne  assise de la  gauche vers la   droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du marche, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 70.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aider  aussi son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Frais de labour, achat d’intrants et  de semence

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Para Humberto contar con el apoyo de un crédito es un gran apoyo, pues lo ayuda a solventar mejor sus gastos y cultivar a tiempo, él cuenta que gracias a los créditos le ha ido muy bien pues varios cambios ha visto, porque ahora ya cultiva con más frecuencia y su  cultivo ha incrementado, por esa razón agradece a los inversionistas que confíen en él.
Humberto con el afán de cultivar en el próximo mes ha decidido solicitar un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de semillas, he insumos agrícolas, con esta nueva inversión espera obtener una buena cosecha y seguir prosperando para el bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: Compra de semillas he insumos agrícolas.

loans.name: Mwasiti

texts.en: Mwasiti is 47 years old ,married with two children.She lives in Kigamboni in Dar es Salaam.She runs a food vending business in Kigamboni area.She has been in this business for many years.The local authorities of the area where she operates requires people running food vending business to rent on already built premises.The move is toward combating cholera out break.The area is usually attacked by cholera.Also they are also required to observe highly sterilized dish serving vessels.All these requirements need some capital investments .Now she want to improve the business by adding food supplying vessels,food wrapping materials for take-aways,hygienical food display cages and plastic sitting chairs and tables.She is in need of USD 750 to implement her plan.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Vazir

texts.en:
Vazir has 6 years of experience in this business. He is 35 years old, married and has 3 children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region Mahmudlu 2 village.
Having borrowed $400 Vazir bought 4 sheep.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy 10 sheep.

loans.use: To buy 10 sheep

loans.name: Freida Lisa

texts.en: Freida is a 35 year old woman from a small Samoan village.  She is married and has five children.  Her husband works as a taxi driver, but his income is inconsistent and not enough to support their large family.  Frieda is a very talented tailor but lack of finances has kept her from launching a formal business.  Frieda applied for an initial small loan from SPBD that she used to purchase fabric that she then sewed by hand.  Having repaid this initial loan and now confident that there is enough demand for her services, she has applied for a second loan.  These funds will go towards the purchase of a sewing machine and other supplies.  A sewing machine will allow her to speed up her production and fill customer orders much more quickly.  Freida’s goal is to build up a regular customer base and thereby secure a regular and dependable income source for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and fabric

loans.name: Martha Francisca

texts.es:
Martha is a married mother of three. Her husband laborer, and his salary is very small, so Martha, as an enterprising woman, decided to start her own business selling clothes to earn extra income. She started selling used clothing 15 years ago, and now, at the request of her clients, she has incorporated new clothes as well. It has gone very well, and she also has acquired a post at the local market and continues to sell out of her home.

Thanks to her business, Martha's children have been able to continue their education. To keep the business growing, she is requesting a loan of $275, which she will use to purchase more clothing in order to offer a wider selection and increase her sales. She plans to repay the loan within four months. You can be a part in the development of this business and the well being of Martha and her family. They are grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Martha es casada y tiene tres hijos, su esposo es obrero y el salario que recibe es muy bajo, como Martha es una mujer emprendedora decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta D. ropa para obtener un ingreso extra, comenzó a vender ropa usada en su casa hace 15 años, ahora a petición D. sus cliente ha incorporado la venta D. ropa nueva y le ha ido muy bien, también ha adquirido un puesto en el mercado y continua con las ventas en su hogar.

Con este negocio Martha ha logrado que sus hijos continúen estudiando y para seguir creciendo ahora necesita D. un préstamo D. $ 275 dólares que empleará en la compra D. mercancía para poder ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes e incrementar sus ventas, ella está dispuesta a regresar esta cantidad en 4 meses. Se parte del desarrollo D. este negocio y del bienestar D. esta familia, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: Purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Mateus

texts.pt:
Mateus V. is a hard working father of 7 children who are all in school. He is requesting this loan in order to buy construction material. He joined the FMD program in 2006. He has requested and repaid various loans which he used to buy essential articles for his home, now he wants to improve his house. He is in the 5th cycle of the program and has been a responsible borrower.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga Kiva Volunteer.

Mateus V. e trabalhador, ele quer usar o dinheiro do emprestimo para a compra do material de construcao. Ele entrou para o programa de Credito do Fundo de Desenvolvimento da Mulher em 2006. Ele e casado e pai de 7 filhos todos a estudar. Os sucessivos emprestimos que tomou permitiram-lhe comprar alguns artigos para a sua casa e agora pensa em construir uma casa melhorada. Ele esta ja no quinto ciclo e tem sido um bom cliente.

loans.use: Buy construction material

loans.name: Menena

texts.en:
Menena, 26, originally from Haiti, lives in Batey Palavé in San Cristobal. A 'batey' is a company town consisting of barracks and a few houses. They are located close to cane fields so that groups of workers can live near the site of their labor (usually called ‘ingenio’). In the past, many immigrants from Haiti came to work the sugar fields in Dominican Republic in order to make a living. Currently the ‘ingenio’ is out of service, but the ‘batey’ houses Haitians and Dominicans.

Menena is living with two of her children. The eldest is living in Haiti with her father. Menena was separated from her husband two years ago. Since then, she has been working as a housekeeper. As money earned from that job couldn’t cover all the expenses of the family, she has been obliged to invest a part of her salary in the purchase of jeans and shoes, which she resells door-to-door in her community. Currently, she works more than she sells. She wants to invert that situation and convert the sale of clothes to her principal source of income.

She is requesting funds to purchase enough clothes and shoes to augment her sales volume and have enough money to keep on taking care of her children.

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes to supply her small business and make it progress.

loans.name: Sulesa

texts.en:
Sulesa lives near the town area on the north side. She is from the village of Sinamoga and she is married with 3 lovely kids. Her husband does not have a good educational background but he is a good swimmer and a good fisherman. Sulesa is only twenty-five years of age and she is young and active.

She heard about SBPD loans weeks ago, and she decided to join so that her husband can have good fishing equipment for his fishing business, and the money left will be used for her barbecue business. Sulesa plans to run the barbecue business as an alternative income in time of bad weather. The barbecue will be sold in front of her house beside the roadside and it will cost $6 WST ($2.40 USD) for one plate. Sulesa is a happy lady now, and she is looking forward to earning more in the future.

loans.use: To buy boxes of mutton flaps, turkey tails, chicken legs and cucumbers for her barbecue business

loans.name: Hol

texts.en: Mrs. Hol K., 54, is a widow and has nine children. Four of them are enrolled in school, and the rest are married and live separately. Mrs. Hol K. works making Khmer traditional cakes and reselling them in her area. She makes about $7.50 each day in revenue. She would like to sell not only Khmer cakes but also a variety of grocery products, which would enable her to raise her income. Unfortunately she faces a financial constraint. Thus, Mrs. Hol K. has requested a loan to help her operate a grocery business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Latifat

texts.en: Latifat A. is a mother of three children. She is 37-years-old and lives in the Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells Elubo (dried yams, plantains and cassavas).  Mrs. A. requests a loan amount of $450 to increase her inventory for resale.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for resale

loans.name: Anatalia

texts.en: Anatalia is forty-six years old and the proud single mother of three daughters and one son, all of whom attend school. To make a living and sustain her family, she sells homemaD. food. Anatalia defines herself as a great cook, and she says that she prepares delicious dishes. Anatalia has been running her business for almost one year, and currently she has a lot of customers that visit her house every day to purchase her succulent dishes. With her loan, Anatalia will buy a wiD. variety of goods to keep preparing her food and increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase an assortment of products in order to continue producing food for her customers.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru:
Mahbuba R. lives in the city of Vahdat in Tajikistan. She is 30 years old, widowed and has 2 children. She is the sole bread winner for her family. Mahbuba has to work a lot to be able to support her children. She rents a stall at the local market where she sells children's clothing. Mahbuba is currently planning to expand her inventory and the variety of goods she offers for sale. This will help increase her profits and attract new clients to her stall with unique goods she has to offer. To finance this expansion Mahbuba is planning to take out a loan of 600 US dollars and pay pack the money in the next 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Рахмонова Махбуба проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 30 лет . У нее 2 детей , но муж умер. Поэтому является единственным кормильцем семьи. Ей приходится много работать , чтобы обеспечить детей. Махбуба занимается торговлей. Имеет торговую точку на районом рынке, где продает детскую одежду. Сейчас клиентка запланировала увеличить товарооборот. Это поможет увеличить доход , а так же привлечь новых клиентов ввозом нового ассортимента. Для этого Махбуба хочет получить кредит в размере 600 долларов США. А погаситькредит клиентка сможет в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Expanding inventory

loans.name: Abdullo

texts.en: Abdullo N.  has been an active client of the MicroInvest since 2007. The business development and profit increases have helped him to return the previous loans and  develop his business significantly. Mr. Abdullo N.  is 59 years old and he lives in the Asht region and has a family of 6 children. He has been engaged in his business for 15 years. He started the business from his household and he now trades from an outlet in furnishings, towels and other items. He has many customers because he is one of the most respected men on the collective farm. Abdullo applies to KIVA for  help. He requests a loan to increase and improve his business by importing new goods. Mr. N. Abdullo requires a loan of 2800 TJS for 10 months. He thanks KIVA for the support that KIVA presents to  small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Business development and importation of new goods

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy O. sells meat, fish, and cow feet. She is married but her husband's income from his job as a fire fighter is not sufficient for Mercy and her four children. Demand for her goods is high and she is looking to expand her business. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business to increase her profits.

loans.use: To expand her business selling meat, fish, and cow feet.

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.es:
Vanesa works at Hotel Sucre as a contracted waitress and is a student at the University Publica El Alto (UPEA) with a career in law. She lives in her parents’ home located in Area 16 of Febrero Rio Seco El Alto.

The credit will be allocated toward purchasing a computer because her parents do not have the resources to support her. The computer will allow her to fulfill her work at the University.

This is her first credit with Impro, and it qualifies because loan approval was requested by Vanesa.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

Vanesa trabaja en el Hotel Sucre de mesera a contrato y es estudiante de la Universidad Publica El Alto UPEA en la carrera de Derecho, vive en la casa de sus padre ubicada en la Zona 16 de Febrero Rio Seco El Alto.
