El crédito lo destinara en la compra de una computadora ya que sus padres no cuentan con los recursos para poderle apoyar; dicha computadora le ayudará mucho a realizar sus trabajos de la Universidad.

Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Vanesa.

loans.use: To purchase a computer to facilitate her work at the University

loans.name: Lellou

texts.fr:
Mr. Lellou has a hardware shop in the Tilene district, not far from the center of town. He is requesting this loan to bolster his stock of iron and cement. He hopes to recruit a salesperson to help him with his shop and sell these products.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

M. LELLOU s'est installe au quartier TILENE, non loin du centre ville. IL a une quincaillerie, il demande ce pret pour renforcer son stock de fer et ciment. Il envisage de recruter un vendeur pour l'aider dans la vente de ses produits.

loans.use:
adding to his stock of hardware products for re-sale

Quincaillerie

loans.name: Muniba

texts.en: Muniba was born in 1975 and she is from the town of Visoko. Her husband works, and Muniba grows vegetables. She would like a loan to buy more seeds for sowing in the fall. She hopes to plant a lot of vegetables, so that she will have something for the winter. After the winter, she will probably have some corn, which she will sell to earn additional money.

loans.use: To buy seeds.

loans.name: Norm

texts.en: Norm T., 26, is married and lives with one child. She works making baskets in the Siem Reap province and typically makes US$1.50 each day. She is also supported by her husband who works as a sculptor and makes a profit of US$3 each day. Norm T. is requesting a loan of US$400 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. This will help reduce the daily expense that her husband spends every day on a motor-taxi driver.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Chan Tha

texts.en: Mrs. Chan Tha S. is a villager in Ampil Tvea Village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a duck breeder who is raising around 1000 ducks. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducks for breeding. She plans to use the rest of the loan to buy food to feed her ducks. She is a 45-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is working in a garage while the other is employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy more ducks to raise and food to feed her ducks

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: Esteban tiene 26 años, es soltero, vive con sus padres y trabaja para ellos. De niño se dedicaba a la siembra de cítricos y demás frutas, pero hace 6 años viene talando arbolés y tiene sus clientes ya conocidos a quienes provee de madera, para la elaboración de cajones de fruta. Su actividad inicia a las 4.00am se va a las profundidades de la selva a buscar los arbolés maduros, compra cada tallo a S/.20.00 y el los vende a S/ 36.00 ya trozados en trocos. Esta actividad le es muy rentable, todo este tiempo solventa así sus gastos, solo encuentra dificultades en tiempos de lluvia, ya que no puede sacar su carga. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP. El haber accedido a este préstamo le permitirá comprar un motor de aserrar para facilitar su actividad.
texts.en:
Esteban is 26 years old, single, lives with his parents, and works for them. Since he was a boy he has grown citrus and other fruit trees, but six years ago he began cutting down trees. He now has an established clientele for whom he provides wood to be made into fruit crates. He begins working at 4:00am, when he goes deep into the forest to look for mature trees. He pays S/20.00 (approximately US $6.50) for each tree and then sells the cut wood for S/36.00 (approximately US $11.50). It is a very profitable enterprise, and for most of the year he completely covers his expenses. During the rainy season, however, he cannot remove the trees from the forest. This is his fourth loan from Microfinanzas PRISMA. With this loan he will purchase a table saw which will greatly facilitate his work.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a table saw

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes S. is thirty-five years old, married, and has five children who are all in elementary school. She lives with her husband and children in Obuasi. Agnes sells fashion accessories such as pomades of all kinds, ready made wear for women, cloth, and other textiles. Agnes has been in business for seven years. She buys her goods in the cities such as Kumasi and Accra. She sells her goods door-to-door and also sells in the local market. She wants to use the loan to make bulk purchases in order to sell to surrounding villages. Agnes belongs to the All Nation Trust Bank group where the members guarantee for one another as collateral so as to access the loan.  She was attending her group meeting when her photograph was taken.

loans.use: To buy textiles, pomades, etc. on a large scale to sell.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: A. Koffi Edem est âgé de 33 ans  et père de 2 enfants.  Il subvient difficilement à ses propres besoins et ceux de la famille parce qu’il travaille la terre qui lui rapporte peu depuis qu’il a quitté les bancs. Pour gagner plus de l’argent, il prévoit changer d’activité pour conduire un taxi moto à Lomé, métier accessible aux gens avec peu de qualification personnelle. Il va prendre les passagers au bord de la route et les déposer à leurs destinations dans l’environnement.  Avec ce 2ème  crédit de FECECAV, Mr. Koffi espère acheter sa propre moto pour commencer son entreprise.
texts.en:
Koffi Edem A. is 33 years old and the father of two children. He has difficulty meeting his own and his family's needs, as the farm that he has worked since he left school, produces little. To increase his income he wants to change his business and drive a motorcycle taxi in Lome, a job available to people who have had little training. He would pick up passengers along the highway and drive them to their destination, in the area. With this, his second loan from FECECAV, Koffi hopes to buy his own motorcycle to start this enterprise.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, tiene 39 años y vive en su casa propia, con su menor hijo Franz de 14 años, al cual le quiere dar un mejor fututo y poder pagar sus estudios superiores. Ana lleva 4 años vistiendo a la gente que concurre al mercado Tupac Amaru (Mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), su puesto es uno de los más visitados, ya que tiene una gran variedad de prendas de vestir, tanto para damas como para caballeros.  A ella le gustaría poner una tienda más grande, donde pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y mostrarles más ropa, puesto que disfruta de vender y conversar con sus clientes, eso sí, lo que le resulta difícil es llevar la ropa hasta su puesto de trabajo, es demasiado cansado para ella sola. Ana trabaja esforzadamente, ya que necesita dinero para pagar los estudios de su querido hijo, al cual quiere dar una vida. Este es el cuarto préstamo al que accede Ana y al igual como hizo con sus anteriores préstamos, desea pagarlo a tiempo y sin dificultades, en su banco comunal es muy respetada, ya que es la socia más activa y comprometida. Con los 600 soles de préstamo, planea comprar más mercadería y así incrementar la cantidad de ropa que vende.
texts.en:
Ana is a very happy and hard-working person. She is 39 years old and lives in her own house, with her youngest son Franz, 14. She wants to give him a better future and be able to pay for his higher studies. For 4 years Ana has been clothing people that converge at the Tupac Amaru market (an important market of Juliaca city). Her stand is one of the most visited, and she now has a large variety of garments, as many for women as gentlemen. She would like to create a bigger shop, where she could better attend to her clients and show them more clothes. She enjoys selling and talking to her clients at her stand, but what is difficult is carrying the clothes to her stand where she works, which is too tiring for her alone. Ana works very hard, and now needs money to pay for the studies of her dear son, to whom she wants to give a good life. This is the 4th loan that Ana has accessed, and as she did with her previous loans, she desires to pay it back in time and without difficulty. Within her communal bank she is very well respected, and she is now the most active and engaged member. With the loan of 600 soles ($200) she will buy more goods and in this way increase the amount of clothes that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy garments for her shop

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes A. is 48 years old. She is married and the mother of six children. Through this business, Agnes has supported two of her children to finish senior high school, and the others are currently in school. Agnes lives with her husband who is a farmer, together with the children in Berekum in the Brong Ahafo region.

Agnes is a food vendor and sells "kenkey" as well as maize. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaians enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper. In addition, she also sells grocery products just in front of her house.

Agnes wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, firewood and grocery products like sugar, evaporated milk, etc. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children's education. Agnes belongs to a village bank called ‘Enoch’. She hopes to receive GHS 500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, firewood and grocery products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a cow

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria Y., 62, is married with 1 child. She has many years of experience in running a general store. She sells to the general public 7 days per week. She has no previous loan with SPBD.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD). SPBD loans are Maria’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Buy frozen foods, tinned foods, sugar, flour, salt, rice, onions, diapers, toilet papers, soap and other stock for her shop

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: La señora Concepción es socia del Banco Comunal Dios es Amor del Distrito de Mazo-Cruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 25 años de edad, de estado civil casada con 2 hijos, vive en el barrio José Antonio y cuenta con estudios de primaria completa.  La señora viene trabajando con el MMR hace ya 7 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar el capital para su negocio de compra de fibras de ovino y de alpaca. En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo, el cual solicitará por el monto de 3000.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitirá incrementara su negocio, y así ampliar su negocio ya que ella comprara por mayor las fibras, de primera por lo cual ella obtendrá mayores ingresos para su familia. Su mayor deseo es comprarse una casa en Ilave y educar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales y lo que mas le gusta de su grupo son los préstamos, todo en general.
texts.en:
Mrs. Concepción is a member of the "Dios es Amor" Community Bank in the Mazo-Cruz District, Collao Province, Pruno Region. She is 25 years old, married and has 2 children. She lives in the José Antonio neighborhood. She finished primary school. Mrs. Concepción has been working with the MMR (Movimiento Manuela Ramos) organization for 7 years. She began with a loan for 300.00 PEN to increase capital for her business of purchasing wool and alpaca fiber. She currently needs a new loan and will apply for the amount of 3,000.00 PEN. This will allow her to increase business and grow since she will buy the fiber at wholesale. She will receive a greater income for her family. Her biggest wish is to buy a house with a key and educate her children for a profession. What she likes most about her group are the loans and generally everything.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASE AND SALE OF ALPACA AND WOOL FIBER

loans.name: Mayllori

texts.es:
La señora Mayllori, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Abiseo” vive en el Jr. Loreto Nº 218, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es casada y tiene 47 años; es madre de 03 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella. 

Mayllori, nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 300.00, y es una de nuestras socias mas antiguas dentro de su banquito, empezó vendiendo truzas para varones, en una parte del Mercado Central de la Ciudad de Juanjui, fueron obtuvieron ganancias y hoy en la actualidad alquilaron un puesto mas grande donde implementaron su negocio de ropas para damas, caballeros y niños. 

Es una negociante ya muy conocida, y sus principales clientes son moradores de la comunidad y amigos.

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,500.00, comprara en docenas (al por mayor) ropa interior para damas y caballeros en todas las tallas modelos y colores, pantalones, polos y blusas en distintos modelos, de tal manera que pueda tener variedad para ofertar a su clientela.

Mayllori, refiere que el Banco Comunal es una excelente propuesta para las mujeres que desean trabajar y progresar.
texts.en:
Mayllori belongs to the El Abiseo community bank. She lives at Jr. Loreto Nº 218, Juanjui district, Mariscal Cáceres province, San Martín department. She is 47, married, and has three children. Two of her children are still dependent upon her. Mayllori started with a loan of 300 PEN, and she is one of the oldest members in her bank. She started selling men’s underwear in the Central Market in the city of Juanjui. This was profitable, and she currently rents a larger stand where she sells women’s, men’s, and children’s clothes. She is a well known businesswoman. Her main customers are residents of the community and friends. With this loan for 2,500 PEN she will buy dozens (wholesale) of women’s and men’s underwear in all sizes, styles, and colors. She will buy pants, polo shirts, and blouses in different styles. This way she will be able to have a variety of items to offer her customers. Mayllori says that the community bank is an excellent proposal for women who want to work and progress.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes to increase her stock

loans.name: Sok's Group
loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel K. is a young kente weaver at Ahado in Hohoe. Emmanuel has received basic education. He is married and has two children. His wife is also weaver of kente cloth. Kente is a traditional woven cloth with different colors of triads and twines that is mostly worn on special occasions to portray the rich culture of Ghana.

Emmanuel is responsible for paying for the financial needs of his children. His loan will be used to buy different kinds of colors of triads and twine to weave. He hopes to save the new profits.

loans.use: To buy difference kind of colors of triad and twine to weave

loans.name: Slc Primary School Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of The SLC (Sierra Leone Church) Primary School, Makeni. The SLC Primary School, Makeni was built by the Anglican Mission in 1914 and is the oldest school in Makeni City. Currently, the school has a total of nineteen staff and 976 pupils. 

Since its inception, the school has helped produced many dignitaries, scholars and professional workers, both within and without Sierra Leone. The school has in its alumni: teachers, doctors, lawyers, engineers, ministers, a president and so on. Still, the school continues to make a mark in the academic circles. Last academic year, they achieved 100% passes at the National Primary School Examination (NPSE). They have also established a link with a primary school in England, Margret Primary School in an inter-primary school exchange program.

With this loan, some of these teachers will start small businesses and those who are already running small businesses will invest the loan into their business. Some of the staff members will be using the loan to buy pieces of furniture, others to pay either for their children's education or pay for themselves to pursue further studies. Others will use their loan in home building projects.  

Yaya M. (right) is the head master at the school. He is age forty-one and was born in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. He is married with five children, one is already grown-up, two are in primary school, one in secondary school and the other in college. Mr. M. has been a teacher for twenty eight years now. He will invest this loan into his businesses. Mr. M. sells local produces like palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), rice, beans, ground-nut etc. in order to supplement his monthly salary. He has been selling local produces for twelve years. Out of the profit he makes from this business, Mr. M. has been able to pay the school fees for his children.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 30-year-old engaged man living with his parents. He has been working as a gas tanks distributor since 1999 to earn income to help satisfy the needs of the family. Today, Mohamad is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy more merchandise so he can increase his sales and therefore his income.

loans.use: To buy more gas tanks for his business.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia M. is from the village of Jang, Poblacion Mahinog Camiguin. Patricia is married and has school-aged children. To make a living, Patricia owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling variety of viands and such in the local community. Patricia has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In September 2008, Patricia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Patricia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. Patricia is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Patricia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Christine's Group

texts.en: N. Christine is the leader of her lending group in Namungoona. She is 34 years old and a business lady involved in the poultry business, farming and dealing in the sale of cosmetics for a long time giving her enough experience in what she does. She is a married lady with her first born 15 years and in secondary school and the loans have helped her pay her child’s school fees by investing in her businesses and getting profits. She has also bought a plot of land and built a house for her family as she also helps to care for her parents, orphans and off springs. Christine has mostly had challenges like when her chicken are attacked with diseases and they die, or at times when her farming does not yield as expected. However, she has dream like having a well vanished house, educate her eldest son whose father died to the last level, as well as buy a car that will help with a family and to help with her business. Business wise, Christine would like to have a much bigger farm that will include cows, pigs, goats and ducks or turkeys. She would also like to involve in farming extensively. She is a hardworking, friendly and trustworthy person and this wins her many peoples’ confidence.

loans.use: Buying quality seeds, employ manpower for clearing her farm land and buying more chicken feeds and chicks for farm expansion.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose O. is a 48-year-old general store owner from Eastern Samar. She immigrated with her family to Maricaban, Pasay City years ago. Her husband, Fernando, 49, is a fellow business entrepreneur. Their three children are all attending school.

Rose has been doing different businesses for the past 15 years. Along with her general store, Rose has a meat stall in Libertad Public Market. She also cooks breakfast goodies and sells them to her neighbors. She has hired the services of an assistant to help her tend her businesses. Rose is earning 48,000 PHP a month.

Over the years, Rose’s businesses have grown steadily. Then, a few years ago, she became afflicted with severe hypertension. Medical expenses have taken a heavy toll on their finances. She thanks God that she learned of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2006. With the loans she received, her businesses slowly recovered. She has also recovered but has to take medications for the rest of her life.

Rose is now on her seventh loan cycle with the cooperative. She is in need of a loan of 20,000 PHP. She wants to venture into the business of buying and selling dried fish. Rose is thankful that she is alive and strong. She works hard, hand-in-hand with her husband, to be able to fund their children’s education.

About CCT: The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response to poverty and social injustice. It is carried out through a fusion of social development initiatives and an evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. CCT serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Capital for a new business selling dried fish

loans.name: In God We Trust Group

texts.en:
“In God We Trust” is a group of five borrowers led by Siafa T., a 42-year-old married man. Siafa has three children aged 9 to 14 years old and their educational levels are 2nd through 6th grade. He is a high school graduate but could not continue to university due to lack of financial support from his parents. Siafa lives and works in the Dualla community, north of Monrovia, the capital of Liberia. This is a very big commercial community and the majority of its inhabitants live on small and medium-sized businesses.

Siafa's business is the sale of fresh fish, meat and chicken. He buys his product wholesale from fishermen, poultrymen and butchers and sells to the local residents. He has been running this business for three years and hopes to become a business investor in the future.

Siafa's difficulty is the rainy season because, during this season, it can be very hard for customers to buy when it is wet. But he also gives his customers a good manner of approach and cleans his business premises in order to encourage them to always patronize his business.

Siafa needs this loan in order to increase his capital so as to improve his business. He dreams of building a house for himself and his family.

loans.use: To increase his capital so as to improve his business

loans.name: Sefululima

texts.en:
Sefululima L. is a 68-year-old woman living in the town of Laulii Maagila. She is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Sefululima owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling fried foods in the local community. Sefululima has been engaged in this business for over 1 year and earns approximately 300 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Sefululima joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sefululima is requesting a loan from SPBD for the first time. Sefululima is now requesting a loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Sefululima plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Biba

texts.fr:
Madame Biba  S. est âgée de 39 ans, mariée et mère  de 6  enfants.  Elle  vit avec son mari et ses enfants dans une famille traditionnelle avec plusieurs ménages au 1er quartier de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant vite abandonné l’école en classe de 6ème année (système éducatif Malien), elle  commença très tôt les activités génératrices de revenus en optant pour l’apprentissage du métier de teinturière,  auprès d’une de ses  belles sœurs, pendant 15 ans.  Aujourd’hui  elle jouit d’une grande expérience et notoriété. Elle maîtrise parfaitement les rouages de ce secteur d’activité. Sa réputation dépasse le cadre de Ségou.
Pour faire de la teinture, elle dilue différents produits de teintures modernes et traditionnels dans de l’eau chaude ensuite elle trempe les tissus blancs  dans cette eau pour leur donner la couleur voulue.  Les tissus teintés sont étalés sur une corde pour séchage. Ensuite elle les amène chez le couturier. Les habits une fois cousus sont  blanchis et soigneusement emballés.
Dans le dessein d’augmenter son fonds de commerce, afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices, elle a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est à son 1er prêt individuel, qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, 3 pièces de bazins. Elle s’approvisionne sur place et à Bamako auprès des grossistes. Madame Biba  S.  vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permet d’aider son mari et de participer aux événements sociaux (baptême, mariage etc.…). 
Son ambition est d’ouvrir une boutique de prêt-à-porter.
texts.en:
Ms. Biba S. is 39 years old, married, and the mother of 6 children. She lives with her husband and children in a traditional family with several households in the first district of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Soon after dropping out of school in 6th class (education system of Mali), she very soon started earning revenues by opting for an apprenticeship dyeing cloth. She learned this trade from one of her sisters-in-law 15 years ago. Today, she enjoys a lot of experience and distinction. She has an excellent command of the ins and outs of this business sector. Her reputation extends beyond Ségou. To dye cloth, she dilutes different modern and traditional dye products in hot water. Then she soaks white fabrics in this water to give them the desired color. The dyed fabrics are spread out on a rope to dry. Next, she takes them to a tailor. Once the clothing is sewn, it’s washed and carefully wrapped. With plans to increase her business capital, to realize bigger profits, she turned toward Soro Yiriwaso. She is on her first individual loan, which she intends to use to buy 3 bolts of damask cloth. She supplies herself locally and in Bamako from wholesalers. And she sells to customers composed of women and men, cash or credit accepted. With this loan, she anticipates earning a monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA. This will allow her to help her husband and to assist with societal events (baptisms, marriages, etc.) Her ambition is to open a ready-to-wear clothing store.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bolts of "rich" damask

loans.name: Sum

texts.en: Sum H., 43, is married and lives with her six children in the Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who works for less than US$1 each day, while her husband works in construction making US$4 each day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has caused food prices to skyrocket. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Sum H. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase a grinding machine.

loans.use: To purchase a grinding machine.

loans.name: Vuth

texts.en:
Mrs. Vuth M. (in the photo), 47, and her husband Mr. Mao Koy, 48, were married in 1983 and have five children: two sons and three daughters. Three of them are garment factory workers, one attends school, and the other one is still young. They live in a small village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Vuth and her husband have been fishing for more than 20 years. In addition, Mr. Mao Koy is a construction worker. He works in his village and other districts. Vuth is asking for a loan of $1,100 to buy a motorbike for her children to drive to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her children to drive to work.

loans.name: Jorge Ruben

texts.es:
Jorge es un padre de familia de 29 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y su hijo de 5 años de edad en casa de sus padres, ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de un año se dedica la transporte público en una mototaxi que logró comprar gracias al dinero de sus ahorros. Jorge trabaja en ella todos los días cubriendo rutas en Cayaltí y sus caseríos. Este negocio es la única fuente de ingreso familiar por lo que trata de esforzarse al máximo.

Debido al tiempo de uso de su vehículo y a la situación accidentada de las carreteras de la zona, la mototaxi ha empezado a sufrir algunas fallas mecánicas, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para reparar los desperfectos y otorgarle mantenimiento general.

Jorge desea seguir adelante y continuar trabajando para mantener a su familia y brindarles lo mejor. El es una persona conocida y respetada por sus vecinos y conocidos que lo consideran un padre de familia responsable y trabajador.
texts.en:
Jorge is a 29 year old father who lives with his wife and his 5 year old son in his parents' home, located in the Cayaltí district, an hour from the city Chiclayo. For over a year, he has worked in public transport in a motorcycle taxi that he managed to buy thanks to the money from his savings. Jorge works in his taxi everyday covering routes in Cayaltí and its surrounding villages. This business is the only source of family income from which he tries to stretch to its limit. Due to the time of use of his vehicle and the rough situation of the roads in the area, the motorcycle taxi has started to suffer some mechanical failures. Because of this he has seen the necessity to request for the first time from Edpyme Alternative a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to repair the damage and give it general maintenance. Jorge wants to move forward and continue working to support his family and give them the best. He is a well-known and respected person among his neighbors and acquaintances who think of him as a responsible and hardworking father.

Translated from Spanish by Elycia Mulholland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repair and maintenance expenses

loans.name: Hamasa-E One Group

texts.en:
This is Hamasa-e one group. This group is made up of three members. Sedeqa is the group leader. She is 40 years old, married, and has six children: four sons and two daughters. She wants to take a loan for her husband’s business of selling clothes from a cart. Her husband is old, so his son supports him as well. 
These three members have requested a group loan of 42,000 Afghani. Rahmatullah, who is the second member of Hamasa-e one group, has a business selling mobile cards. He supports his family members using the income from his business. His purpose in getting a loan is to expand his business. The last member is Hamasa who is a tailor. Since the Taliban regime, she has been sewing clothes because at that time they had lots of economic problems. Now with the Kiva loan, she wants to buy a new sewing machine and wants to start her business in a new way to support her husband and children.
They all would like to thank the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Rejoice

texts.en:
Rejoice A. is currently in the business of selling charcoal in the market. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. Rejoice is 40 years old and married to a peasant. She has eight children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a charcoal store.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC, a Kiva partner, started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Cecilia De

texts.es: Cecilia es una señora que está casada y vive en una casa que es propia. En la casa vive toda su familia que consta de 6 personas, ella su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, Cecilia trabaja como empleada fija en una empresa que se dedica al servicio de limpieza a empresas privadas y también a residencias particulares. Por otra parte su esposo es maestro contratista de albañilería. La competencia en sus actividades es media ya que hay otras personas  que desarrollan las mismas actividades. Pero el tiempo que ambos desarrollan sus actividades les permite contar con experiencia y sobre todo con clientela fija. El crédito será destinado como capital de trabajo del esposo para la compra de materiales de construcción  que requiere en algunas obras que efectúa como obra vendida. Esta será su sexta operación de créditos con Agrocapital, con un excelente cumplimiento de pago en todas sus otras operaciones. Los esposos son personas muy responsables y trabajan juntos para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a lady who is married and lives in a house that is her own. In the house lives her entire family that is comprised of 6 people: Cecilia, her huband and their four children, Cecilia works as a regular employee in a business that is dedicated to providing cleaning services to private enterprises and also to private residences. Her husband is a master bricklayer. There is the usual competition in their fields now that there are other people that offer the same services. But their early beginning permits them to build on their experience, above all with their regular clientele. The loan will be used as working capital for the husband for the purchase of building materials that he requires in some works that he prepares as finished goods. This will be her sixth loan cycle with Agrocapital. She has an excellent record of payment in all her other loans. The couple are very responsible people and work together to help their family get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy building materials for her husband's bricklaying business

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene D. is from the village of   Malinao ,  Gingoog City. She is 68 years old. Irene is widowed and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Irene owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Irene has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities. Irene chose to have 7000 thousand worth of loan for her 8th cycle loan.

In 2003, Irene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Irene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Irene is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Irene from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 26 years old and is married with one child who goes to school. He runs a video production shop where he edits and does video coverage. He records music and also takes videos at weddings and parties for his customers. He also has a dairy cow on his farm.

Francis was previously involved in a brick-making business before he ventured into his video business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, his video business has grown. He hopes to improve his business and provide his family with a high standard of living.

Francis has requested a loan of Kes 30,000 from Faulu Kenya to restore his brick-making business. He describes himself as hardworking and optimistic.

loans.use: To restore his brick-making business

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora  Reyna Isabel G. M., es comerciante de este mercado su tramo esta ubicado de la esquina de almacén mundo elegante  75 vrs al norte la señora vende jabones, aces, cloros, sal  tiene 20 años de vender en este mercado.
Su negocio lo inicio con poca mercadería con un capital de C$ 2,0000 fueron aporte de su hijo, tiene tres hijos que mantener por los cuales ella se esfuerza grandemente para sacarlos adelante  abre su negocio  a las siete y media de la mañana hasta las cuatro de la tarde de lunes a domingo.
La Señora G. M. tiene 3 años de trabajar con ceprodel ella se siente muy agradecida de estar trabajando con nosotros ya que ha salido adelante con su negocio
texts.en:
Reyna Isabel G. M. is a merchant in this market. Her stand is located 75 varas (a vara is approximately .8 meter) north of the corner of Almacén Mundo Elegante. She sells soaps, detergents, bleach, and salt. She has been selling in this market for 20 years. She started her business with C$ 2,0000 from her son, and she had little merchandise. She has three children to support, and she puts forth great effort to get them ahead. She opens her business at 7:30 in the morning, and she is open until 4:00 in the afternoon from Monday through Sunday. Mrs. G. M. has worked with Ceprodel for three years. She is very grateful to be working with us because she has gotten ahead with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soaps, detergents, bleaches, and salt; which is what she sells

loans.name: Yenis Goretti

texts.es:
La Sra. R. U. es una profesora  de Educación primaria en la zona rural de la ciudad del Viejo. 

Ella va a utilizar el crédito para mejorar las condiciones sanitarias de su hogar. 

Es el tercer crédito que tramita en nuestra institución cancelándolos sin ningún problema  alegando que le ha servido de mucho el financiamiento que CEPRODEL le ha brindado para hacerle mejoras poco a poco a su vivienda ya que no lo podría hacer sin los créditos adquiridos,  y  de igual manera  se los agradece profundamente.
texts.en:
La Sra. R. U. es una profesora de Educación primaria en la zona rural de la ciudad del Viejo. Ella va a utilizar el crédito para mejorar las condiciones sanitarias de su hogar. Es el tercer crédito que tramita en nuestra institución cancelándolos sin ningún problema alegando que le ha servido de mucho el financiamiento que CEPRODEL le ha brindado para hacerle mejoras poco a poco a su vivienda ya que no lo podría hacer sin los créditos adquiridos, y de igual manera se los agradece profundamente.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra e instalación de servicio sanitario con sus accesorios.

loans.name: Dolores Alejandra

texts.es: Doña Dolores Alejandra tiene 48 años, es casada y tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. Ella se dedica al negocio a la compra de mercadería en general, la cual distribuye de manera ambulante pues inicio hace 30 años, pues siempre se ha preocupado por mejorar los ingresos de su familia ella atiende a sus  clientes muy amable es así que sus clientes se sienten a gusto. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de ropa, bolsos, calzado y cosméticos.  Su meta siempre ha sido poder establecer su negocio, de tal manera que pueda vender al por mayor.
texts.en:
Doña Dolores Alejandra is 48 years old, married, and has one dependent child. She manages a business selling general merchandise as a street vendor. Dolores started this business 30 years ago and has always been concerned about improving her family’s income. She attends to her customers in a friendly manner that helps put them at ease. Dolores will invest her loan in the purchase of clothing, purses, shoes, and cosmetics. Her goal has always been to have an established business where she can sell wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing, purses, shoes, and cosmetics

loans.name: Sesa Me Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Theresa is a 50-year-old married woman with one child, age 16.  She describes herself as trustworthy.  Theresa would like to provide her child with the opportunity to obtain a university level education.  

For the past 15 years, Theresa has operated a trading business where she sells smoked fish.  She also trades in wax cloth (printed fabric) and shoes. She plans to use the loan to purchase more smoked fish.  Her future dream is to open her own shop where she can sell her products.  

Theresa is currently the leader of the 12-member trust bank group named "Sesa Me", which means “Change me” in Twi.  Twi is the language most commonly spoken in Ghana, especially in the Ashanti region.  The other group members are engaged in trades such as smoked fish seller, wax cloth seller and grocery seller. They hope to receive the loan to enable them to buy various stock to grow their businesses and provide more support to their families.

loans.use: To purchase cartons of fish

loans.name: Farooq Group

texts.en:
Rahila, the daughter of G. J., is 33 years old and married, with 4 children. She lives in Kabul, Afghanistan and is the leader of Farooq group. She wants to take out a loan for her husband, who has a clothing shop in the city of Kabul. He has been involved in this business for more than 5 years, but now he needs a loan to buy more new clothes for this season.

Rahila would like to thank all lenders from around the world and Kiva in Afghanistan.

loans.use: to buy more new clothes for her husband's shop

loans.name: Fausto Ramón

texts.es:
El señor Fausto C. es casado con una carga familiar de 5 personas, entre ellos 2 varones y dos mujeres todos en edad escolar. El es trabajador de la Alcaldía Municipal de Chichigalpa desde hace 3 años donde se desempeña como recolector de basura en el tren de aseo de la Alcaldía, cubriendo varios barrios de la ciudad.
Don Fausto trabaja con Ceprodel desde hace 2 años tiempo en el que se le han otorgado tres créditos y los cuales los ha utilizado para gastos agrícolas como alquiler de tierras y compra de insumos, ya que él es nacido y criado en una finca donde antes de laborar para la Alcaldía se dedicaba a la Agricultura.
texts.en:
Señor Fausto C. is married and is responsible for a family of five including two boys and two girls of school age. For the last three years he has worked for the Chichigalpa municipal government as a garbage collector, covering various neighborhoods of the city. Señor Fausto C. has worked with Kiva field partner, Ceprodel, for the last two years, during which time they have given him three loans that he has used to pay farming expenses such as renting land and buying supplies. He was born and brought up on a farm where he worked as a farmer before his current job with the municipal government.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay farming expenses including land rental and purchasing supplies

loans.name: Thary

texts.en:
Mrs. Thary N. and her husband, Mr. Heng Siv, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1986 and have four children.

Thary has been selling fruit (water melons, apples, oranges, etc.) for two years. She buys them in Phnom Penh for resale at the village market. Her husband, Mr. Heng Siv, has been a village doctor since 1984.

Thary does not have enough capital to purchase more fruit for resale so she is requesting a loan of $1,000 to help her capital.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena S. is from the village of Tinabalan, Gingoog City. She is 44 years old, married and has 5 school-aged children. Elena owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Elena has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8,500 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Elena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Elena is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Elena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital

loans.name: Deggo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité DEGGO est né le 20 décembre 2010. Il est composé de 12 femmes issues du même village. Les membres ont décidé de se regrouper au sein du même groupe parce qu’elles habitent le même quartier et ont des affinités. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageoise de KOUNOUNE AIR FRANCE

Madame Amy P., debout à droite de la photo, avec un foulard autour de la taille, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 37 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants.

Elle est détentrice d’une boutique où elle vend du riz, de l’huile végétale des condiments pour cuisine etc. 

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de renflouer sa boutique en marchandises afin d’accroître son activité et réaliser plus de bénéfices. 

Son objectif est de participer au bien-être de ses enfants et de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
The DEGGO solidarity group was created on the 20th December 2010. It is made up of 12 women from the same village. The group's members decided to unite because of their proximity and similar interests. They are members of the Kounoune Air France credit association. Madame Amy P., standing at the right of the picture with a scarf around her waist, is the group leader. She is a 37 year old married mother of four. She owns a shop, selling rice, vegetable oil and cooking condiments. The new loan will enable her to restock her shop with goods in order to generate higher revenues. Her aim is to improve her children's living conditions and help her husband with family duties.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing rice, vegetable oil and cooking condiments

loans.name: Mille Manuela

texts.es:
Mille de 48 años, vive en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil), ella tiene unos departamento que los alquila para cubrir con los gastos familiares. 

Para ayudarle al esposo con los gastos familiares ella comenzó a trabajar y ahorrar dinero para construir unos departamento y alquilarlos, poco a poco con ayuda de su esposo pudo tener sus departamento, ahora ella administra los departamento. Esto le ha ayudado a tener tiempo con su familia y asegurar la estabilidad económica de su hija.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento y pinturas para readecuar los departamento, en el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Mille, 48, lives in Primavera de Duran (an area now on the outskirts of the city, whose natural ecology is fast disappearing.) She has some apartments that she rents to cover the household expenses. To help her husband with the household expenses she began to work and save money to build some apartments and rent them. Gradually, with the help of her husband, she was able to have her apartments. Now she manages the apartments. This has helped her to have time with her family and assure the economic stability of her daughter. With the loan she wants to buy cement and paint to recondition the apartments. In the future she wants to finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cement and paint

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La Señora María Elena es socia del Banco Comunal “Mataro Chico”  ubicado en la provincia de Azángaro y departamento de Puno, tiene 24 años de edad, de estado civil  conviviente y tiene 01 hijo,  la señora estudió educación secundaria (completo).

La señora María Elena esta trabajando con Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 4 meses,  nos cuenta que con el préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar el capital de  su negocio de venta de productos lácteos.

En la actualidad la señora solicitará un nuevo  crédito S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le servirá para comprar insumos para la elaboración de sus productos.

Su sueño para el futuro  es mejorar su negocio y ser mayorista.
 
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones, la puntualidad y la facilidad de los préstamos.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is a member of the community bank named "Mataro Chico", located in the province of Azangaro in Puno. She is 24 years old and she lives with her boyfriend and together they have a son. She graduated high school. Maria Elena has been with the Manuela Ramos Movement (Kiva Field Partner) for the past 4 months. The first loan was in the amount of 500 nuevos soles and she used it to supplement the working capital for her dairy business. She requests a new loan in the amount of 800 nuevos soles, funds that will be used to purchase ingredients to make her products. In the future she hopes to improve her business and become a wholesaler. What she most enjoys about the community bank meetings is the meetings, the scheduling and the loan conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make dairy products.

loans.name: Kakajjo Development Group-Mukono

texts.en: Her 10-year-old boutique or clothing business began with a combination of variables: her savings from her fried food sales and then persuasion from her mum. This is the story of a certain 33-year-old enterprising businesswoman who goes by the name of Ziwa Roy N.. Roy describes herself as friendly and hard working and in a sense, that is what has been working in her favor. In her boutique, she sells a variety of designer clothes and pairs of shoes. In a week, she makes profits that are equal to 100,000 shillings. With this loan that she is requesting, she wants to buy more clothes and pairs of shoes to resell.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to resell

loans.name: Araba Eshun Florence

texts.en: Araba Eshun Florence A. is married to a secretary and has seven dependents. She has not been to school. She sells smoked fish at Elmina. Araba helps her husband by making sure that there is always food available. She will use the loan to purchase more fish to smoke for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Araba plans to save to further her children’s education.

loans.use: purchase more fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose G. is currently in the business of selling onions, groundnuts and cooking oil and is requesting a loan to stock more jerry cans of cooking oil to sell. Rose is 40 years old and is married with a husband who is an NGO staff member. She has three children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To stock more jerry cans of cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Josephina

texts.en:
Josephina S. lives in the village of Dalacon. She is 41 years old, married and has three school-aged children. She makes a living as a farmer, growing and harvesting fruit trees. She has been in this business for more than 10 years and earns about 3,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2006, Josephina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid nine previous loans from PMPC after using them to buy items she needed such as fertilizer.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to improve her family's living conditions.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to expand her farm

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
This is Virginia M., 58, resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Ricardo M., a farmer. Together they work hard to be able to provide their family with finances for their everyday expenses.

Virginia operates a fruit and vegetable stand. She buys seasonal fruits that are native to the Philippines like pineapples, which are grown mostly in the south region of Luzon. She also sells green and ripe mangoes, melons, watermelons, and other Filipino fruit staples. Also in her product inventory are garlic and onions, tomatoes, and other staples for simple cooking recipes. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of fruit and vegetables to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Virginia hopes to have her house renovated by the end of the year. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of fruit and vegetables to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Heide

texts.en:
Heide A. is 45 years old, married and supports her family by operating one business venture: a spice and vegetable selling business. She lives in 4th Street, Brgy. Progreso, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her spice and vegetable selling business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,500. 

Heide is now borrowing PHP 19,500 so that she can continue to purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom.  Heide aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital to buy vegetables and spices to sell

loans.name: Esther Gathoni

texts.en:
Esther is 29 years married to Gabriel Macharia who contributes to the family income. They have two children. She has been knitting for about 10 years now with an income of Kshs. 7,000 per month.

This is her first loan from  KADET LTD and she plans to use it to buy more knitting thread and a new machine. She hopes to open more knitting shops in the area and to manage a wholesale shop . She also hopes to improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy more knitting thread and a new machine.

loans.name: God’S Help Group

texts.en:
Freeman B., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'God’s Help'.  He is 54 years old, married, and has six children who are between the ages of 31 and 18 years. He was only able to attend school through 10th grade due to financial constraints. 

For 6 years, he has been selling charcoal in Neezoe Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 6,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 32,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more bags of charcoal. He describes himself as a friendly man whose goal is to improve his business.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Famatta is inset at lower right because S. was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Robiya

texts.ru: Рачабова Робия жительница Яванского района. Ей 44 года. Замужем, имеет троих детей. Муж, шафер. Сын зарабатывает строительными работами по найму. Сама Робия имеет среднее образование. Более 5 лет занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Кредит берет для закупа скота. Она в основном закупает скот в дальнейшем для перепродажи.
texts.en: Robiya R., 44, lives in Yavan with her three children and her husband who works as a driver. Her son works as a freelance constructoin worker. Robiya has secondary education. For the past five years she has worked in animal husbandry. She is applying for a loan in order to buy livestock that she is planning to resell later.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn S. is 48 years old, married and supports her family by selling nipa, a type of palm leaf which is used in homes and in making items such as baskets. She lives in Prk. Orcaides, Brgy. Vista Alegre, Ilog, Negros Occidental, where she has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004. She has used her membership to improve her family's living conditions through hard work and by making good use of loans from NWTF. Evelyn is slowly succeeding in making her family more economically stable, and now earns 1,000 PHP a month. She is applying for a new loan, her 12th, for PHP 29,500 to buy more nipa to sell to her customers.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its poverty alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To buy more nipa to sell to her customers

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth H. V. es vecina de  Canalete de Alajuela, ella es una mujer   emprendedora dueña de  “Creaciones Mely”, un negocio de Confección de Ropa.
 Ella se ha dedicado toda su vida a la Costuraría, sin embargo hasta hace poco pudo independizarse y crear su propio negocio. Es por esa razón  que ella necesita un préstamo de ₡500000 (Quinientos  mil colones) para la compra de materiales y diferentes tipos de telas para su trabajo.  Ella quiere dar una mayor variedad de servicios, para que su negocio siga creciendo. Una de sus metas principales es ir renovando su equipo de trabajo.
Ella es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Elizabeth H. V. is a resident of Canalete de Alajuela, she is an enterprising woman and owner of “Creaciones Mely”, a dressmaking business.
 She has spent all her life as a seamstress, however it was not until recently that she was able to become independent and start up her own business. This is why she needs a loan for ₡500000 (Five hundred thousand colones) in order to purchase materials and different types of fabrics for her work.  She wants to offer a wider variety of services, so that her business continues to grow. One of her main objectives is to update her work equipment.
She is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: Buy materials and fabrics

loans.name: San Juana

texts.es: La Sra. San Juanita, es una señora que le gusta mucho estar siempre al tanto de su casa, ella a avanzando cada vez mas en el mejoramiento de su vivienda, y ahora su deseo es  instalar protecciones a su domicilio, ya que ahí vive con su hija y una nieta, su miedo es que cuando ella este ocupada, la nieta salga al patio que da a la calle y como pasan muchos automóviles por esa calle ya que es muy transitada ella teme que puedan atropellar a su nieta, por este  motivo esta utilizando este crédito para poner la protección del frente de la casa que además de proteger a su familia protegerá la vivienda y cuando ellas decidan salir fuera saldrán sin preocupación.
texts.en:
San Juanita is a woman who enjoys watching after her house very much.  She has progressed a little more each time with home improvement and her wish now is to install security devices on her home because she lives there with her daughter and granddaughter.  

Her fear is that when she’s busy her granddaughter might go out into the yard that leads to the street and, because many cars go by on that street because it has a lot of traffic, she fears her granddaughter could be run over.  

Because of this she is using this loan to install protective devices on the front of the house which, besides protecting the family, will also make it possible for them to leave the house unattended worry free.

loans.use: To install security devices on her house.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine M. is 34 years old, married, and has five children. Christine is requesting her first loan from Kiva partner Vision Finance Company. She needs the loan to purchase more clothing to sell at her market stall. She has been in business for four years and has two employee in her shop. With her additional profits, Christine will buy a plot of land, build her own house, pay school fees for her children, and save for the future.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 31-year-old single man living with his parents and one sibling. He is from Lebanon. He has worked as freelance textiles trader since 2003. He has worked in this domain for 10 years.  He sells his products to various clothing factories and tailoring shops. As per the majority of the Lebanese guys, he helps his family with the household.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional textiles in order to increase his sales and his income. He has high hopes for the future of his business and looks forward to open his own clothing store.

loans.use: to purchase additional textiles

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She is also a very caring mother who is bringing up her children very well. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah because her son wants to improve his mobile phone selling business. He has a shop in the market where he sells new and used mobile phones and mobile phone accessories. Through his shop, he offers mobile phones in different price ranges, which helps him target every kind of client. With the loan, he will buy mobile phones and mobile accessories to put in his shop to sell and earn good profits. He has been doing this business for the past six years and Shahnaz is hopeful that a loan will help him do his business better. She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application to Asasah.  

Shahnaz lives in Kasur, which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan known for its leather industry. She has been living there in a small two-room home in the area of Pakka Qilah for the past 10 years. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shahnaz.

loans.use: To buy mobile phones and mobile accessories to sell

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en: Hilda, a 38-year-old married mother of six children, operates a business selling seaweed. Her husband is a seaweed farmer, so she sells his harvest and  also buys from other farmers. In this business for two years, Hilda earns about 4000 PHP per month. She is now requesting a loan of 6000 to buy more seaweed to resell.  In the future, she wants her business to be stable.

loans.use: to buy more seaweed to resell.

loans.name: Leonille

texts.en:
Leonille is 56 years old. She has three children, the youngest of whom is 13 years old. The eldest finished high school and the youngest is currently in school. The other was not able to continue school. 

Leonille sells banana juice and sorghum, working with her husband. She has operated this business since 1975. She is requesting a loan to buy more banana juice and sorghum in order to make more profits. She plans to reinvest the profits in her business.

loans.use: to buy banana juice.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a married woman with a 26-year-old child. She is engaged in farming and hog-raising businesses. She helps her husband grow rice and corn. They own a cow that is very useful in tilling the land. While her husband mainly manages the farm, she focuses on keeping her piggery clean and the pigs healthy. Rosemarie earns about 5000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month. 

This loan will be used to purchase piglets and feed. In the future, she hopes to be rich and expand her business and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Las Malvinas Group

texts.es: La Sra. Susana  es casada, tiene 3 hijos, actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Las Malvinas” grupo  conformado por 13  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades D. comercio. Susana   trabaja desD. hace 8 años en la venta D. comida este trabajo  surge a raíz D. que a su esposo ganaba sueldo mínimo y no podía cubrir los  gastos básicos,  alimentación,  educación y pago D. servicios,  es así que Susana   pone su puesto D. comida, hoy en día tiene muchos clientes y eso le genera buena ganancia y también desD. hace tres años Susana junto a su esposo se dedican a la venta D. zapato y prendas D. vestir,  y las prendas y zapatos los venD. en provincia. Susana  trabajo muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia,  gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado mejores ingresos económicos , sus hijos van a colegios privado,  y sobre todo  su familia tiene una mejor calidad D. vida  ,  con el fin D. seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercadería prendas D. vestir y zapatos . Sabemos que Susana cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos D. Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Susana is married and has three children.  She is a member of the “Las Malvinas” communal bank which has 13 members dedicated to various commercial activities.

Susana has worked for 8 years selling food.  This business arose because her husband earned minimum wage and it was not enough to cover basic needs, food, schooling and utility payments.  Therefore, Susana set up her food stand and today she has many customers which generate good profits.  Three years ago she and her husband also started selling articles of clothing and shoes.  They sell these out in the countrysiD..  

Susana worked very hard to move her family ahead and thanks to her effort and dedication she’s attained improved income; her children attend private schools and, above all, the family has a better quality of life.

With the thought in mind of continuing to grow she has asked for a new loan to buy clothing and shoes.  We know that Susana will meet her goals with much work and effort and that Edaprospo loans will help her.

loans.use: to buy articles of clothing (clothes and shoes).

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with four children.  All of them go to school. She doesn't take care of  additional family members.  She sells vegetables at the market and works seven days a week.  She has been in the business for the last six years.

She has requested a loan of 500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more baskets of tomatoes and onions.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation of boxes of tomatoes from the villages.  Margaret aspires to grow vegetables herself.  She resides in a rented house and does not have access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира проживает в Кулябском районе. Она замужем. У неё один ребёнок. Она имеет среднее образование. Более 5 лет Замира занимается шитьём женских национальных платьев. Она берет кредит для покупки разных видом тканей, чтобы сшить и продать их.
texts.en: Zamira lives in the region of Kulob. She is married and has one child. She has secondary education. Zamira has been sewing traditional national women's dresses for more than five years. She is taking out the loan to buy different kinds of fabrics to make and sell dresses.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of fabrics

loans.name: Esther Group

texts.es:
El grupo Esther está integrado por tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras. La coordinadora del grupo Arelis de los Ángeles quien vende cosméticos y ropa desde hace cuatro años. Ella vende aproximadamente 3,300 cordobas semanal.

Las otras integrantes son María Esperanza quien realiza enchiladas y tajaditas y Walter José tiene un taller artesanal de calzado.
texts.en:
The “Esther” group is composed of three hard working, enterprising people.  Arelis de los Ángeles who has sold Cosmetics and clothes for the last four years is the group coordinator.  She sells about 3300 cordobas worth weekly.

The other members are María Esperanza, who sells enchiladas and ‘tajaditas’ (fried plantain) and Walter José who has an artisanal shoe shop.

loans.use: to buy clothes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 55 years old and is married with three children, all of whom live separately from her. Her occupation is selling different types of bread in the local market of her city, Calca. Delia wakes up early each morning to make her bread fresh daily at a local place where she rents an oven. 

She is asking for a $1,200 loan mainly to help pay for the rent on her oven but also to buy ingredients such as wheat, flour, and sugar. Delia is a hardworking woman and is committed to making the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to pay for the rent on her oven and to buy ingredients such as wheat, flour, and sugar to make bread

loans.name: Atagai

texts.en:
Atagai, age 24, provides dressmaking services to local community members. She has one year of experience in this business. 

Atagai needs a loan in the amount of WST $1,000 to purchase a new sewing machine. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve and expand the business.

Atagai and her husband have one child.

Atagai joined SPBD earlier this year in order to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Atagai's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy groceries for a grocery store business

loans.name: Orilla Del Itata Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal se llama “Orilla del Itata” lo conforman 17 emprendedoras que se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran preparación de comida rápida, artesanía en madera y greda, preparación de tortillas, venta de ropa usada y nueva en una feria libre y repostería. Todas ellas pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chillán.
Ruth integrante del banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en el segundo puesto de derecha a izquierda, vistiendo una chaqueta color café, quien además tiene su pulgar hacia arriba. Se dedica a confeccionar disfraces desde hace 3 años. Comenzó con 20 disfraces ya hora cuenta con 200 disfraces. Ella compra géneros y moldes para luego confeccionar, arrendar o vender.
Durante los meses comprendidos de agosto a diciembre se dedica a confeccionar disfraces, ya que durante el resto de los meses los pedidos tienden a disminuir. Por lo que se dedica a reparar ropa y realizar algunas costuras de manera particular.
Ruth trabaja desde su misma casa, ahí confecciona y vende. Además comenta que cuenta con hartos clientes, sobre todo adolescentes.
Su mercadería la compra en las ciudades de Concepción y Santiago. 
Con el crédito comprará géneros, broderi, telas, cintas, cierres, adornos, tul y raso. 
Sus metas son tener un local establecido en el cual pueda vender sus disfraces, cotillón para fiestas. Además le gustaría comprar una máquina de coser overlock, ya que por ahora solo cuenta con una máquina de coser costura recta. 
Ruth vive junto a su madre, sus 4 hijos de 21, 19, 11 y 8 años de edad y un nieto de 2 años. 
Sus sueños a nivel personal son estudiar diseño de vestuario y especializarse en la confección de vestidos de novia. 
Sus motivaciones de continuar con el negocio se deben a que Ruth es el único ingreso económico familiar, además le ha permitido tener una flexibilidad horaria, para criar a sus hijos. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de los servicios otorgados por Fondo esperanza, ya que ha podido invertir en su negocio. Comenta que conoce hace bastante tiempo a los demás integrantes del grupo del banco comunal y que tienen una muy buena relación y compromiso entre ellos. 
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Orilla del Itata” (Shore of the Itata) and it has 17 members who are involved in a variety of lines of work among which are: fast food making, wood and clay crafts, tortilla making, used and new clothes sales in a free market and pastry making.  All of them are from the city of Chillán.

Ruth is a member of the communal bank.  In the photo she’s seated in the second spot from right to left wearing a brown jacket and pointing her thumb up.  She has been making costumes for the last three years.  She started out with 20 costumes and now she has 200.  She buys patterns and designs to make them and then rent or sell them.

During the months between August and December she makes costumes because the other months orders tend to decrease so then she works doing clothing repairs and making some individual articles of clothing.  Ruth works at home; she sews and sells there.  She also comments that she has many customers especially teenagers.  She buys her merchandise in the cities of Concepción and Santiago.

She will use the loan to buy patterns, lace, fabric, ribbon, zippers, decorations, tulle and satin.  Her goals are to have an established locale where she can sell her costumes and party supplies.  Besides, she’d like to buy an overlock sewing machine because she currently only has a straight stitch sewing machine.
