With hard work and a lot of effort, he has succeeded in expanding his business. This is also thanks to daily improvement in the quality of the service and products that he offers his clients. 

Shahbaz's son is his motivation for continuing to improve and expand his business. To meet the current demand of his clients, Shahbaz is requesting a loan of 1606 AZN. With your help, Shahbaz will improve the quality of the service he offers his clients and will continue to expand his business. He appreciates the opportunity that your support offers him.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Kojoki

texts.en:
Kojoki B. is currently in the business of selling sugar, rice and soap in a shop, and is requesting a loan to purchase other items such as paraffin, bags of beans, etc. to sell.  Kojoki is 28 years old and is married to an accountant. She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a larger store.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase paraffin, bags of beans, etc. to sell

loans.name: Cresing

texts.en:
Cresing A. is from the village of Villanueva. She is 51 years old. Cresing is married and has 6 children. To make a living, Cresing owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling clothing & shoes in the local community. Cresing has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Cresing joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cresing is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Cresing from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly composed of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Davaa

texts.en: Davaa is 49 years old and lives with her husband and 21 year old daughter in the Arkhangai province of Mongolia. She and her family live in a Mongolian traditional nomadic tent called a “ger”. Her daughter attends university, her husband is retired and Davaa runs a household goods retail business out of a rented stall in the local market. She started her business in 2005 with working capital of 60,000 tugrugs. Since then, her working capital has reached 350,000 tugrugs and she has become established in the business community. Davaa says, “I am working hard to feed my family.” She is requesting a 400,000 tugrug to purchase products to sell in her business.

loans.use: To purchase products.

loans.name: Rosalinda Lugod's Group

texts.en:
Rosalinda L. is from the village of Brgy. Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 43 years old. Rosalinda is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Rosalinda is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalinda owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rosalinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase piglets to raise & sell in the future. Rosalinda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Rosalinda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Marlina

texts.en:
Marlina Y. is from the village of Batangan , Valencia City. She is 34 years old. Marlina is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Marlina owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Marlina is just starting this business.

In 2009, Marlina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marlina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Marlina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Mujeres Rumbo Al Progreso Group

texts.es:
El Señor Nolasco siempre trabajo como personal D. limpieza en diferentes empresas lamentablemente el sueldo que percibía era mínimo y no le alcanzaba para el sustento D. su familia es por  ello que deciD. invertir sus ahorros implementando una bodega  en su propia casa empezó vendiendo golosinas y algunas pocas cosas, a pesar D. la competencia  le va bien en su negocio, trata D.  mantenerlo surtido para que sus clientes siempre encuentren lo necesario, en la bodega trabaja el y su esposa ella lo ayuda las veces que el se ausenta ya que sigue dedicándose al servicio D. limpieza 3 veces por semana en forma independiente. Con sus  ingresos  ha podido comprar una exhibidora y una congeladora que es indispensable para mejorar su negocio,  también pueD. ayudar a su hijo en sus estudios.
Para  el futuro el Señor Nolasco quiere buscar un local adecuado para poner una bodega más granD. en un lugar estratégico,por otro lado pertenecer al grupo" MUJERES RUMBO AL PROGRESO" le ha servido D. mucho en sus proyectos es el unico hombre y se siente feliz dentro del grupo, en esta ocasión su préstamo lo usara para comprar alimentos para aves D. corral, incursionara en esto por que la mayoría D. sus vecinos se dedican a la crianza  D. aves  y le piden mucho este producto. El esta feliz por que en EDAPROSPO ha encontrado apoyo para lograr sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Señor Nolasco always worked providing cleaning services for various companies. Unfortunately the salary that he was earning was minimal, and was not sufficient to support his family. For this reason he decided to invest his savings to start up a store in his home where he started selling sweets and other small items. In spite of the competition, his business is doing well. He tries to keep it well-stocked so that his customers can always find what they need. He works in the store and his wife helps him at times when he is absent, because he is also continuing to work independently as a cleaner 3 times a week. With his income he has been able to buy a display case and a freezer which he needed to improve his business, and he also helps his son pay for his studies. For the future, Señor Nolasco wants to look for an appropriate site where he could have a bigger store in a strategic location. He belongs to the communal bank "Mujeres Rumo al Progreso," and it has helped him a lot with his projects. He is the only man, and he is happy to be a part of the group. On this occasion he will use his loan to buy food for poultry, venturing into this area because the majority of his neighbors raise poultry, and they get a good price for this product. He is pleased that EDAPROSPO has supported him in achieving his goals.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy poultry feed

loans.name: Cable Workers Group, Lugazi

texts.en: K. Godfrey, at the top left, also appears in the group photo and he is the leader of his lending group in Lugazi. He is a hardworking and devoted married man with three children aged 11, 7 and 1 1/2 years old. They are all in the primary section. He takes care of other dependants. Godfrey has been selling spare parts from Lugazi for 10 years and although he is able to make 150,000/= profit weekly, he is affected by the transport costs to Kampala where he buys his stock. This why loans help him to buy in bulk. Therefore he does not have to move all the time. He hopes to continue working hard so that he can offer a good education to his children and he believes this will be possible if he has a steady supply of goods in his shop. Godfrey needs a loan to be able to buy more spare parts for resale.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
Nicolas tiene 52 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y tres hijos en el distrito de Santa Rosa, un distrito cuya principal actividad es la pesca y que se encuentra ubicado a 25 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la pesca desde que era muy joven, trabaja en embarcaciones que efectuan extracciones indutriales de anchoveta (pescado que se extrae en abundancia del litoral) y, cuando no trabaja en este rubro, tambien trabaja en pesca artesanal, el pescado que logra extraer lo vende en el muelle del distrito. El depende de estas actividades para solventar los gastos familiares por lo que siempre se esfuerza por trabajar lo mas arduamente posible.

Nicolas ha acudido a Edpyme Alternativa para solicitar un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles que necesita para realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda, ya que la brisa marina esta llenando de salitre sus paredes y estas necesitan de mantenimiento para que no se dañen las estructuras.

El es un padre muy responsable y entregado a su familia. Sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una persona de confianza. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser un cliente responsable y puntual al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Nicolas is 52 years old, is married and lives with his wife and three children in the district of Santa Rosa, a district whose principle activity is fishing and which is located 25 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, He has been dedicated to fishing since he was young. He works on vessels that are engaged in the commercial fishing of anchovy (a fish that is found in abundance on the coast) and, when not working at this, he also works in fishing on his own: The fish that he catches is sold at the district's wharf. He is dependent on these activities to pay for the family's expenses and so he always strives to work as hard as possible. Nicolas has approached Edpyme Alternativa to solicit a loan of 1500 new soles, which he needs to makes some improvements to his home since the sea breeze fills his walls with salt and they need maintenance so that it doesn't damage the structure. He is a very responsible father, dedicated to his family. His neighbors and acquaintances consider him to be a trustworthy person. He has already worked previously with our institution and has proved to be a responsible client who is punctual at payment time.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expenses for maintenance and repairs to his home.

loans.name: Grupo De Mujeres El Quetzal Group

texts.es:
Este grupo D. personas residen en Prados El Quetzal, San Antonio, Suchitepéquez, y solicitaron un  
crédito en L. Asociación ASDIR, con el cual cada una inició con una venta, los cuales son venta D. productos D. belleza, venta D. frutas, venta D. aguas, venta D. pollos, el cual lo comercializan en diferentes puntostanto en el municipio D. San Antonio como también en los municipios aledaños. Con estas ventas que realizan se ha visto L. superación que han tenido estas familias ya que el ingreso que ellas obtienen se ha conbertido  en una base fuerte que contribuye al mejoramiento económico del hogar y al mismo tiempo al logro D. los sueños para sus hijos.
texts.en:
The members of this group live in Prados El Quetzal, San Antonio, Suchitepéquez. They took out a loan with ASDIR which each of them invested in a sales business. The businesses incluD. sales of beauty products, fruit, soft drinks, and chickens. The sales are maD. at different places in the town of San Antonio and the neighboring towns. With their businesses, these families have seen improvements in their lives. Their earnings have improved the economic conditions of their homes and, at the same time, are fulfilling their dreams for their children.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty products, fruit, soft drinks, and chickens for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable cellphone cards to sell

loans.name: Elcie

texts.es:
Elcie H. M., tiene la edad de 44 años, está casada, y vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 20 y  15 años de edad, que son su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Doña Elcie también trabaja desde hace muchos años en la agricultura. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora. 
About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Elcie H. M. is 44 years old, married, and lives with her husband and two children (ages 20 and 15). Her loan will be used for attending to her farm, specifically for growing coffee. She plans to buy compost and fertilizers so that she can adequately maintain her coffee crop in order to obtain better quality and the best price when it is time to harvest. This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR and she is very happy with the services that have been provided.

Doña Elcie has been farming for many years. She hopes to provide a better quality of life and greater financial stability for her family. In addition, she wants to continue growing as a person and as a producer.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost & fertilizers for her coffee crop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase larger quantities of fresh fruit to make juices and snacks

loans.name: Leang

texts.en:
Leang L. is a 56-year-old widowed mother. She has six children, two of whom are now married and the other four of whom are single. She lives with other family members in her own small family home in Kompong Tom province.
Leang L. owns a piece of land that she inherited from her parents. She grows different kinds of crop on her land, such as cabbages, cucumbers, and potatoes, which she sells to buyers every two or three months when the plants mature. She has many partners in her teenage children who grow the crops with her. Leang L. will be using this loan as capital to grow potato crops.

loans.use: To grow potato crops

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a hardworking farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. She is 40 years old and married with ten children between the ages of 2 and 15. Five of the children are currently attending school.

She has been practicing mixed farming for over 10 years and her main product is milk which she sells to the local market. She is also a cash crop farmer and sells her tea to the local market. Her major challenges in this business are a lack of enough food for the dairy cows and insufficient water since there is no piped water and they have to rely on water from the river which is very far away.

Mary has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 45,000 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. With the income from the sale of milk, she will be able to provide food for her family and pay school fees for her children.

She would like to have five dairy cows in the next five years. She would also like to be assisted in sourcing for good quality dairy cows.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Suy's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Suy S. is the group leader of a four member group loan located in Preaek Traeng village in Kandal province. They will all use their portion of the loan in different ways to improve their businesses. 


Mr.  Suy S. is 46 years old. He is a laborer while his wife, Mrs. Sophors Sun, is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. Through this activity, the couple supports seven children. One of their children is a seamstress in a garment factory; another is a jewelry maker; four are attending the local public school, and the youngest one is three years old. Although all the members try to work hard, they can only earn a small amount of money. To improve the family's living conditions, Mr. Suy S. is asking for a loan to buy coffee and fruit to start a new business reselling these goods.

loans.use: To buy coffee and fruit for resale
